description:
$37 (after tax and tip) per person, but it's totally worth it.

Considering it was all you can eat, I was expecting it to be lower quality meat, but it far exceeded my expectations. They had more options than other hotpot places, and I felt like everything was super fresh and high quality as well.

Our favorite meats were the Kobe Beef and lamb. The shrimp mix is great if you like seafood. The corn and spinach were both very fresh and tasty as well.

Overall totally recommend it, food is great, service is great, you'll leave stuffed.

One downside is it's a long wait, but you can join their waitlist on Yelp to shorten the wait from 1hour+ to like 30min. It's so worth the wait, though.
author: Matthew P.

description:
IMHO

This was my first visit to any hot point joint and I was excited!  We were invited guests to a cousin's birthday dinner so I was blissfully unaware of the $27.99 pp price.  You have two hours for all-you-can-eat!

Long story short, if you like cooking your own food in 3-4 varieties of hot broth, by throwing in thinly sliced cuts of meats, noodles, veggies, tofu, shrimp, octopus, mussels, etc., then this is the place for you.  

Service is friendly and fast.  Tip:  Eat slowly and savor your food.  Two hours is a long time when dining.  It's a great place for a celebration or a quiet romantic date.

This is a popular place.  Expect to wait unless you arrive when they open.
author: Sue S.

description:
Boiling Hot Pot serves, you guessed it, Boiling Hot Pot. Be seated, order ayce via an ipad at the table and feast away. Meats, seafoods, vegetables, tofu, so on and so forth are just some of the many options you can unlimitedly choose from. 

What's unique about this hot pot place is the ability to have 4 types of broths at once. I ended up using only two but if you like variety in your broths, then this'll be great. For ayce, it's pretty standard pricing. 

That's all I have to say. Eat good food. Enjoy life.
author: Derek T.

description:
Wow! The hot pot, amazing and the broths very solid! The wait is unbelievably long but you can get in line on Yelp when you are 3 miles out. The meat on their menu is decent quality, my favorites were the "Kobe" beef and the signature beef. Both really good and quick to eat (my favorite). They have all the other typical hot pot options like lamb, chicken, etc and some more unique ones for Asian folks.

They have a good selection of other options beyond meat too with some veggies and mushrooms. The sauce bar is also stocked with everything you need from hot sauces to peanut sauce. A must visit! The AYCE for 28 is awesome deal (when you honestly spend that much at a normal resturant).
author: Taylor Z.

description:
Aight here's the run down.

This place is the real deal. Been to many AYCE hot pot affairs, and not many comes close to this. You pay $28 and you get a choice of 5 different broths in one pot, in addition to AYCE kobe beef? Sign me up everyday bruh. 

It's also a pretty convenient method of ordering too. Order straight from an iPad at your leisure, which results in less time trying to waive down a waiter, which is great. 

Parking can be problematic as it is a popular area for Asian food. But hunt around enough, I'm sure you'll run into something.
author: Quang H.

description:
Such a nice hot pot spot in the Richmond.

Food: The meats were so fresh, and all the sides, from the mushrooms to the veggies, were fresh and yummy. The circular hot pots have 4 compartments, each with a different flavoring, from regular broth to spicey broth. The sauces were another highlight: they have a bar with all the "go-to" hot pot sauces + vinegar / sesame oil / cilantro / chopped garlic / green onion.

Service: Fast, and you can keep adding to your order through the computer screens provided at each table.

Atmosphere: Modern and quite clean. They have 2 round tables in the front, with rows of 4-seater booths down the sides. They have another room in the back with more 4-seater boots.

Location: Off Geary street. There is generally parking within the neighboring blocks. Also a few blocks away from some dessert spots.
author: Michelle B.

description:
I LOVEEEE THIS PLACE!!!!

This is one of the best hot pot place I have ever been to. They have good selection of meat, veggies, seafood, and misc items for AYCE. My favorite part is the soup base. I am typically an indecisive person so being able to get 4 different soup broth is a huge plus for me! And who can forget about the sauce bar...Yum!

I always leave feeling full and satisfied. They have these ipads for you to order from so you don't have to flag down a waiter everytime you need something.
author: Kelly C.

description:
Does not take American Express :( 

Everything was super automated! Joined waitlist on the Yelp app and got to the restaurant at the suggested time, but due to the popularity of this place, it took us another hour and a half to be seated. Was it worth the wait? Hmm, I'm not too sure. Boiling Hot Pot wasn't mind blowing, but definitely good! 

What's special about this place is that you can order FOUR soup bases! That's definitely not standard and if you like to try a lot of flavors, this is an awesome spread! 

iPad menus at every table. After you pick your soup broths and initial selection of ingredients, your screen locks for five minutes before your next order. 

We found the meat to be a bit disappointing - will only order the house special from now on. Vegetables were fresh and good, as were the frozen foods such as tofu and bean curd.
author: Shirley C.

description:
This place is awesome! One of the best hot pots I went to. AYCE for $28 and extra $10 for AYCD.

I love that you can get 4 different soup bases. I had spicy, miso, pork, and mushroom... mushroom was my least favorite (but it was also the smallest). 

The portions here are small, which is actually great because then you can try a greater variety of things. Also, you order on the ipad and the waiters bring the food to your table. There is a 5 min waiting period between orders, so make sure you double check before you submit!

ALSO - SAUCE STATION!!! One thing I hate about little sheep is you have to pay extra for all your sauces, but here they are unlimited and freeee!!!! 

The service here is also great. They're super nice. Will come back always!
author: Angela L.

description:
Come back with group of 5. Always love this hot pot place.make ensure u get the all u can eat and drink combo, best value. 

Unlike some other AYCE, their quality of food is amazing and lot of variety for beer!! Also I like their sauce bar and I can make up some of the weird combo.
author: John C.

description: Hurray for free parking on any Sunday in San Francisco. You order on the iPad connected to your table. You can order four items at the time and wait for five minutes before you can make the next order. My favorite is the Kobe beef and lamb. If you don't like meats, they have seafood and veggies options. You also get to chose up to five types of broth all at once. Staff are mostly attentive and constantly check on you to ensure that your needs are met. This restaurant is worth a visit if you are in the area.
author: Desiree N.

description:
Food is really good here. They have many different broths and you can choose 4 broths which is pretty cool. I have been to many different hot pot places, and I can safely say this is one of my favourite in SF. 

The only thing you need to consider is that it's a very small restaurant so there will be a wait. Came here a few times and there is always a line. So be ready for that.

Will be back again.
author: Shanzay H.

description: Best hot pot in the city! Cheaper than the little sheep but the quality is not bad! And the service is always good!
author: Rebecca H.

description:
Celebrated my birthday dinner here this year with my colleagues. Arrived around 6pm on a weekday, we were seated in a booth in the front of the restaurant. Given it's hot pot, the windows were foggy and it was humid inside the restaurant. Booth was a bit dirty and run down and I didn't feel comfortable throughout the meal in a small and stuffy place.

This place is unique in that you can select 4 soup bases, we got spicy, tomato, miso and kimchi. There is a sauce station in which you can create your own sauces. The AYCE options are plenty as we selected our meats, veggies, and seafood options. It was A-OK but prefer Jin Pot and Grand hot pot lounge instead.
author: Annie L.

description:
This place is amazing. This was my first hot pot encounter and was very pleased. We ordered the miso, spicy and beef bone broth base and piled on everything else. 

Pro: Can join wait list via Yelp as long as you're within 2 miles. It was only much husband and I so the wait wasn't as bad as estimated (40-50 min). Service is fast. Service was great. Price is great - $28 AYCE per person, add $10 for AYCDrink. 

Cons: spicy base is spicy. If you can't handle spicy ask to mix with anotjer soup base or don't get it. Not the cleanest establishment in terms of their bathroom and walls. There's not much of a waiting area (they maximize with hot pot spaces).
author: Yen H.

description:
A fave! But there can be a heck of a wait even with the waiting list via Yelp. Even if you're next in line...you could be waiting for an hour...hours...days...years...

It's worth at least one try though. Do it.
author: Joshua F.

description:
This place is definitely worth the all you can drink and eat price. My friend and I came in on a Friday evening and we put on our name on the list through the Yelp app when we were on our way to the restaurant. Once we arrived, we were number 2 (from starting at 9) on the list and only waited for like 10 minutes then were seated right away. We sat in the back part of the restaurant - a little steamy and humid so they had the windows in the back cracked. 

The broth's we chose were the mushroom, kimchi and miso. The broth's were pretty spicy but still savory. The service was fast and friendly. They have a sauce station with recipes posted on the wall on how you can mix the sauces to make good dipping. I loved having unlimited amounts of dipping possibilities - especially someone like me who likes to dip everything possible. 

I ordered everything on the menu seafood and veggies related; my meat eating friend ordered everything meat related on the menu. They would bring it out pretty fast and they would keep checking if we needed more food. Of course we took advantage of the all you can drink for the additional $10. So we got started with wine, Sapporo, and sake bombs. Considering the cheap price to add drinks, I wasn't surprised the wine was not too great. But we did keep ordering the sake bombs with Sapporo. You do have an hour and a half time limit once you sit down to take advantage of the all you can eat and drink. - not bad.

I definitely will be coming back here often. It satisfies my Hot Pot and Sake Bomb craving within a good budget :)
author: Joscelynne R.

description: This place is small. It has around 10 tables (2 big round and 8 square for 4 people). My recommendations are don't come here if you have a big group especially you all hungry or call for reservation. Second, join the wait list on yelp and if the app says 20-40 minutes then give it 50 minutes to an hour. It's all you can eat so some people sit longer than they need to be. Don't show up early because the restaurant has no chairs for you while you're waiting or even a place to stand. You can choose 4 soup bases and they will refill if you run out but with a broth base, so at the end you will get mix soup base :)) i was waiting for over an hour when yelp said 25 minutes.
author: Lee M.

description:
Came here exactly at 5pm when they opened on Saturday and there was no wait. Hooray! 

2 hours of AYCE hotpot (last order at the 90min mark). You can select 4 different broths and we went with the Mala spice, pork bone broth, miso, and beef bone broth. They were all good, although i do have a personal bias towards mala spice.

There is a good variety of food, although we enjoyed the kobe beef best. The meat were all very thinly sliced, and portions were pretty small so we had to keep ordering more meat. I think we must have ordered at least 8 to 9 portions of beef (amongst others) just between the 3 of us.

I also like that they have a sauce bar where we can make our own sauces.

The line got pretty long by the time we left, and I'm so glad we went super early!
author: Christina N.

description:
Hot Pot! Hot Pot! Hot Pot!
What you need in winter is HOT POT!

Came here for celebrating 1/1 2018. 
We went around 5 pm, right at opening time so we didn't wait for our table. 
After 6 pm more and more came and there was a long line when we left the restaurant.(Around 7 pm)

Meat and broth were both excellent. Great value for the price.
They have all you can eat menu, for $27.99 per person and add $10 per person for all you can drink.

You can select 4 soup base. We chose "Pork Bean", "Spicy", "Tomato" and "Kimchi". 
I loved "Spicy" and "Tomato" the most.
Quality of meat was great. 
Seafood and vegetable were fresh and good as well.

Service was pretty good. Staffs were super friendly and attentive.

Nothing better than having Hot Pot as dinner in cold weather.
Come try it!
author: Naiyun W.

description:
Personally i feel like this place is 3 1/2 stars, but i will give them the benefit of the doubt because of their hosting device on the iPad, and also for the service. 

The food to me is okay. Service was great! Upon ordering our server Mason gave us a very warm and professional welcome, explaining the menu to us, and informed us we can order their new upcoming soup bases. He mentioned four, but I only can remember the numbing spice, Chinese mushroom soup, and Thai tom yum. We ordered four soup bases. Their new numbing spice, miso, tomato, and pickled cabbage. We really enjoyed the numbing spice and used that as our main soup to cook our food in.  The miso was good as well, but the tomato and pickled cabbage was pretty disappointing. the pickled cabbage one tasted like water. 

For our meat option we basically just ordered Kobe beef as our main. One interesting note is that every time we would order 2 orders, but they would only bring out one. I wasn't sure why, maybe because they didn't want us to waste meat which is understandable, but what confused me is that when we ordered it the second time, the guy even confirmed that we wanted two orders, but still brought us one. I also feel like their food menu is a bit limited as well. Overall I wouldn't mind eating here again, although I don't like it as much as my beloved iPot, but It's pretty decent place for hot pot.
author: Maggie L.

description:
Great service ! Mason is awesome, ask for him as your server. He will walk you through the process - very patient. You can choose up to four broth but pork and spicy broth are the best. Much variety in the do-it-yourself sauce station. 

And, they provide extra napkins without being asked.
author: M H.

description:
AYCE hot pot place with a variety of little gimmicks that add up to a fun experience. The special pot lets you pick your comfort broths and new broths you want to try; I was particularly satisfied with the beef bone and sour cabbage broths. The mushroom sauce from their sauce bar was chunky and savory, and went pretty well with ponzu. Unlike most places, the food came in rather small portions, but I actually liked it this way since I could have room to try different things. Their "fish gluten" was unlike anything I'd tried; it's like a cross between tofu puff and fish cake, and we enjoyed it so much and ended up getting multiple orders of it! Other items we enjoyed included the beef and pork, beef tendon, pork intestines, shrimp paste, oyster mushrooms, and bamboo shoots.

My only small gripe was that the seating was a bit low, and I frequently found myself stretching to grab my grub. Not a major issue for me, as the food was amazing!
author: Yen Ting L.

description:
Definitely the best all-you-can-eat hotpot in San Francisco. They even have an all-you-can-drink option! All the selections are pretty great and I like that you can choose up to four different broth options.

The meat and veggies come out quick and the sauce bar is amazing for creating your perfect combination. The servers are all very polite and accommodating and make sure you will never leave still hungry.

Worth every penny!
author: Toshi P.

description: I came in with a friend for my birthday, service was great and the food was good! We ordered the kimchi broth, miso, spicy, and Tom yum. The kimchi was our least favorite, because it was sour. The spicy was very hot! And kind of tasted like water with chili. So I wouldn't recommend getting those. But the miso was SO GOOD!!!! I would drive all the way to sf just to come back for the miso! Second best was the Tom yum! Also very good but it tasted better with seafood, as it is a seafood based broth! Kobe need is super tender and delicious and the shrimp is very good as well, just a lot of work because you have to peel off the shell. I will be returning again to try the other broths, which will hopefully be better!
author: Ashley H.

description:
This is my FAVORITE AYCE hot pot in the city. Service is great and for AYCE the meat is very good. Sohand is our man!!! Awesome server. I've been to a lot of hot pot restaurants in the city and this place has the best service, best broth, best meats, and best all you can drink for the price that you pay. I mean $10 for all you can drink?!?! That's a no brainer! 
The only thing to keep in mind about the all you can drink is that the whole table has to do it - so they can prevent 1 person from getting the all  you can drink and sharing with the rest of the table - which is really not unreasonable. So if you're with 3 people, then they will charge $30. BUT if you think you'll drink wine/beer worth $30, worth it to just get the all you can drink. Anywhoooo not that i'm an alcoholic but WHAT A DEAL!
author: Jessie D.

description:
I went here with a couple of my friends yesterday and I really like how you can get 4 different kinds of soup. My favorite was the spicy one. 

We ordered a ton of meat and we felt like they kept forgetting to give us some of the stuff we order. We weren't sure if they added all the meat on one plate, but I felt they probably should have told us. We know for sure they forgot to give is tripe but we didn't know until the end. RUDE! 

I would give three stars but, when we paid we were still eating, and we asked them where the rest of our meat was, but the waiter said, he was pretty sure he gave it all to us, but he was nice enough to give us another plate of meat on them.... So nice. 

I always love getting the fried chinese donuts at hot pot... BUT, I WOULD NOT get it here... IT WAS SO STALE. so disappointed. 

Would I come here again? I don't know but I'm surprised they open until 12am.
author: Christina T.

description:
This place is small so expect a wait to be seated!! I added myself to the waitlist around 6:10 pm (must be within 2 miles of the restaurant to add to the waitlist) then we took an additional 20 mins looking for parking meaning we arrived at the restaurant around 6:40 pm and still waited about 40 more mins to be seated. 

They provide laminated menus and dry erase markers for you to order your food then servers bring everything to your table. The food quality was good; I'd definitely recommend the Spicy Soup base and get the Kobe Beef! The only downside was that the servers only bring a few dishes out at a time and forgot some of our orders so at some points we were sitting there with an empty table waiting on our next round of food.
author: melanie c.

description: Everything was delicious! My favorite was the Kobe. Since ordering and reordering is all done through an iPad, the food came out without much wait. Staff is friendly and attentive. There is also an all you can drink option for an additional $10 (house well drinks only) - but every person at the table met order the all you can drink to take advantage of this option. Definitely one of the best AYCE spots in the city!!
author: Shiny P.

description:
Ok, came back and gave them a second chance. So glad I did too! 

Meats were fresh, everything we ordered actually arrived to our tables, great service, and ayce. 

I love how they have a separate small pullout rolly table next to your table to help hold all your stuff. The tables are just never big enough!

But four broth flavors, with a base of pork or beef (no vegetarian option). 

But everything tasted really good, and I'll definitely come back!
author: Mandi W.

description:
This place is a pretty solid ayce spot. One pot to share has 4 different types of broth, and the broths are all excellent. I got the mushroom, spicy, and tomato on the sides, and then the pork broth in the middle. I think my favorite is the tomato one, but theyre all very solid. 

The only part that I could think of for room for improvement is the meat and fishball department. The meats were all very fresh, but I do wish they were thicker. For fishballs, I wish they had a little bit more variety like roe filled fishballs. Nevertheless, I'm definitely coming back. A lot of hot pot places forget that the broth is the essential part of the taste, and this place gets it right.
author: Raymond L.

description: Great meal, attentive service - guaranteed good time no matter if you're a party of 2 or 12!
author: Brittany R.

description:
I have never been to a place that lets you have hot pot with 4 yes I said FOUR different types of soup. That is just crazy. The place here is not that big so wait time is crazy and stack it with a shitty area to park makes me lose motivation to come. They do offer a yelp waitlist option but you gotta be within a certain range before you can get on it. 

There is a diy sauce bar and the food here is ayce. I personally thought that the soups were super rich and I had a hard time choosing what I wanted to cook my food in. The struggles are real. Once you eat here you will understand. To order, simply just take the white board markers and check off the items and hand it off to the workers. Don't do it when you are minutes away from finishing all the food, they take awhile to get it all ready and it's a bit difficult to get their attention to even hand them the menu. But hey they have a wide selection of fresh foods and rich broth, maybe I'll come back.
author: Tiffany H.

description: This is my new favorite hot pot spot in San Francisco. Its AYCE and a great value. I like that you can order on the iPad at the table, some items got missed but I just reordered. Only down side, you have to wait 5 minutes between orders and it can get very warm in the room from all of the steam. I really like how you get 5 different types of broth, and the bowl is placed into the table. It's much easier to reach your food, and it turns like a lazy Susan so you don't have to reach over everyone. Highly recommend you try it.
author: Michelle V.

description:
Ok, after trying many AYCE hot pot places in the city, I think this is my favorite. I love the variety of the soup bases and the sauce station. I think I took these things for granted before.

I also like that they are continuing to update their menu w/ new items.
author: Cynthia X.

description: Mason was exceptional. Probably one of the best I've seen in the entire country. He was patient, attentive and understanding. 5 stars for him.
author: Linda L.

description:
My friends and I were looking for a good hot pot place and came across this gem! Wait list was pretty easy to get on courtesy of yelp. 

Food was amaze balls! Menu was pretty easy to order from, I recommend the mushroom, miso and pork bone as soup base and make sure you order the Kobe beef, for AYCE its worth it.
author: Jonah Mae R.

description:
Pros:
4 choice of broth
Pork belly and Kobe beef
Lots of choices 
Love the do it yourself sauce (numbing sauce #1)

Cons:
Quite a long wait but is worth it
author: Tina L.

description:
Awesome little AYCE hot place! Ipot used to be my go-to hot pot spot in town but the attentive and proactive service here definitely won over some of my business.

The restaurant is very small compared to other ayce places in the city. It seats maybe 8 tables of 2-4 with 2 large party tables. You can choose 4 soup bases and the variety of meats and veggies is pretty good. Boiling Hot Pot doesn't have some of the stuff I love from ipot like the xlb, short ribs, and other dim sum items, but the core hot pot selection was solid and fresh. The staff proactively pick up newly filled menus and bring out the food quickly.

We ended the meal with snow ice, which is well priced at $1.99/small bowl compared to other dessert places in the city. Great way to finish up a delicious and filling meal.
author: Dani T.

description: I don't believe in spending an excessive amount of money of things that aren't worth it, but the "all you can eat" hot pot here is worth every single penny. My friends and I came here and stayed for over an hour because of the endless supply of food that was provided and the quality of the ingredients that were provided were amazing. You're given the option of four soup bases and a large array of toppings that you can order on an electronic device that is right next to your table so you can get what you need instantaneously! I'm going to come back for sure and bring my parents here with me as well
author: Maya S.

description:
Ok after trying most of the hot pot places in the city, Boiling Hot Pot is the winner.  

This is the only place that has a TRULY TRULY spicy and numbing broth.  I love the fact that they give you straight up sichuan peppercorn oil to really crank up the numbness of your mouth.

Meat quality, great. Service, great. Broth, GREAT.
author: Tu T.

description:
Seating is better for groups, especially in the back area
4 flavor broth setup is a nice way to sample but hard to distinguish after awhile
When packed, ordering becomes a challenge 
Variety and quality is good enough

Overall Thoughts

Not out of the question to return but for now planning to explore other spots first
author: Eddie W.

description:
Hot pot buffet.

There are many choices and materials are good! Only $30 per person. 

Recommend party here.
author: Zhijian J.

description:
This place seems to be really busy on the weekends so make sure to come early or if you have a big group make reservations.

We came here for a birthday celebration and had a party of 19 people and good thing we made reservations ahead of time. We got 3 booths reserved in the back and didn't have to wait too long to get settled in. 

This was my first time here and I thought the restaurant was a bit cramp but it is SF and space is pretty much limited. We did the AYCE for $27.99/person (90 min dine in time) and got a pitcher of blue moon. The beer was a bit flat since there was no head in it. They have menus where you pick and choose what you want and they'll bring it out to you. There was a bit of variety of different meats, seafood, vegetables and starch. What they're known for is for their pot where it comes with 4 different soup bases. It's a pretty cool pot but might be hard to share with a table of 6 and one pot. We ended up getting the kimchi, Szechuan, miso, and their regular house broth. 

We got all kinds of stuff but the kobe beef, lamb shoulders and their special beef was all really tender. Everything else was pretty much standard for any hot pot place. I liked their Fuzhou fish balls since it contained like a beefy surprise in the middle when you bite into it (beware it might squirt everywhere!). They also have a sauce bar towards the back of the restaurant and have a good variety of sauces to choose from. 

Everything was good but the the soup base for me didn't do it. It wasn't as flavorful as I thought it would be and it was a bit watered down. All the broth ended up tasting the same. Usually for me, a good hot pot place would have a really good flavorful broth so that you didn't need to load up on the sauces to make the meats and everything taste better. I also wished they had dumplings or wontons as side dishes. Other than that the service was actually better than average. The waiters were really attentive, got everything we needed, always came back to check on us, and refilled our broths and water. 

Overall, it was a great experience. Parking is not the best in this area but if you circle a couple times then you might get lucky. It's a great place to try with a group of friends.
author: Lisa H.

description:
I went here for a birthday dinner on a Tuesday night in early Dec. 2017. There were 7 of us and none of us had ever been here, but we're all avid fans of hot pot, so the expectations were high. I'm pleased to say that this place did not disappoint!

There was a wide selection to pick from - 4-5 broths, many meats and types of cuts, tons of mushrooms and veggies and other add-ins. For the price, you can't beat it!

Regarding the taste, the broths were pretty similar and the Mala wasn't really that spicy, but honestly they were all good. The meat and other add-ins (as far as I could tell) were good quality and it was so much fun ordering with abandon! We tried all of their meats and I think the lamb added the most to the dishes. Re everything else, the best things were the quail eggs, the different mushrooms (quite the selection), and all the different types of balls they had. 

Room for improvement: The timing of bringing out plates resulted in a slightly imbalanced hot pot (all beef at once without any veggies, then a bunch of mushrooms all at once, etc). Also, the suave bar seemed a bit watered down. For example, the oyster sauce was so diluted it barely added flavor. That's it. All my complaints.

Either way, I strongly suggest coming here. In the future, I definitely plan on coming back. Solo or in a group, I think either way this could be delicious and fun!
author: Quinn Li O.

description:
Saturday night 9pm dinner , 
Didn't need to wait very long to have our table.. 

This place is not a for a get to know each other type of establishment .. you can't hear each other talk across the table. 
I had to basically scream and asked my friend constantly repeat what he said. Yeah! After a while I just tuned out and just continue to cook our meals and watch Kpop on tv screen. 

Offers 4 different types of sauces to choose from . Select you broth choice. We had the satay and the house special spicy broth. Ordered some of the meats and seafood selections, vegetables .. 

Food came out quickly, I thought the waiters were attentive with clearing dirty dishes and replenishing our drinks .
author: Vuoch. L.

description: Soooo good and within walking distance from my bf's place. My favorite broth is the spicy one. All the meats and sauce bar is great!! Usually pretty packed so best to get on the waitlist before you show up.
author: JR E.

description: Overall is good. Went early with my parent with wheelchair on a Saturday morning without waiting. Service was excellent. Our server was extremely attentive and friendly.  Made our first visit a very pleasant experience. I liked the soup base selections. Ambience was good. But, the sauce serving station could be more organized and cleaner.  Selections of sauce could be better. Some of Veggie and tofu selections and products could be fresher and better...very tough even cooked for long time.
author: LaDeDa H.

description:
I've been to almost every single hot pot place in SF and this is probably my favorite! I went on a Friday which made it a really long wait but it was well worth it.

One thing about Boiling that's a lot better than other places is that their soup selection is much bigger and each soup bases actually taste different. We got the pork bone, spicy, kimchi and tomato soup bases and they were all pretty good. Tomato was my favorite though.

The food was really fresh. The portion sizes are pretty small which is super useful when you're getting full but just want a little bit more of a few things. Their self-serve sauce bar has the essential although its not the most comprehensive. 

You can also pay another $10 for all you can drink (including alcohol!) They have red and white wines, cold and hot sake and a small selection of beer.

The only small complaint I had is that they took a really long time to bring out the food after we placed our order (relative to other hot pot places) and they forgot multiple times to bring certain items on our order so we had to order them again.
author: Cassie Z.

description: A great hot pot place in Richmond. All you can eat. They have a good selection of meats and vegetables on the menu. Also great because you can have the split pot of 4 different broth options. And they have a great sauce bar too. They even have an all you can drink deal.
author: Peter K.

description: Came here over the weekend with some friends. [AYCE hot pot!!] We made reservations on a Friday night and it actually wasn't packed at all which was nice so we got seated within few minutes. The cool thing about this place is you can have four different broths! We chose the pork base soup, tom yum soup, miso soup and one other soup I can't remember but they all tasted delicious. The servers were nice and checked up on us. Lots of variety of meats and veggies to choose from! Overall, we had a great time and would come back again soon!
author: Monica W.

description:
My friends and I were craving hot pot and decided to try something new. 

They only take reservations for 5 or more people and if someone cancels and your party is less than 5 they'll also take away your reservation! 

When walking inside it looked pretty small but there's actually tables in the back which is pretty cool! 

They had a nice ish selection of sauces and they also had a paper where they showed certain ways customers make their sauces so you can replicate. 

The soup bases we chose were tom yum (pretty good has a kick to it) curry(pretty good) tomato soup (taste like Campbell tomato soup) kimchee (okay). It was cool that they offer 4 soup bases per party. I stuck with tomyum and curry! 

They also had a huge variety of meat selections and other food selections like pork intestines (first hot pot place I know that has this) fish mix paste thing which was really good and many more! 

(-1 Star) because we were seated in the back and it was somewhat difficult to contact a waiter to order more food/drinks.
author: An L.

description:
Solid place if you're hungry on a cold day, not looking to wait an hr, and happen to be nearby. We came on a Saturday night, party of 4, and we were seated pretty much immediately.

The quality of the meat was good, the broths were great, and the servers were very attentive. Would recommend as a great, local catchup spot.
author: Jim Z.

description:
I starved all day so my stomach would be ready for Boiling Hot Pot, and at the end I could barely breathe around all the food I ate, so I'd count that as a good meal. 

We made reservations for 9 at 6pm and were given a full 2 hours to eat until the next reservation at 8. The interior doesn't seem very large, and it filled up quickly though it was half empty when we arrived at 6. We got one of the large tables in the middle with two pots, which meant we had the option of trying all the broths if we'd really wanted. For the pot on our side, we chose the tomato, pork bone broth in the middle, miso, and spicy. While we waited for food to arrive, I went to the sauce bar and made a beautiful concoction of sesame, cilantro, oyster sauce, and satay, which I could've eaten on its own. 

There are a ton of options for meat, seafood, veggies, and other goodies like my favorite pork blood rice cakes and frozen tofu. The meat is incredibly thin and only needs to be dipped in the broth before it's ready for eating. My favorite was the pork belly, but that might be because that was the only one I kept track of... In terms of the best kinds of veggies to stew, I'd recommend the taro and pumpkin, finished off with some wide vermicelli. 

The waiters were really attentive and brought us huge portions of everything we ordered, so we never went hungry for long. The spicy broth does get pretty spicy, but my only issue is that the other broths didn't taste strong enough to flavor things like the rice cakes. Still, I left feeling like I couldn't stand properly because of all the food I ate, which means that it's good hot pot!
author: Sophie W.

description: Excellent hot pot! Love that you can get four sauces for your meat! Lots of flavor and variety in the sauces. The meat sizes are smaller, which is nice for variety. Service was great. Highly recommend and will definitely come back!
author: Camelia M.

description:
Loved this place!!! Amazing staff, food and awesomely priced! 

We had the all you can eat and it was more than enough and super delicious!

They had so many sauces and choices for broth, we had the beef, kimchi, spicy, and curry and the kimchi and spicy were AWESOME!! 

They have an all you can eat and all you can drink menu... whaaaaaat!? 

Anyways, we randomly found this little gem and we will definitely be back!
author: Tara B.

description: I came on Wednesday night it wasn't that busy  . Ofcz the service very good and professional This is the best hot pot place ever!! Good service good food and the beef here is the best . They do have a big pot that you can choose 4 different soup base . I will definitely come again !
author: Agnes S.

description:
No matter how big your party is, I feel it's worth the money to do all you can eat for $27.95, rather than just ordering a dish here and there for $17.95 each. Just make sure you arrive with an empty stomach, ready to eat. You order by choosing four soup bases first. Three on the outside and then one little circle in the middle which can hold a pork bone soup or beef bone soup. I love the fried tofu skin at Tasty pot, so when I ordered the fried tofu sheets I thought it would be the same but I didn't like the texture and it was thicker. I think the only meat I tried and liked was the Kobe meat. The pork belly was too thin. I normally like how pork belly is thick. Even though they had a good variety of meat, vegetables, seafood, tofu and noodles, I didn't really like the selection. If you're a fan of ipot and little sheep Mongolian hot pot, you'll love this place. They even have a sauce bar area where you can mix your own sauces. I just chose to get the sesame sauce which was alright. I did however really love their dessert. Their strawberry snow for only $1.99 is probably the only item I would come back for. For only $1.99 the portion was perfect, and the lychee topping + syrup (it comes with) and snow were very fresh. 
In the end, in my opinion $27.95 wasn't worth the price since I didn't like the selection.
author: Kristin H.

description:
Came here on a Friday night for dinner. The place is small compared to other Hot pot places so we had to wait about 45 minutes.

Once seated, food was served quickly and service is so friendly.  Husband and I both ordered the All you can eat option which was only about $30 each.

Pretty good deal and pretty yummy meat selections.  I personally liked the kimchi broth the best and my husband preferred the miso.  In terms of meat - Kobe, lamb and pork belly were all quite good.

Would definitely recommend and come again.
author: Siv L.

description:
Hot pot AYCE: $27.95
All you can drink: +$10.00

Atmosphere: on the quieter side, not too loud. 
Good for couples or big groups.

The hot pot is good. Portions are a good, but smaller than other hot pot sizes I've had at other places. If you know you can eat a lot, just order more all at once.

The pot is sectioned off into 3rds so you can get more than one soup base at once.

They have a sauce bar which is amazing, that way you can come up with your own sauce concoction. 

Service: attentive staff. Very fast with refills on meat, water, and any other needs you have. Asked if it was our first time when we came in and explained how to order from their menu.

Dessert was shaved snow with lychee jelly. Very strong tea flavor in the green tea which I'm a big fan of.

I'll come back again.
author: Leanne K.

description:
This is my favorite chinese hotpot in SF!!!!!!! 
That's right, SEVEN exclamation points.
My justification:

1. Make-your-own sauce bar: always a consistent variety of condiments, sauces, and veggies to create your own dipping sauce- chopped garlic, cilantro, green onions, satay sauce, peanut sauce, chili sauce, oyster sauce--they have it all.

It's much better than Little Sheep where you have to pay for sauces AND they only have a few choices. Where's the autonomy?!

2. All-You-Can-Eat: ok, so this is common to most hotpot places. But! I feel like Boiling HotPot really lets you eat all you can. I never feel rushed or judged for ordering my fifth plate of deep-fried tofu skins here.

3. SO MANY SOUPS TO CHOOSE FROM: this is decidedly the go/no factor for me when it comes to hotpot--is your broth tasty and flavorful? Do I want to dip my meat in it? Yes to both here. My favorite broths are: Mala, Pork bone, Beef, and the tomato one if I'm tryna be chill. The best part? YOU CAN ORDER ALL FOUR. Their pots are split into four sections.

4. Last but definitely not least, Boiling Hotpot has a legit selection of meats and veggies. I usually order Kobe beef, house premium lamb, tripe, intestines, all the mushrooms, bamboo shoots, wood ear fungus, tripe, deep-fried tofu and tofu skins.

5. It's v reasonably priced for AYCE in SF ~$27

6. There's extra seating in the back with huge tv screens so you can watch warriors games while you feast.


What's not to like? Ok sometimes you have to wait an hour in line, but if your party is 5 peeps or more, you can make a reservation! Plus, Yelp has this handy new waiting time feature on the app so you can prepare yourself for the wait ^^
author: Cindy T.

description:
Damn. Damn, damn, damn. I love hot pot as much as the next person but this place really fucked over my stomach and that's depressing because the food actually seemed pretty good. 

My friends and I came here on a Saturday evening for dinner and all the small tables were taken so we ended up taking half of a big table which wasn't an issue because hey, less waiting on our part. One pot for us four with four different broths to have so we chose pork bone, miso, tomato, and something else that I forgot but it was definitely impressive when the pot first came to us. I've had this place bookmarked for a while so it feels good to finally check this place off the list. 

We did the all you can eat option and added 2 bottles of soju (mango and yogurt) and began ordering a lot of stuff. So first off, food? Comes out pretty damn quick. Sauce bar? Easy to navigate and kept pretty clean most of the time. Service? Friendly and helpful. No complaints there. 

We were all having a good time honestly going through the food until almost halfway through when the broths started dwindling away and the food started getting burnt. Even when the waiter refilled the broth, the rest of the food that cooked just tasted burnt. And the soju? It's not a bad price for one but I would just skip it if I were you. On its own the mango and yogurt sucked, but mixed together.. well, a bit better.

Overall, I gotta skip it. One of my friends and I ended up getting a bad stomachache the next day and she ended up throwing up, too.. so.. sorry.
author: Venus L.

description:
Four soup choices?! So many choices. Three large soups and one small center soup (center choices are meat based broths). Tried the Spicy Soup and Miso Soup - when spicy got to be a bit much for me, I switched over to the miso soup, which ended up being a ton more flavorful than I thought it'd be! 

You can also make your own dipping sauce in the back. Good assortment of oils, sauces and garnishes to mix to your hearts desire. 

They've got all the standards for meat, seafood, and veggie choices. My friend and I LOVED the fried bean curd (reordered three times ah) - it comes out super crispy, and you can prob eat it as is, but we had it seep in the soup for some extra flavor. Since I don't eat meat, I always measure the freshness of the foods by the seafood. They had a great assortment of octopus, shrimp and fish - all were delish in the spicy and miso soups! 

Service was on point. Never had to ask for more ice water or soup. Even though we were sitting at the booth closest to the door, the waiter came by a handful of times to check in on us. 

All in all, a great hot pot experience. It's $27pp before tax..and came out to $35pp after tax and tip. Not an every night price I'm willing to pay for dinner, but worth it. 5 stars!
author: Jennifer L.

description: This place was really good, but the waitlist is weird. I want a real person to confirm that I've arrived.
author: Alexandra R.

description:
This is my favorite place of hot pt. You can choose 4 soup and you can create your own sauce.My favorite soup is miso.Not too expensive for buffet to get a lot of choice of meat , vegetables and seafood.I love watermelon juice but right now they are always out. :'( 

Mason always good server ever!!
author: Panpaporn K.

description: AYCE $27.95 This place was good! Friendly staff, good portion of meat, and you get 4 different soups! Come on down today to taste this exquisite one in a lifetime 4 in one special! Shout out to server DT for being so kind.
author: Sophia Y.

description: My new holy grail for AYCE hot pot place in the city! I have been here twice with my friends and I was very pleased with the food and customer service both times. They let you choose 4 different broths and I highly highly recommend tomato and miso broths. Those are amazing!! They have a sauce bar too so you can make your own dipping sauce. Wait can be long but you can reserve a spot on the waitlist first before arrival. A variety of meat and vegetables to choose from, all of which are fresh and tasty! Love this place
author: Bao Q.

description:
Boiling Hot Pot used to be my go-to spot for hot pot in the city but that has changed since the last time I visited. Menu options are limited compared to my now-favorite hot pot place (Seapot in San Mateo). Yes, there are still some aspects of BHP that are good, like the 4-broth pot which you don't see everywhere. I find that the tomato broth is the most flavorful one and other broths such as miso and pickled cabbage are a bit bland. In terms of meat quality, they do have some of the best pork belly I've had - so tender! The kobe beef is also good. 

Now onto the reason why i'm docking stars. My boyfriend and I used to love coming here for the mango snow dessert, which has been complimentary at the end of our meal the past few times we visited. Now we haven't been back for a couple of months and since we were in the area and craving hot pot, we decided to come back to BHP. At the end of our meal, we asked our server if they had snow, and they said yes, but in order to get it, we had to write them a 'positive' Yelp review on the spot. EXCUSE ME???? I informed the server that I had written a review in the past and he said "It's a one time thing". UMMM, actually, I wrote my review free of charge - I did not get ANYTHING for writing that review, I wrote it because I genuinely enjoyed my past experiences here. Needless to say, I was irritated at their nerve to tell me that since I had wrote a review in the past, I had to pay for the mango snow today when it had been complimentary the previous times we visited. My boyfriend and I refused and left the restaurant. Makes me wonder if all these 5 star reviews are from them bribing customers with dessert. Not planning on coming back again.
author: Cecille W.

description:
We visited this place last Saturday night (3/10/18) since our regular spots (Boiling Hot Pot and Shabu_club) had hourlong waits. It was totally worth it. 

Both of us did the AYCE hot pot, sharing spicy/house broths (spicy was excellent, house broth tasted like extra-umani pork stock) with lamb, beef, trumpet and enoki mushrooms, napa cabbage, quail eggs, fried tofu pods, and udon noodles. Everything was brought out promptly and the service was super fast (our first set of ingredients came out within 2 mins of us ordering). The portions are much larger than at Boiling Hot Pot, so pace yourself if you like sampling a bunch of things at once. We were also pleased that appetizers/dessert were included in AYCE, so we got a scallion pancake (came out incredibly crisp) and mango pudding for dessert. 

Instead of a sauce station, the basic sauces (soy sauce, sesame sauce, chinese vinegar, sacha sauce, chili oil, minced garlic) are at each table. It looked like you could order onion and cilantro from the menu separately. 

Really nothing bad to say about this place, except that it's a bit far from home. I'm looking forward to going back!
author: Christine H.

description: Jessica is the best waitress ever! Highly recommend this place for hot pot. DELICIOUS!!!
author: Haley S.

description:
The boiling hot pot is an okay place to go to
Nothing much stand out compare others

Pro& cons
Have yelp reservation(great app if you don't want to wait)-but doesn't mean that you will be on their waiting list in store. What's the point of having yelp reservation if they don't considered that as a reservation. It was so pissed off at that night when a group of 5 ppl arrived at the restaurant base on the yelp estimated wait time and was told to put our name on their waiting list in store again. Prob takes another 30minutes. 

Food -standard 
Customer service -average

Prob won't returned
Unless they honor the yelp reservation or remove it
author: Jasper K.

description:
Delicious all you can eat hotpot with 4 soup bases for only $27.95. This place is awesome and well worth the drive/uber/lyft over. 

For starters pick a base, which my preference is pork over the beef. You can then pick 3 additional soup flavors. I suggest miso, spicy, and sour cabbage. There is a sauce bar to make your own sauce, and it has kimchi. Order your choice of meats, seafoods, and veggies galore. My favorites are the beef tenderloin, kobe beef, pork belly, and shrimp. All ingredients are really fresh and portion size is reasonable if you want to try some of everything. If you are looking for alcohol, all you can drink is $10 more. 

Be careful on peak days/times. The wait can be an hour. Service is pretty responsive. They get busy at times, but if you flag someone down they are always very helpful. If its getting late they will tell you its last call so you can squeeze everything you want in.

5 stars for overall quality, variety, and freshness. Price point is reasonable. Avoid the crowds.
author: James S.

description:
Meat and seafood were fresh! Meat are sliced thinly and perfect for the hot pot! Kobe beef was in the menu but somehow was not the "wow" factor to us as compared to kobebeef we had in japan. But everything is perfectly delicious and great! 
We absolutely love these soup base: szechuan, tom yum, kimchi (we love spicy stuff). There are other non spicy soup base to choose from too!
author: Stacey W.

description:
Food was good, the reason for one star is lack of service and the nerve of an employee asking for a good review.
heres my verdict:
upon entry, we were seated pretty fast, towards the back. the server explained the policy and came back 10 mins later for the menu. we ordered water since hot pot was all bout the soup at the end!

Food was good, however we had no clue what was what as the server just mumbled everything and left. 
when I wanted to reorder, we had to flag someone else down, when they came with our dishes I asked for napkins the gentleman gave me a nasty look and snatched napkins from another table. I did not even bother asking for water at this point, it was clear there were no water in any of our cup.

Had to get up later to request a menu for desert , and later get up again to hand deliver the menu.

I felt pretty comfortable at this point, getting up to request for items, so I thought why not just request a check.

After I brought the check to our table, a man came up asked us for a good review..and just stood there.. Not awkward at all.
author: S C.

description:
'Twas a dreadful rainy Saturday afternoon that my lover and I rendezvous here for lunch. I've been craving shabu shabu, but unfortunately the shabu shabu places that I wanted to go to--only open during dinner time; not lunch.

So I settled on this place--Boiling Hot Pot. The pot is definitely unique with the different sections of broth in which we only use like 2 out of the 4 sections. Food was pretty good. I'm not a fan of the sauce bar cause from a sanitary stand point it's not that good of a idea. But anywho..it's cool that they have a great deal of sauce variety though.

The kobe beef was good. I mean you can never go wrong with that meat. We tried their beer beef which was pretty fatty beef with a hint of beer taste. 

Price was pretty pricey. I'd much rather go to a shabu shabu place than hot pot. Better broths.

Oh yeah, parking is a total beyotch! I probably spent at least 30 something minutes til I found a spot just as someone was leaving. That's the one thing that's soo eff in annoying about SF. The mothereffin parking!
author: Amy C.

description:
I love the broth selection they have here.

It's not just split in half but 5 ways! The pork bone broth is my favorite. It's just so flavorful and tasty. They allow you to create your own dipping sauce as well. The meat here is good and service is friendly - they always ask if you've been here before.
author: Mabel Y.

description:
choices galore! multiple soup options, multiple sauce options, multiple meat options, multiple veggie options. AND none of the options are of poor quality.

the only criticism I had was that there wasn't enough ladles and communal utensils
author: Jason C.

description: This is the greatest sentimental Sunday throwdown AYCE dreamscape. The broth is BOMB. Get that fried tofu the best secret of the meal. Omg so fucking good I am BLOWN AWAY.
author: Thea B.

description: Holy crap!! This place is amazeballs!!! Service was amazing, expedient, and friendly. Food was fresh and plentiful. I've been to 20+ Shabu places. This is by far the best.
author: Az A.

description:
My go-to spot for a hotpot fix.

I like the variety of broth choices (1+3, where 1 is beef of pork broth and the rest are up to you).

The staffs are every attentive and friendly. They might forget your order at time, but they will bring out what you want almost right away.

Highly recommended for a hotpot party with friends or family.

Waiting can be long at times, so either come early or reserve seat(s) in advance.

All in all, highly recommended.
author: Eren R.

description: The food here is great! Something different from other hot pot restaurants is that this place has pots split into 4 sections which means you can share 4 different soup bases! Their portion sizes aren't too big each round which is nice if you want to try different dishes. The sauce station is also convenient. I enjoyed the food a lot, but there was a long wait time since it was a Saturday night. Although it can be a long wait sometimes, I was able to get added onto their waitlist through Yelp.
author: Cheryl C.

description: I was a bit skeptical about this place but my friend kept insisting. I really love their sauce bar and they're quite attentive in terms of service. Pricing is also reasonable with decent quality meats. Would recommend it if you're in this area.
author: Tiff W.

description: The service is great and the food is awesome. Broth  took a bit of time to get just right, but it was a fun with their large selection of sauces.  I will be back!
author: Daniel G.

description:
This place wasn't bad and some of the beef was rather high quality. It's a good choice for an all you can eat hot pot.  That being said, they don't refill the broth, they just pour water in it when it gets low.  

Their sauce selection looks decent to start.  They have two oil based sauces, and their both spicy.  It actually numbs your mouth when you eat it so I stick with the sesame sauce.  

The staff is responsive and they bring the food out quickly which is a plus.  After a while of dumping different foods into the boil, the top of the water will begin producing scum which doesn't get cleaned out.  

Again - a good option for all you can eat, but overall quality / cleanliness is not as high.
author: Justin L.

description:
I was mind blown that this place gave each table 3 broths to cook in! My table ordered the spicy broth, Korean broth and the miso broth. We unanimously agreed that the miso broth was the best, we ended up.avoiding the spicy broth because it was just too spicy. 
Loved how helpful and polite the servers we're! This place had many variety  of noodles, vegetable,  tofu, meats that we could order from. It was a fun experience. I would highly recommend this place to my friends and family. It was perfect for a cold night in SF!
author: Cindy N.

description:
I'm a hot pot lover and this place has been in operation for 3 years and I can't believe I just found out about this place! 

Each soup pot allows you to choose up to 4 different flavors which is the most I have ever seen! We chose Pork Bone, Spicy Soup, Tomato Soup and Miso Soup and they were all very flavorful and delicious. My favorite was the tomato soup because it added so much flavor the food. 

All you can eat is $27.95 per person, all you can drink for an extra $10! Really good variety of meats, seafoods, veggies and noodles! I am very impressed by the quality of the ingredients and the speed of service! The food kept coming and we had no breaks to rest! Bellies filled to the max! 

The staff were very friendly, fast and service was great! The restaurant is very clean and had TV screens everywhere! I will be back again!!
author: Janny S.

description: Great selection of broths - can get up to 4 different kinds of broth for each pot. All the broths we got were very flavorful, I especially liked the spicy broth and the miso broth. Good amount of food per serving. Meat was fresh and tasty, the beer beef was really good in the spicy broth. Will come back again!
author: Angela C.

description: $27.95 for all you can eat hot pot. Great selection and great service. Got here around 8 on a Friday night and had to wait 20 minutes for a table. Highly recommend if you are in the city!
author: Kelly Z.

description: Our best hot pot place in the Bay Area. Expect long wait time (Over a hour).
author: Kevin C.

description:
Came here about a year ago and haven't decided to do a review until now. Looking back on memories, this place may deserve more stars, but I'll check later. 
We wanted to go to the hot pot place down the street, but it was clogged so walked down the street and found this cute little hot pot shop. They sat us immediately and gave us plenty of time to look at the menu. My friend and I both ordered the supposedly "homemade" plum juice. Eew. Tasted like watered down barbecue sauce. When we flagged down the waiter to ask what was in it he said " I dunno" WHAT! How do you not know what's in it if it's supposedly home made! That was one fail. 
Another slip was how long it took to serve us. It really wasn't packed that day and we hadn't ordered that much food. I noticed a group that arrived at the restaurant after us but left before we even got our noodles. We waited about 60 minutes before we got our hot pot.  
When we actually GOT our food it was delicious!
Here I need to explain how hot pot works. 
Let's say you have a large party( like ours). Each person gets a small bowl. In the center is a huge bowl, divided into three parts. The bowl is filled with hot water. When you dip your noodles or whatever you ordered it gets cooked for you.
Our food was amazing! If it weren't for the two little fails at the beginning, I would have given Boiling Hot Pot five stars.
author: Lucas D.

description:
Ok. So I've always been skeptical with all of these AYCE buffet hot pot places as I always think the food quality isn't so good, but Boiling Hot Pot proved me wrong. I brought my sister who was visiting from Seattle and my fiancé here. We got here about 6:30pm on a Saturday night and already there is 5 people on the wait list and a jam packed restaurant. Good thing my fiancé dropped me off for me to sign in first, and he circle around the block to find parking. I supposed the parking was pretty horrendous because it took him 45 min to find parking but when he finally did we were also seated. So I guess perfect timing!

When we ordered our first round we were worried that they might be slow with our second rounds so we made sure to order a lot in our first rounds. The meats were great! The best I've had at these AYCE places. The broths were good too, we had the sour cabbage, spicy hot pot, beef broth and the tomato flavored one. The service was impeccable and they were really great at making sure we are taken care of. We are slow eaters so really took advantage of the two hour mark, but they were very courteous and just reminded us 20 min before our 2 hour limit that if we wanted to make last orders which I thought was a great way of reminding us without being pushy.

Definitely will come again when I'm in town!
author: Jean C.

description:
GOOD THINGS:

-AYCE drink option, which includes beer and wine
-Each pot can hold 4 different types of broth; the middle one looks super small but is deeper than it looks
-Sauce bar where you can make your own sauces and grab some cucumbers and kimchi; looked sanitary
-Extra options I don't see at other places like octopus and tong ho (veggie)
-Fresh fruit (super sweet) and shave ice (green tea, mango, vanilla) after the meal

BAD THINGS:

-The broths, even the spicy, tasted really mild... almost bland
-Meat quality was slightly poorer than other AYCE hot pot places (Little Dipper)
-It took longer to get our meat so we think that they get you to fill up on other stuff first
author: Shannon L.

description: I was impressed with Boiling Pot.  Wait is long as it is a small place and limit of all you can eat up to 2 hours.  Vast selection of items on the menu and the sauces you create your own.  Meat selection was absolutely fabulous and same for veggies.  The hot pot had 4 compartments so if you are a vegan  you can definitely share a hot pot with a group and no worry of mixing meat with veggies.  Overall I'm very happy with this restaurant.
author: Lillian W.

description:
one of my favorite spots for hot pot in the city!

+ 4 different soup bases to use (we had kimchi, miso, beef bone, and spicy) all delicious and add so much variety to the meal!
+ wonderful make your own sauce bar (easy to use, and keeps for less wait to get a refill on!)
+ SO MANY OPTIONS!!!!! different types of noodle, meat, seafood! only minus is there is no fish ball with roe. :'(

will definitely be back here! $27.99 for AYCE dinner, and added $10 for AYCD. only minus is there is no portion menu in case you don't want AYCE.
author: Cathy Y.

description:
Awesome hot pot in he Richmond. Can't believe I didn't know this place was just down the road. Selection is phenomenal and the quality of ingredients just as equal! AYCE + D for ~$40 is quite literally a steal! Their AYCD IPA on draft at the moment is Green Flash which on its own one glass is worth the amount of the whole AYCD price!
Love the tofu sheets, pickles cabbage broth, and their miso broth I can just sip forever! 

Please come and enjoy the great hot pot and great service!
author: Rachelle F.

description: I didn't expect much from this place because there are so many chinese hot pot spots in the city that everything seems typical. I guess what really stood out the most was our server Mason who was so attentive and sweet throughout the entire meal. The  pork bone & beef bone is so good :) I recommend getting both! If you like fatty meat, try requesting! Mason was able to accommodate my needs so I was a happy fatty :)
author: Anne C.

description:
Really good！！！I love the beef
Also the price is good！And the tomato pot is really tasty with mutton and fish, in which we feel more comfortable than other pot we ate before.
author: Shirley Y.

description: Amazing service and amazing food!! You get up to 4 broths and unlimited meats and veggies for $30 pp. Waiter was super attentive and asked us multiple times if we wanted more food (this is a buffet) before last call at 11 pm. What more can you ask?
author: Lisa X.

description: Great value! Really enjoyed the food and great service . Get spicy, miso, and Kimchi broths.
author: Simon S.

description:
Would give this place 3.5 stars. $28 before tax, AYCE! Came here to eat on a Saturday night, party of two. Wait was about half and hour and we were seated at 9:30pm. They close at 10:30pm and last call was at 10pm, which was fine.

They have a sauce bar on the side which was nice. But being that it was towards the end of the night, a lot of it was pretty empty. Not sure if it got refilled but we made due with what was there. You basically get to choose 4 different broth options! We got beef bone, szechuan, miso, and kimchi.

Pretty standard ordering, you mark off what you want on the sheet and hand it to a worker. We were missing an item or two and reordered during our next round. Had marked for rice twice, and got it after verbally asking for it. Anything else that was missing generally showed up after we marked and ordered it again. Items looked portioned for one individual, which is nice so we don't end up with too much food. Only annoying part about our service was that meats and veggies came out at separate times. Meat came out first, we dug in and cleared it. Then veggies. Ordered more and same deal. Had to hold off eating for a bit to have both on the table. We also had to ask for our waters to be refilled. Workers were on top of clearing plates though, which is nice.
author: Tina N.

description:
Four broths in one hot pot!  Everyone can have their fill of delicious soup without offending other members of your party.  We enjoyed the tomato broth the most, and it ran dry by the end of the meal.  Next time, we will do two servings!  Do check out the self serve condiments bar.  

The meats are fresh and high quality, and the restaurant doesn't try to fill you up on cheap stuff by listing them at the back of the menu.  We did not like the shrimp as they were large whole shrimp and the veins took a long time to remove.

Servers are fast and efficient, with frequent dish removals and soup refills.  The 45 minute wait and lack of near by parking can be a deterrent. But, oh, it's worth it.
author: Jack C.

description:
Great service.  Great all you can eat and drink!
Highly recommend! Our go to hotpot!

We went on a Tuesday night.
author: Shay D.

description:
Over charged me with my credit card for the bill without my permission
 Be carefullllllll!
author: Holly Y.

description:
The all you can eat value is amazing! Especially for the drinks!

Meat quality was extremely good, although the portions are a bit smaller than other hot pot, probably to pace people. 

Despite that, we were always able to reorder very quickly and the staff didn't seem like they wanted to slow us down at all. 

Veggies were also all crisp and clearly fresh!

Very good service and great broths - the spicy broth is very very spicy, though, so be careful!

All in all, we definitely plan to come back!
author: Aidan B.

description: Small and intimate place but a great location in the outer Richmond. All you can eat is the way to go. Meats are fresh with color and taste. Did some seafood and the lobster balls are the way to go. Only negative thing is the parking is scarce but definitely worth checking out.
author: Peter Y.

description:
Great hotpot for groups. 
- You can have up to four broths 
- Service is fast 
- Order by marking a menu, clear and easy to communicate with servers. They give you a lot of menus up front so you never have to wait to order. 
- Meat is tasty 
- Last call for the table is 90 minutes, total time limit is 2 hours. 
- You can pay $10 for all you can drink!
author: Angela N.

description: Many choices. Favorite hot pot in the US. Highly recommended. You can choose three kinds of base flavour. Waiters there are very nice too.
author: Hugo Z.

description:
I was originally intrigued by this spot due to its $28 ayce menu along with the sauce bar which allows you to conjure your own dip amongst an assortment of 10 or so choices. While I typically eat Shabu when deciding between the two options, I do like hot pot for it's bigger menu of meats and vegetables. They have the standard beef, pork and lamb but also have a robust selection of fish balls, fish, tendon, tripe, dumplings  and other speciality items which add different textural components to the meal. The hot pot comes in 4 different broth flavors which also adds to the variety of the meal. We tried the pork bone soup which was good, the tomato soup which was really good, the kimchi soup which was spectacular and the spicy soup which was so intense that we ended up not using it after the first bite. I'm a big fan of spicy food and that mala mouth feel but the spicy broth was so intense that our entire table who loves spicy food gave up on it after one try. Other than the spicy broth, all the others were very good. I also suggest getting the quail egg as it's not an every day item you can get at shabu or even hot pot locations.

The service was also surprisingly good as our waiter was very receptive and friendly to any questions as it was our first time there. Any requests were handled promptly and they were very attentive to our water and food needs. We never felt the need to order large batches at once, our waiters were always very quick to acknowledge us when we wanted more.

I would suggest this spot to anyone who likes hot pot or even the typical Shabu lover who wants to venture out. The pricing here for ayce is better than other places and the food quality is just as good. With the different selection of broth and food, it feels like you're eating a couple different meals at the same time. Combine that with a sauce bar where you can mix and match flavors from over 10 options, this place won't be boring for a while. I had a great experience here all around and will definitely be back.
author: James K.

description: The bespectacled boy in the store served very well and we ate very well. Everyone was very happy that we would come again next time.
author: Huiting X.

description: This is my third time came here, I am so full , the service is good, plus it's buffet, you can eat whatever you want , take your time and chat with your friends- love it
author: Eden X.

description: Great place for hot pot!! Service was excellent and timely. Make sure to make reservation early for a table. Would recommend to family and friends.
author: Steve H.

description: Good selection of broths, sauces, and foods. You can have four broths which is good. AYCE. Fried bean curd sheets are good.
author: Alexander G.

description:
I love how this place gives you so many options! Tbh I was kind of overwhelmed with how many different broths and dipping sauces I had to choose from, but it was a fun experience haha. My favorites were definitely the miso broth and satay dipping sauce. 

They have a huge selection of meats, seafoods, veggies, and tofus here that are also really fresh. They even have quail eggs here which is not usually offered at other hot pot places but so good!

Service is decent. They seem a bit understaffed though so at times we had to wave to get attention, but the waiters were all really polite and helpful. 

If you come on the weekend, make sure to arrive early or be prepared to wait (~40 min...they only take reservations for 6+ people). Also, you get a free shaved snow dessert if you like their Facebook page! Overall, this place is a great deal for $28 AYCE.
author: Jennifer T.

description: This place is great and the staff is courteous, the quality is off the hook and the feel is homely. Come one come all!!
author: Alfonzo T.

description:
I thought this place wasn't going to be good at all. From reading the reviews, it seemed like reviewers got bribed into writing good reviews. I wasn't sure which review was truthful or not. That being said, I came in here with low expectations. 

My friend and I came here on a Sunday evening around 7pm and we got seated in 15 minutes or less. The restaurant itself looked pretty small. We got asked if we wanted to share a larger table with another party but we said no. The waiter explained to us how to order and how much the price was for all you can eat. At Boiling Hot Pot, you cannot order a la carte. Must be all you can eat/all you can drink (extra $10). I don't think my friend would have been down to drink, so I ordered a soda for myself. Non refillable because it was a can. We ordered about 3 rounds, but every round they forgot at least one plate. It didn't bother me much because the food was coming out pretty fast. As for the broths, you can choose 3 different ones with a bone broth in the middle. I thought the miso and spicy one I chose were really flavorful. The meats I thought tasted really good in all of the broths. I especially liked the pork belly, because that was the only one I could differentiate out of the few we ordered. We didn't order any dessert, as other reviewers stated that you could be bribed into writing a good review. 

For two all you can eat, we only paid around $75 which wasn't bad. I would spend more at other all you can eat hot pot places. Still, little sheep is my favorite but I would still come back to Boiling Hot Pot. 

Note: a lot of plates were chipped, which is a health code violation.
author: Jeanne C.

description:
The only cure for SF "summers" is a boiling cauldron of piping hot soup that you can dip an unlimited amount of meat, seafood, or veggies into. It cost $28 per person to escape into this meat sauna, guaranteeing you a full belly and warm steam that's probably good for your skin. $10 more and you can get to this state of nirvana even faster with all the sake and beer that you can drink. 

So take off that Patagonia jacket for once and join me most weekends at the Most Magical Place in SF.
author: Dan Z.

description:
Varieties, really good service. 
You can choose up to 4 soups. 
Worth to try it when you in the neighborhood.
author: Niko L.

description:
This was our first time eating hot pot-style. We came in the late afternoon and there wasn't a wait. They were going to close soon but let us in anyway and there was no pressure to leave, though they did have a "last call" for orders.

The sliced potatoes were literally raw slices of potatoes. The fried tofu was pretty dry and I wouldn't get it again, and I wasn't a huge fan of the fish and lobster balls. However all the meats were incredible, and I especially liked the miso soup.

The waitress was not very helpful. We only knew about the sauce bar from reading yelp reviews, we had no idea how much food to order, and kind of figured out what to do with it once it arrived on our own. Hopefully nobody got food poisoning. In the end we were not entirely full which was disappointing for the price of all-you-can-eat, and while this was due to our inexperience (and the fact that they closed the kitchen), I wish the waitress had hinted that it might not be enough for our group. She also didn't seem great at identifying the different meats.
author: Victoria S.

description: I like the lamb is fresh enough and they have some special options as well such as Fried tofu sheets pickled cabbage pork blood rice cake.
author: Ting B.

description: Nice alternative for hot pot since our normal joint wasn't open for dinner. Great selection of meats and veggies and service was very good. Ordered the spicy soup and it was nothing short of hot. If you like hot this is the broth to order. Would come back again and recommend to others.
author: Jerry R.

description: I Found this place on yelp and I'm so glad I did.  Best hot pot I've had so far.   Prices are reasonable for all you can eat and drink.  What makes this place stand out from others I've been to is the broths.  You get to choose up to 4.  My personal favorite was the curry followed by the mushroom.  Looking forward to returning and trying other flavors.
author: Shawn A.

description:
My favorite hot pot place in San Francisco. 

THE SOUP BASE!! What do I love most about it? The fact that we get four soups! I recommend everyone to get the beef bone soup and pork bone. Pork bone IS A MUST. Although the menu says select one only, you can pick both. I have tried all the soups and this is what I think:
Pork bone: THE BEST ONE
Beef bone:  LOVE it!
Spicy: Spicy, but not salty enough.
Tomato, Miso and Kimchi: I would pass on it... It's bland.
Pickled cabbage: I honestly really like it. If you like the taste of pickled cabbage, I would definitely get it!

If you want more spicy soup bases, honestly it's not going to be spicy. But, they do have their own sauce bar. It has this chili oil that goes well with the food and has a hint of spice. 

The meat is sometimes good, but sometimes it's just okay. It's a gamble... but majority of the times I've been here it was good! It definitely has a good amount of options in their menu. 

In terms of service, every time I come (honestly I have been here at least 7 times... hahaha) we got great service.

Lines can get long, so try to get there before the dinner rush.. so maybe around 6-6:15.
author: Darlene T.

description: This place is great! My friend and I came on a SF "summer" weekday. The broths were all very flavorful and the ingredients fresh. They also have an efficient iPad ordering system that I appreciated (as opposed to struggling to flag staff down at other places). I'd definitely come back!
author: Cindy G.

description: This was an overall great experience. The service was pretty fast and the quality of the meat was good. The spicy soup broth and tomatoe broth are very strong in flavor, would recommend.
author: Arvin R.

description:
Great food but such a horrendous wait. I came here on a Saturday night for dinner (terrible idea I know) and ended up waiting over 2 hours! I had to go hunt down the waiting list to add my name to it. Then we waited and waited. At a few times during our wait, several tables sat empty. Not a great start. 

Service was good and attentive when we were finally seated. The soup broths are tasty and you get to pick 4 of them! That being said, was it really worth a 2 hour wait? Maybe a 1 hour wait. Nothing is worth waiting 2 hours for!
author: Heidi L.

description:
Our most fav hotpot in SF 
Everything is perfect here.
Recommended.
I actually eat here twice a month
author: Minh D.

description: Amazing customer service! Super fast. Got seated right away. And the food is great, worth the price
author: Arjimy Q.

description: A long line but they take reservations via phone. We had a party of four with a baby and got seated in the back room where it was comfy in the booth under the window. Hot pot places can get too hot but with the window and door ajar, we were fine. You order your food on a plastic sheet and it's all you can eat for $27.99 per person with a $10 per person add on for all you can drink. The food is good.
