It's not frozen stuff and the vegetables are fresh. The plates of meat are small so you can try a few types and not waste food. Beer Beef was on point per my friends. They have Kobe Beef, fish balls, and shrimp and fish pastes which the baby liked. You get a pot with four compartments of broths. We had spicy, tomato, pork bone, and miso broths. They were all tasty and you could really taste the beer flavor in the Beer Beef cooked in the tomato broth. My friend really liked the Wide Vermicelli Noodle but I thought it was too chewy though that's what she liked about it. The service was friendly and attentive. We got our water filled and they checked on us often.
author: Jen L.

description: Good quality of meat. I always come here. Unlimited food. Lovely staff. But it is always busy on the weekend night. Suggest to come early. Thank you
author: Paramee L.

description:
Quality meat
Great service
Great variety
SoupBases are good

Came at 10pm Friday night.  No wait
The four of us feasted. 

The hot pot was large so we could pile all the stuff into it and they were not skimpy on their portions.  Service was efficient and friendly.
author: Pin C.

description: So far the best hot pot that I have ever had in San Francisco. Good service and with really nice desserts. It's worth it to go.
author: Vicky C.

description: Check your bank statements!!!! So my friend and I requested to split the bill in half and we both paid with credit card. We paid a bit over 15% for tips. But when I just checked on my bank statement, they charged me an extra $1.  I asked my friend, and the same thing happened to her. So I am pretty sure this is not a mistake. They probably charge everyone a dollar or two more, thinking no one will notice that small difference. $1 is not a lot, but getting an extra dollar from every bill sure do add up. They are smart, but I am pretty sure this is not legal. This is not even about that $1. I don't mind paying more tips if they deserved it, but changing the amount secretly is just not right.
author: Sarah C.

description:
The hot pot was decent. They ONLY have all you can eat for ~28 per person (adult price). 

What makes this stand out from other places is that they have pots that have four sections, so you can select a broth and three other flavoured soups for your hotpot. I liked the miso flavour and spicy flavoured soups.

They also have a bar for you to make your sauces, and there's quite a lot of choices for sauces. They have sesame sauce, oyster sauce, the asian bbq sauce, and other toppings like scallions, garlic, etc.

Their food is decent too...but there were more than a few issues which is what gives it a 3 star review. First of all, they didn't bring everything that we ordered. They brought out a bunch of food that we ordered, but they never brought out tong ho which we ordered at the very beginning. Also, my friend would ask for more meat and he was very specific ("Three more orders of lamb, please") and the waiter would come back with one plate of lamb or two plates of lamb. This happened multiple times...it was really strange. Also, one of the plates of lamb had issues with the meat. No matter how long I cooked the pieces of lamb on that plate, there was a section that remained SUPER raw/undercooked/red colored. It wasn't just one piece of meat..it was the entire plate. My friends had the same issue too.

So overall, this place is really the definition of yelp's 3 star review which is 'A-OK'... I might try it again to see if it was just a one-off occurrence.
author: Theresa L.

description:
I have no idea why this place have 4.5 stars average, but here is my honest assessment on it, which is far from what it averages. 

I went on a week night but it was semi-busy. People were waiting inside and outside of the entrance. This brings me to a tip; do not sit by the entrance. You will constantly be getting looked at by people waiting. They may also hate you because you take forever and orders 50 dishes, looking like a slob lol. Anyways, just don't sit by the entrance. 

Here are the negatives of my night here:

1.) Let's start first by the dishes they give you for when you get food out of the hotpot to eat on. It is way too small. Not only that, it does not have a decline therefore, the soup spills everywhere when you put food on it from the hotpot. I am thinking this place does it on purpose. Think about it. 

2.) On the first order from the menu, we ordered only a few things because we didn't know how much (or little) food it comes with. Not to my surprise, the quantity was really low and the meats were unbelievably thin. So thin that when you put it in the hotpot, it disappears. Again, the quantity is very low for each dish of food. This makes customer order more food and go through the hassle of it while being deterred from ordering. 

3.) When we ask for the 2nd round, the waiter was running around frantically and waved us off by saying "second order, second order" and threw the menu on our table. We didn't really care about her demeanor because it is an Asian establishment and we didnt come here for 5 star service. What did got on our nerves was when it took 20+ minutes and us asking them twice before they start putting out the food from our 2nd round. 

4.) The seats are very low, it's awkward. It feels like you on sitting on a adult version of a baby  highchair. The table was literally at my upper chest level. It just feels awkward and not comfortable.

5.) They forgot a few things from our menu selection and brought us a dish that we didn't order. 

6.) There is no fan or ventilation in this place like other hotpot places. It definitely need it. It feels like a sauna in here. I feel bad for whoever wore their nice clothing here because it will smell like hotpot for days. The front door was originally propped open for some ventilation, which is suffice, but at some point during my meal it was shut. It could be from customers or the employees. I went and open it but a few minutes later someone shut it again. Annoying. 

I gave this place 2 stars because the food was decent and one of the other waiters apologize to us saying there were "backed up". I understand that but some things were too inefficient. Also, it was a week night. If it was this bad on a weekday, I don't want to be in here on Friday's and the weekends. 

This place absolutely does not deserve 4.5 stars average. Especially not in SF, where there is tons of competition for hotpot restaurants.
author: U L.

description:
This place is steamy!   Seriously, it clears up your congestion and it like eating in a giant humidifier.  Not to mention all of your clothing will smell like hot pot.  

Anyways about the food.  We found that quality of the pretty good, and the staff pretty attentive.  You have a pot of 4 different broths, but personally I think I would have been happy with just 1 or 2, as 4 is a bit overkill for me.  They have a good variety of options and the vegetables seemed pretty fresh.  

Overall a small restaurant to be prepared to share a table or wait a while (or maybe even both).
author: Tiffany C.

description: The service here is fast. No waiting around getting full. There is usually a wait, but they have a waitlist system that give you a text when you're next.
author: A b.

description:
One of my favourite all you can eat hot pot with quality in SF. I admit for hot pot Sf does not have many options and it is very hard to find parkig in GEARY. But if you can, boiling hot pot really worths it.

I came around 8 and many people waiting. The restaurant is not big but they have powerdul electric stove that powers the hot pot. U can choose up to four soup base and my fave is tomato. I usually order beef and lamb  they are with great wuality. I also really love their taiwanese sheet tofu. They fried the sheet tofu and it served warm. It is very good to absorb the soup base and it is veey yummy.
author: Stephanie H.

description:
Chinese hot pot places are made or broken on the strength of their broths, and on that front this place is hands down the best Chinese-style hotpot place in the city. The service is friendly, the prices reasonable. For soup bases, we got:

-The spicy numbing Szechuan broth (incredibly herby and sweet, and not too oily. coats every slices of meat in an intensely satisfying fragrance)
-Tomato broth (a surprise favorite! i would drink this soup on it own)
-The sour cabbage broth

Ingredient-wise, I recommend the beer-marinated jar of beef, the pickled sour cabbage, and fried tofu sheets.

In terms of condiments, I don't feel like a soy sauce / vinegar side dip was necessary. The spicy szechuan soup and tomato soup bases were plenty tasty on their own!
author: Ken H.

description:
I may or may not have been bribed with free snow ice to write a review, BUT I won't factor that into my rating.  

The wait wasn't very long compared to some of the other places in Richmond, we went on a Saturday night but we're only second on the list.  Offerings are pretty standard, but I did enjoy being able to have a choice between 4 different broths and making my own sauces at the sauce bar.  Tomato broth is the way to go!  The beef was tender and yummy and snow ice is the perfect end to a hot pot meal!
author: Jessica L.

description:
Came here for the first time last night. 

We were seated down promptly and received menus. Our server came over and we ordered the Chicken combo with a few soup bases. During our wait for the food, we helped ourselves to the Sauce bar. The sauce bar isn't located in an exactly ideal area of the restaurant and I can imagine it gets crowded. This was a minor thing.

Once our food came we began eating. The food was good, nothing exceptional, but just OK. The rice was much over cooked as well.

During our dinner our original server never came over to us and our water cups were never refilled until we asked.

Overall, it's a good location with OK food.
author: James D.

description: We love their hot pot! And the sauce bar too! You can just mix and match whatever sauce you want to pair with you food. Service is also great.
author: Jaide F.

description: This is one of our favorite places to eat anywhere. When we are in the bay from Sacramento, we go out of our way to come here and eat. Be prepared to come right at 5pm when they open or else there is a long wait and it can be hard to find parking. Parking is free after 6pm on weekends. Food is delicious!
author: Nathan C.

description: This is the really good hot pot. There are lots of soup favor thats really good. Im thai and tom yum goong soup is same as thai originally
author: Noparit T.

description: had a really great time here! the service is fast and friendly, veggies are fresh, and meats are nicely prepared. wish they had more sauces just to make it fun, but i would come back!
author: Christina L.

description:
Way better than I expected.

I passed by this place several times but always skipped by it due to the price (all you can eat) and stuffiness.

But the food quality is on point, the soup bases are flavorful, and they have a great sauce bar and service.
author: Mike L.

description:
I think my reviewed disappeared, but I understand why.  This place didn't have much consistency.   When they first opened everything was so good.  The meat was pretty fresh and service was pretty good.  The more and more I ate here, the quality and the service changed.  Upon my last visit here with my friends , the waitress started out speaking to me in Cantonese.  As the night progressed, it went to Mandarin, and ended with English.  Ok, lady, stick to one language and stop testing my Chinese. 

Ok, let's talk about the food itself.  The meat was pretty good, but like I said it wasn't fresh on some days.   The portions are ok for 2 people for, but small for a party of 3 or more.   I only come back here because of the four different broths.  The spicy one is SUPER spicy.  If you want to spice up your life, go for it.  I did like the herb base the best, followed by the tomato one. I was sad they no longer had the shaved ice the last time i was here.  It was free too!
author: Belinda C.

description: My favorite hot pot place in the city! You get 4 broths, unlimited Kobe beef, and the sauce bar is amazing.
author: David L.

description:
I love this place! Service is a 5 stars  one of my favorite all you can eat hot pot in the city. 
All you can eat for a great price, with lots of choice of meat, veggies, seafood and different types of noodles as well. 
I highly recommend boiling hot pot!
author: Zee Z.

description:
Found this spot on Yelp and saw that it had great reviews so I decided to give it a shot. Came here on a Sunday night around 830p and was seated right away! Service was very attentive and friendly. Restaurant was a little stuffy but it's expected from a hot spot place. There's a huge variety of meat and veggie dishes to choose from. Definitely love the fact that they give you a few options of different soups to choose from. 

Would definitely recommend this spot if you're craving for some good hot pot!
author: Bonnie S.

description: Great place. Terrific atmosphere, great quality, very nice service. Incredible deal for the price. Don't miss this place if you're in SF.
author: Kevan I.

description: Food was great and flavorful. Service was also great.  The server had patience with me and explained how the hot pot worked which was very nice as a first timer.... not to brag or anything but I'm a pro now.
author: Marc G.

description:
Great idea! 4 flavors! Reasonable pricing! There was some confusion with the waitlist but Jessica was very understanding and was very helpful!

I had asked DT for a ladle with holes and he said they were out at the moment but remembered to bring one when one was available. 

Props!
author: David L.

description:
Their Tom Yum and spicy broth are my absolute favorite out of the five that we had to choose. I love the quality of their meat. They also have a sauce stand but there's not that much sauce selections. We came at 5:30 on a Wednesday(?) which is the time that they reopen for dinner. You get a two hour limit to eat. 

The cons:
*The restaurant gets stuffy and windows fog up because there aren't any vents. It's a pain for customers during the winter because the server would have to open up the doors which is understandable. 
*I felt rushed an hour into our meal because they were starting to get slammed for dinner. 
*It was my boyfriend's and my first time here and our waitress seemed a bit irritated because we didn't know what we were doing. We thought that it was a usual hot pot restaurant where each individual chose one broth for themselves. 

Despite the cons, I would come back but only for lunch to avoid the rush.
author: Jennifer L.

description: Customer service is pretty good and for all you can eat $28 its not bad. A good variety of meats and vegetables, and you get to choose 4 soups which is impressive. I really liked the tomato one. There's a make-your-own sauce bar. No wait on a Friday for lunch. I think in terms of value I prefer Grand Hot Pot Lounge better since it's $25 which already includes all you can drink, but this is a good second.
author: Wendy L.

description: Awesome hot pot. Lots of soups to choose from and some interesting desserts. Staff is attentive and friendly. Booths are intimate and music playing on the background sets a relaxed vibe.
author: Yoav G.

description:
The wait is no joke! Use yelp to put yourself on the waitlist, and even then, you still have to wait after your check in time. Reservations are only for parties of 5 or more I believe. 

The great: 4 soups for your hot pot, sauce station, lots of food options, including beer beef (meh) 
All you can eat $28, all you can drink $10 (everyone must participate) 
Comfortable booths!

The bad: condensation from the hot pot may drip back down on you from the ceiling. 

Good hot pot place!
author: Annie H.

description:
Came here for an early Father's Day celebration- one thing I noticed about the place is how clean it is! I like how they have sauce bar so you can pick your own sauces and flavor! 
For $27.95 you can have an at ayce experience - ranging from a good variety of meats, seafood, veggies, and and noodles! You also get a choice of FOUR diff soups! Perfect for any party with multiple tastes! We brought our 22 mth here and it's def family friendly as well! Def will be back!
author: Betty S.

description:
All you can eat hot pot is fun for the whole family! Or just yourself. Not only is the food spectacular - unlimited seafood! - it provides a lucrative and ripe opportunity to #TakeRisks, #FailHard and #FailFast (the failing won't happen until much later when your bowels react) 

As Master Shi-Fu says in Kung Fu Panda 2: if you only do what you know, you will never be more than you are. At Boiling Hot Pot, you can do more - eat more - and be so much more than you are now. Get your ~fuego~ on at Boiling Hot Pot!!!!!!!!
author: Ben Y.

description: Super delicious ayce. Shrimp paste tasted just like har gow only better. It was the veggies that rocked my world.
author: Seth N.

description:
AYCE! And AYCD! 

Amazing prices and great food! For $28 per person you get all you can eat. Plus, they have self serve sauce so you can get as many bowls as you want! I love that they let you pick 4 different times of soups. So good. For $10 more, you can get all you can drink. 

Memorable items:

- beef
- tripe 
- enoki mushrooms

Super service! Definitely coming back!
author: Melissa T.

description: Probably the best hot pot i ever had in bay area! The meat quality is exquisite! Great service. Great beer selection. And the 4 combo soups.... jesus u gotta try it.
author: Eric L.

description:
The experience was great! Great Quality! 

I came here for Father's Day and they gave us free drinks, and a desert if we write a review. We got to get 4 soup bases, the pork bone was my favorite. It had great flavor and taste. You can't skip the Kobe beef, the richness and quality was good. There is a side bar for sauces, but I think that they could have better sauces. The people here are really nice and overall it was great.
author: Surachai W.

description:
Omg so full. Cannot think. Ayce hot pot so aggressive!!

$28 ayce and $10 aycd. This is what happens to you. Be warned. You may not wanna go out after.

The staff was sooo nice and patient considering how often they had to attend to us constantly ordering plate after plate. They did miss a couple things but nothing to sweat about.

Plentiful menu has everything you could ever want. Nice condiments bar. Sake, wine, beers. Rotating hot pots blew my damn mind. Food in general was pretty darn good but how can you really go wrong when you're cooking your own food? Really good low-stress satisfying dining experience with a big group of friends.
author: Vivian H.

description: First timer here and both the food and service was great! I loved that we had a lot of options to choose from. Overall, the service was fair. Some may think that making your own sauces is inconvenient, but it was actually fun and gives customers a chance to explore and create their sauce. Of the meats we ordered, they were all delicious and filling. Definitely worth the money!
author: Cynthia S.

description:
If you know me, you know that one of my favorite things to eat is hot pot ! This place definitely does not disappoint! For an all you can eat place it is different from most other places I have tried. 

It's unique in the sense that within the group you may order 4 broths in the pot and each one is delicious and tasty! We went with the beef bone broth, kimchi soup, miso soup and spicy soup. All of them had great flavor and it was to the point where you really didn't need to dip your food into the dipping sauces. Yes, it's that flavorful!

I also like that they have a diy sauce bar, made it hard to choose the right combo of flavors but I loved it! The menu also gave you  an extensive amount of meats, seafood, dumplings, fish balls and veggies to choose from! The one thing I wanted to try was the shaved ice but we were unfortunately too full to have any! Since it's so close to where I live, I will be back in the future for more hot pot!

Total for 2: $60
author: Stella J.

description: yesssss. another hot pot that is an all you can eat. it is great you get to choose up to 4 soups, the quality is fantastic. also their sauce station is really great. good for big groups or even a solo dinner.
author: Sam E.

description:
The last couple times I came here was on a Monday and a Wednesday and for both times, I did not have to wait too long. I heard good things about this restaurant and it did not disappoint. For all you can eat, with a variety of sauces to choose from, and 4 different choices of broths, it was $27.95 per person. And for the amount of food you get, along with the quality, I thought this was a great deal. 

They have a sauce bar that offers about 14 different things you can mix together: ponzu, soy sauce, garlic, cilantro, onions, chili, salt, etc. And there was a big variety of everything: broth, meats, vegetables, tofu, mushrooms, other sides. The broth choices include pork bone, beef bone, spicy, tomato, miso, kimchi, and pickled cabbage soup. My personal favorites are the pork bone and kimchi soup. The different kinds of meats included lamb shoulder, beef, kobe beef, beer beef, pork belly, chicken breast, tenderloin beef, fatty pork belly, beef tendon, tripe, and so much more. Their cut meats are fresh and always cut thinly so it doesn't take too long cook. They also have meatballs, cuttlefish balls, lobster balls, and the list goes on. Having this many meat options allowed the order to be diverse and well worth the price. On top of the various meat options, there were many different types of vegetables, tofu, noodles, mushrooms, and other side choices to choose from: fresh/frozen/fried tofu, enoki/shiitake/oyster mushrooms, napa cabbage, spinach, winter melon, potato, corn, and vermicelli/egg/udon noodles, etc. The variety of choices allows everyone to order something. Another plus is that the portions are kept at a decent size, which ensures less wasted food and allows you to order more different things.  

Once you have chosen what you would like to order, all you have to do is mark how many plates you would like on the menu with the expo marker. Everything is good quality and has great flavors. The service has always been great and the people that work there is surprisingly nice and attentive. Everything I ordered was handled promptly; so I never felt like I had to order everything at once like other hot pot places. 

I would definitely recommend this AYCE hot pot location to anyone that likes hot pot. You definitely get a bang for your buck and everything is great quality, has great flavors, and there is also great service.   I will definitely be returning to this spot!
author: Victoria H.

description: one of the best hot pots in san francisco. really like how they offer 4 soup bases. the meat selection was good as well.
author: Tommy A.

description: Food poisoning! I was here last night for dinner and everything was fine. Good for the price and food tasted fine. At about 2am my stomach started killing me so I went to the bathroom. I have been back 3 times tonight (and I'm sure this isn't my last). All trips have included vomit. What a fun experience!
author: David S.

description:
You can't beat $28 all you can eat hot pot and $10 all you can drink! The wait can be long but they're great about calling you on your cell when you're table is ready. My friends and I stopped by the local Starbucks as we were waiting! 

Get the beef broth, miso, tomato and spicy! My favorite dishes were house beef, Kobe, shrimp, udon noodles and spinach
author: Grace L.

description: Amazing service, they're super attentive! Must get, house special beef, pork belly, Kobe beef! Love love love all their broths, esp esp the tomato one *droooools! Trust me, get the udon, and make yourself a beef tomato udon noodle soup! Love!!!
author: Cindy C.

description: A very delicious hot pot location in San Francisco! You can choose four different broths and there's a variety of toppings to choose from. Super great service and the food was served extremely quickly. A great place to come with friends and the vibe is very casual. Will return!
author: Kiki C.

description:
When I ate here, this place was called Hot Pot Island. I guess the name has changed? Or maybe change in ownership?

We all did AYCE (but I'm reading in recent reviews that there isn't AYCE offered??) and I can't recall the exact price, but it was standard. The pot is split so that you can have 4 different broths. You can choose which ones you want but I let the restaurant staff give us the first timer variety. My favorite was the pickled cabbage. I'm a sucker for that stuff, so noodles cooked in that broth were so good! Reminded me of Taiwanese noodles. 

There is a condiment/sauce bar. Each sauce is labeled, so feel free to help yourself.

Pretty nice variety of meats to choose from. Loved the beer marinated beef. 

Service was okay. They were quick to refill our water and our broths, but I really hope AYCE is still offered here...
author: Susy C.

description: Amazing place with a great selection of speciality items along the standard hot-pot must haves. Pretty cool because they give you the option to choose 4 different soup bases. The spicy soup wasn't too spicy, but the tomato and miso were delicious. Speedy service and easy dry-erase ordering sheets. 10/10 would recommend!
author: Hanyu Q.

description:
Came here for a AYCE hot pot with 6 of my friends. 

Soup base: this place has interesting soup base where you have 4 choices instead of normally 2. 

Toppings: meats are fresh and the shrimp/fish paste was really good.

Besides, there is a sauce station!!!!!

Will definitely come back next time.
author: Ruxin H.

description:
First time here today, food was great, service was even better! All you can Eat for $28 per person isn't too bad considering what their menu has to offer. I love how they have a sauce bar on the side where you can make your sauce however you like and as much as you like instead of other places that make it for you or charge you for it. They also have a All you can Drink for $10 which is such a good price! I would have gotten that if I didn't have work tomorrow. Another great thing I love about this place is that they let you select 4 type of soups to use which is awesome, because you can have a variety of flavors from each different soup to find the best one to fit your needs. Lastly the portions that they serve are so generous, much better than alot of other hot pot places. So overall its a great experience and place to come to for AYCE hot pot around San Francisco! Definitely will come back again in the future! 

Just a heads up, I would avoid the marinated tenderloin beef, it has a weird marinate flavor but everything else is perfect! Lamb was the best meat in my opinion!
author: Christopher G.

description:
I'm rating this spot a 3.5. I was decently satisfied with my meal at Boiling Hot Pot. It's one of the better hot pot places  I've had in the city. A huge plus was that you're able to have 4 different soup bases at the same time. 

+ Pork Bone & Beef Bone soup bases were soo good 
+ $10 AYCD includes wine, 4 different beers, sake!
+ Kobe beef was the best meat 
+ Fish tofu, fish fillets were both really good
- The beer marinated beef was really weird.. i would not recommend unless you like unusually soft and pinkish beef
- The service was really slow, and they forgot to serve us a few of the plates we ordered.
- Stuffy when the door is closed, really cold when the door is open
author: Estelle C.

description: This hot pot is pretty good and it has many decision of base flavors. The meat and veggies are fresh!
author: Holly Z.

description: Freakin amazing spicy and miso soup! Great kobi and fatty pork belly . The waiters could use a bit slower pace of giving instructions bc I couldn't understand much with thick accent. They were great at service and really polite overall. All the meats we ordered were fresh and delish. Recommend going after 8 so you get table right away on fri nites. Great spot to actively eat with friends and hear drunk people laugh hysterically in the background (this chick was laughing so hard trying to impress this young fob dude last night bc I think he's balling, either that or she forgot her wallet on purpose.) Check them out.
author: Eric K.

description:
If I could give 3.5 stars I would. Anyways......

Not as good as it was before when I tried it summer of 2017, or sometime in 2017. Had it again last week and and felt a major difference in employees and food quality. It is a pro that you get to make your own sauce and get to choose 4 broths (wished there were more broth selections) but otherwise I have other hot pot places to go to. 

My parents and I (a party of 3) entered at around 515pm on a Friday and we were welcomed....but was told to sit at the big table that seats a party of 6 with two pots. We told the server we would like a booth, obviously because we had a party of 3, because it's more family style and easier to share and eat together. But he insisted that we sit at the big table and assured us that we wouldn't have to share the table.... bruh do you know what you are doing? The restaurant is empty but you want to seat a party of 3 at a table of 6-8 with two pots????? What if a party of 6-8 comes in??? We insisted that we wanted the booth and we FINALLY got it literally 5 times later insisting we wanted the booth. Few minutes later, another party of 3 walks in and they were also told to sit at the big table and insisted that they wouldn't have to share blah blah blah but the party of 3 also wanted a booth. I was SO irritated. 

Been here before and my parents and I assume that they had changed owners or something... My credit card bills says that it's called Hot Pot Island???? Anywaysssss... my point here being is that I don't want to have to argue to get seated at a booth and get irritated knowing it should've been a smooth process getting a seat and knowing I was gonna eat good food. Service afterwards was pretty good tho without a doubt.
author: Vivian F.

description:
The customer service is pretty good and the food comes out pretty fast. It's interesting that you get to choose 4 different soup bases and the meats are pretty fresh. The watermelon juice is really refreshing as well! I would recommend this to others to eat. 

Disclaimer: I was asked to write a review for dessert. The review is honest though.
author: Justine T.

description: This is my favorite Hot Pot place in the world!! not only do they have all you can eat but for an extra 10$ its all you can drink as well. My friends and I love to come here on Friday nights before we go out to have dinner and enjoy the atmosphere and company. I highly recommend it!!! The service is also incredible.
author: Norman K.

description: My favorite hot pot in the city. Good quality, flavorful soup bases/sauces, all your favorite ingredients like tong ho, taro, etc. Reasonably priced beer. Not an everyday kind of meal, but a great way to spend time with your friends and eat a communal dinner together. 10/10 would hot pot again.
author: Dan C.

description:
ENDLESS POSSIBILITIES. 

I have to say this is by far the best hotpot, I'm sorry, I meant, best restaurant in the entire San Francisco district. 

FOOD:
1) Unlimited amounts of choice of meat, veggies, sides, sauces
2) Fresh everything. There is no odor on any meat or unqashed veggies. 
3) Truly fit to each customers taste
4) Quail eggs made my bf feel like it was Easter every day in the hot pot.
5) Kimchi soup is best!

SERVICE:
1) Super friendly staff, catering to your every need
2) Mentioning of promotions in the restaurant
3) Homey feel - you get to write wishes on notes and put in bottles hung around the restaurant
4) FREEEEEEE SHAVED ICE FOR DESSERT
5) Honorable Mention #1 Server: Mason

ATMOSPHERE:
1) Music you can sing to every song - its bumpin' !
2) Comfortable booths as seating
3) Nicely lit for a more intimate setting

I would definitely come back!
author: Crystal H.

description:
We were able to make a reservation for a large party of 17 (2 tables) on a Saturday night and were seated on time. The service is pretty good considering it's all you can eat. I'd suggest to select your next rounds ahead of time so the waiting time is cut down. AYCDrink comes with a selection of beers, sake, and wine- everyone at your table needs to opt in for it.

It's Chinese style hotpot. There's a sauce bar and the pots have 4 sections for soup. Get the pork bone soup! The AYCE hotpot had a variation of meats, veggies, tofu, mushrooms, balls, and noodles. Kobe beef and fatty pork belly were standouts.
author: Jessica L.

description:
Go exactly at 5pm when they open or you'll have to wait a long time in the cold. The wait is horrendous. Maybe today was especially bad because IPOT was closed for lunar New year and everyone had to settle for another place like this but the wait was not worth the meal. 

The hot pot comes with 4 soup options which is really overkill especially for small groups because you're just constantly reaching around or moving the pot and made eating a hassle. They weren't too flavorful to me except the spicy broth which was just really spicy. Miso tasted like a foot and the tomato broth wasn't intense on the tomato flavor.

Kobe wasn't as marbled as I expected and when our server gave us our meat he recited them in Mandarin assuming we understood... All the thinly sliced meats are fine but I've seen better marbling at other places.

Some positives were the fried tofu skin, sauce bar and the mango milk (even though it's literally milk and syrup/jelly blended together).
author: Christine L.

description: Great food and services. Everything is fresh. We like their soup bases which you will get four different kinds of them. Snow flakes are good too. We like strawberry and green tea. Will come back the other day!!!
author: Henry C.

description: Excellent selection of soup broths all with lots of flavor with a large menu and good sauce bar. Fun for big groups of family and friend. The all you can eat deal is a steal.
author: Mia G.

description:
AYCE and AYCDRANK for two people $82 that is a steal. I honestly don't know how this place makes money cause I feel I can eat so much here.

Came on a Friday night at 7 and it was packed. Probably waited 30+ min for our table. Tip if you have 5+ people you can make a reservation. Or if you want to share a large circle table with another 2 person party you can move up the line cause there are two hot pots at the big tables.

Soup broths (spicy, pork, beef, miso, kimchi, sour cabbage) and you can pick 4!

We ordered all kinds of meat: lamb, kobe beef, beef, fatty pork belly, it was all delicious.

Other items: quail eggs, noodles, lobster balls, fish balls, shrimp, the list continues

The service was great and I loved our bartender who made sure the hot sake and blue moon beer was always filled
author: Joy M.

description:
Eh, there are many things about this place that I am just not a fan of. I'm sorry to sound picky but...

- Why are the pots split that way? What's the point of the tiny middle section?
- It's so hard to rest the dippers/strainers. They keep slipping into the broth! Maybe invest in the ones with the little hooks so you can hook them to the edge of the pot.
- The booths are so low but tables so high. Arms/elbows were not comfortable...
- Most important of all: quality of the beef is awful! Worse than other AYCE places I've had.
- Who invented beer beef? It's gross.
- This is just a personal preference but I really wish they had watercress :(
- And the sauce bar? Pfft, tasted like old stuff sitting out.

But...the tofu skin, tong ho, and pumpkin were really good...
author: Thao T.

description:
My favorite hot pot in SF! I come here every time I'm in town. Love the mushrooms, all you can eat/drink and the service is tops! 
Do yourself a favor and come to Boiling Hot Pot!
author: Jen F.

description: Very friendly staff. Remembered my girl and I who eat here at least 2-3 times per month. We always have a great experience!! Good music. Waiting list is always accurate. Great prices- we definitely get our money's worth pretty easily!! This is by far our favorite Hot Pot spot in the city!!
author: Gian D.

description: Always a great time with friends. Best hot pot mushrooms in the Bay. Hard to beat the value and quality of Booking.
author: Zachary S.

description: Food is good. Service is A+++. Price is reasonable and location is nice with easy access to tea places after you eat. Cant really complain.
author: Cram Z.

description: Went here for the first time with my husband and girl friends! We made reservations, so seating us on a Friday night was not a problem for us. The amazing concept about this restaurant is that we can order a total of 4 broths :) the turnover of orders was also fast and the waiters were very attentive. I would definitely come here again!
author: Jessica Mae T.

description:
It is the best hotpot food in SF,we had a few times 
 That we were cooking and we took shots somebody  got buzzed!!!!
author: Dirty D.

description:
This is the first place I've been to where you can get 4 different soup bases in one pot!

We got tomato (interesting), kimchi (alright), porkbone (alright), spicy (tasted like spicy water - it's pretty spicy though). The were all decent for the most part, but they're weren't super good. 

There is also a pretty decent sauce bar where you can make your own sauce mixture.

The meats were all good and the veggies were fresh. No complaints there. 

There are TVs around. We pretty much watched the whole Warriors game while we were there and eating. 

Like their FB page and get a free shaved ice dessert. I got mango with lychee and I was super full, but I ate all of it because it was really good.

Overall, decent spot for hot pot.
author: Sophia Y.

description: This place has bowls that allow up to 4 soups, I like having the variety! The soups they serve were good but nothing outstanding. The meat we had was ok, I preferred the premium pork and the special beef. I would not bother with the kobe, I wasn't very impressed with it. I had a strawberry milk, it was strawberry milk. Lol I was seduced by the offer of a snowflake for a review, I took it and i also snapped a photo of it and here is my review. Service was good they brought food quickly and water cups were kept filled. Over all this was a good experience, would I do it again? Maybe but there are other better hot pot establishments.
author: Kris C.

description: This honestly has to be one of the best hot pot places I've ever been in. The broths were so flavorful AND the service was amazing!! Everything here was amazing! The only reason why i didn't give it 5 stars, was because of the wait time, but I don't blame them. It really has to do more with how many people are there. The great thing about this place is that you can register yourself on there waitlist through yelp while you're on your way, or whatever the case. Never going to any other hot pot location, again. This will forever be my go-to hot pot place!
author: Cynthia M.

description:
This is my go to place for hot pot in the city. Sure it has the most generic name ever, but the food delivers in taste and quality!

First off: 4 different broths that you can choose from in one pot. Recommended: Spicy, Tomato, Kimchi, Pork...basically you can't really go wrong. Based on personal preference

Things to note: AYCE for I believe $27.99 before tax+tip. LARGE variety of what you can order (my personal favorite is the house special beef, although kobe beef is much leaner). You can also request for leaner cuts if necessary. Make your own sauce. 

Tons of vegetables. Tons of fishball and other options. This place gets pretty packed so I would recommend making a reservation if you're going with a group of 6 or more!
author: Andrew C.

description:
First meal in San Francisco and we glad we eat here.
The miso soup is the best soup broth of them all. We had a Beef soup, Miso Soup, Korean spicy, and a. Spicy Soup.  The snowflake ice is a must have here.
author: Chan T.

description: Great place! First time eating here and our server Sohand was great! Fully described the menu to us, has a great positive attitude and always came to check on us if we needed anything. The food was really good too! I asked for an iPhone 6 charger to borrow for an important phone call and he lent it to us without a doubt. Will definitely come back here and recommend this place to friends and family!
author: Tim M.

description: Below average hot pot restaurant, soup is very basic and meats are not marinated well at all, most of the tofus taste like they're from frozen packages, would not say the buffet is worth the $27
author: John G.

description: Very satisfied! Normally don't have too much expectation for the quality but the quality is good and satisfying. Like the special beef and Shimpmix蝦滑, and squid. Good value for the money. The only thing is it is too small, I would suggest it to remove the bar table and put two more dining table there.
author: Kelvin Y.

description:
Ramen is definitely my most reviewed restaurant type. I think hot pot might be my second. I've been to many hot pot restaurants all over the Bay and my reviews range from 2 to 5 stars. Boiling Hot Pot gets a five because it's up there among my favorites. It's always a plus when a hot pot restaurant does AYCE for a decent price. Even better when the meat quality is good. But Boiling Hot Pot is the only one that does all this AND has a station for you to make your own dipping sauce. I love options and Boiling Hot Pot gives you ALL the options here.

And when I say ALL the options, I mean that it even extends to the broths. Not only is there like 8 broths to choose from but each pot can hold up to 4 broths. One small broth in the center and three surrounding it. If you come with friends and can't decide on what broth to get, fear not! You can all get your favorite broths and maintain your friendship. My favorite is the herbal broth (it always is), but I think the beef bone broth is pretty good too. 

If you are early and waiting for your friends, I must warn you that it smells very very good outside the restaurant. You will really be putting your stomach to the test waiting right in front of Boiling Hot Pot. It'll all be worth it once you enter though.
author: Philip W.

description: This is the best Hotpot that I've had in SF so far. The meat is very fresh and the broths are amazing. This place is definitely my go to and the waiters are very nice and helpful.
author: Londonn M.

description: I really liked it. I don't usually eat hot pot, but everything we got was delicious. The spicy broth is very spicy. The country music that was playing was a little confusing. But hey, keep San Francisco weird.
author: Steve B.

description:
Like the other reviews, this place was fantastic.  The food is fresh, especially the veggies and service is good.

Some of things that made it delish:  fresh taro, pumpkin, udon, seafood mix, flat fried tofu, oyster mushroom, enoki mushrooms... and the house beef.  That in itself makes for a great meal.

And the broth... liked the miso.. nice flavor without being overpowering.  And the beef and pork broths were good.  We tried the tomato which a lot of people liked, but we weren't too crazy about it.

Overall, a good value and delish food.  We will be back.
author: Tom N.

description:
Because of limited space, they will start timing you on the reservation time, if you made one. It's pretty busy and popular here. They have attentive service but would forget a thing here or there. But that's pretty normal.

Aside from the seats in the front of the restaurant, there are additional tables in the back. It can get kind of cold until you start your hot pot. They also have a sauce bar in the middle of the restaurant.

The food is pretty good. Huge selection. Special shout-out to the udon, which was still chewy after being soaked and forgotten for awhile. Loving the fact that their hot pot has 4 chambers for 4 different flavors.

And lastly, their snow ice is small but tasty. If you write a review, they may give you a free one. ;) That's not why I'm writing this review though. Just kidding. Maybe.

On a serious note, would come back here for hot pot. Pleasant service and had a fun time with friends. AYCE $27.99 or something like that.
author: C. C.

description:
I went there with my friend for Mid-Autumn Festival to celebrate. It was an okay wait, the place is kinda small. They didn't want to seat us at the big table so we ended up waiting for about 10-15 minutes with NO ONE ahead of us. The food was $25/ person, I think $10 more for drinks. Yes it was all you can eat so that was pretty cool. We got a few plates of meat and a few plates of veggies. We got to choose 4 soup base, remember the "main" one is very small so don't expect it to be large, you can always ask for soup refill if your soup base is low.

We got to try 4 soups, a lot of meat, but we felt like something was missing. Our waters weren't refilled, and they didn't mention there were sauces available to us by the kitchen. She even asked if it was our first time. They need to be a little bit more accommodating when it comes to first time customers.

I've definitely been to better hot pot places for the same price but because it's really close to where I live I might come back again, other than the 4 soup bases, nothing special. Long wait, okay food, okay people.
author: Kimberly W.

description: This is my third time here. That, in itself says a lot. I love the variety and the meat here is delicious. So many selections, it can be overwhelming. The servers are really nice and they're helpful for first timers. Looking forward to coming here again!
author: Michael S.

description: Great service here. The online wait list works pretty good, still had to wait a little bit but not a problem. Can't say enough about our waiter though. Would come again. Got a free dessert for writing the review. Everything was very fresh. Noisy!!
author: Ivan L.

description: Super delicious!!!You can't not missing the hot pot is best in Bay Area. The meat fresh. The all material is very good. We have a nice dinner today night.I will come back again for sure.
author: 雅筑

description: A great variety of selection for hotpot from seafood to veggies to meat to drinks and dessert!!!
author: Jonathan H.

description:
Came here based on high 4.5-star Yelp review, and it was okay.

Food was okay as was the sauce options. The best part was probably the broth choices.

For the service, there were a few gaffes. Specified "2" was quantity on several choices during the initial order on their menu, and only got a single quantity of all these choices. So if you have a favorite item, you'll need to order multiple times despite the "quantity" column. Also, during the third order, they "lost" the menu order that they had taken from us, so they only discovered this when they came back to our table asking if we were interested in free desert, and we told them we were still waiting for an order. They came back with the order quickly this time, however, they gave a different item than one that we had selected. Furthermore, there was a long black hair in the dish containing the vegetable. Not very appetizing. Free desert was an option if we were to write a Yelp review for them. We decided not to, as I write this review the next day.

We've had better all-you-can-eat hot pot elsewhere, so the Yelp star ratings aren't necessarily the only item you should see before making your decision on where to go.
author: Stephen L.

description:
Probably the best hot pot spot in SF at the moment in terms of food quality and price. Been here three times now and...

- the beef is always marbled 
- everything is generally fresh
- large selection of items (ranging from seafood and vegetables) 
- Love the huge sauce bar
- unlimited yummy cold cucumber and Chinese kimchi
- AYCE + AYCD options both available! 
- their pot allows you to try 4 broths at each time!
author: Katherine C.

description: This is our fav hot pot spot the food is always fresh and tasty, besides their meat selection they also have lots of veggie options. Great service. $10 all you can drink is kinda dangerous. Wait may be somewhere 45+ mins but def worth it. Check it out.
author: Mutlu T.

description: I like the fact that you can choose four different soups, and the large selection of food. They have mala spicy sauce in their make your own sauce station. We came on Christmas day, and they were pretty busy that day - we waited around an hour. However, other days they are less busy, and if you come right when they open
author: Michael C.

description: This place is legit!  Lots of options -- 4 different soup bases available in each pot a well stocked sauce bar and several meats, seafood, and vegetarian choices.  We will be back!!
author: Viv S.

description:
A very unique hot pot place. You get a choice of 4 soup bases and at $27 you get all you can eat of a variety of options. 

I ordered multiple plates of Kobe beef, tendon, lamb, chicken, and their beer beef is untraditionally great. 

They also have a separate sauce station where you can whip up your own concoction, and as much as you like.  

Our waiter was attentive, and refilled my water glass as soon as it was low. He also came out with our order of food quickly. 

A tip, double up on your Kobe beef orders because they come out in small portions but are sooo good!
author: Tiah T.

description:
If only I could give a 0/5 stars for this place... I genuinely do not understand why this place receives such great reviews. I've been to my own fair share of hot pot & AYCE hot pot places, but my experience here takes the cake--it was TERRIBLE!

I do not care about how much I have to pay, but I really believe in "you get what you pay for" and the $27 AYCE here was not worth it. 

 I had two waiters serve my party and they weren't memorable. In fact, they rarely came around. I found myself having to get up to go get them TWICE. It was not a busy night & I'm pretty understanding when it comes to being overwhelmed so I don't mind getting up to flag them down, but the ground was wet? I had to be really careful. Be really careful here because for a hot pot restaurant they have no ventilation. It was stuffy & hard to see my friend from across the table because it was foggy. Steam was everywhere and condensation gathered on the ceiling and floors. At one point it dripped on my head... uhm.... bye.... Anyway, the table was really awkward too in terms of space and height, I had to stand up to get my food and I'm 5'5." 

Regardless, their meat quality wasn't terrible; however, their sauces were mediocre and the hot pot broths were really bland. Also, don't get the marinated tenderloin beef!! 

TLDL; save yourself the trouble and try other great places Richmond/SF has to offer. I genuinely felt like I wasted my time and money and I'm never coming back.
author: Mandy P.

description: Great hot pot and wonderful service!! Each portion was the right size so we got to sample a lot of stuff. Got to pick 4 broths to have at the table so it was always a little different and the sauce bar was really awesome with endless combinations. Definitely coming back!!
author: Liz C.

description: This was our first time and it was so yummy! We loved all of the different choices in food,the staff was super friendly and the different broths were tasty. For the great price I would definitely come back!!
author: James L.

description: I enjoy this establishment.  It's delicious.  I also enjoy the staff.  It's soooooooooo good and I want my free snowflake.  How long do these have to be to be reviews instead of tips?  I'm not sure, but I'm going to keep typing until yelp tells me I can stop, because I want my free snowflake.
author: Shawn J.

description: We had a really fun experience at this hot pot restaurant! We went on a Friday night and paid $30 each for 4 different broths, and unlimited meats, fish, vegetables, tofu etc. We also paid $10 each for unlimited beer and sake. The service was attentive and fantastic. I can't wait to go back.
author: Caitlin P.

description:
Terrible service. Feel like the restaurant is trying everything to cut corners, maximize revenue, and not caring about customers. 

We were told it's 'last call' an hour after we sat down, even though the menu said it's 2 hours maximum per table. A bit later they had the nerve to ask us to hurry up and leave to make space for new customers, and the waiter made up some lie about the typical max time is 90 minutes. I get they want to make more money, but this is not the right way. He argued on top of that the timer starts when you sit down not when the food comes. Well we didn't get served until 15 minutes has passed.  

On a minor note, I ordered shrimp the moment I sat down and only got 5 an hour after as part of the 'last call'
author: Robert L.

description: I love this place, 5 Stars service. I love the Kobe beef. You can also choose 4 differ soup bases.
author: Summer W.

description: Decent food but not high quality of ingredients being used.  I have been to better but very good for the price.
author: George Y.

description: I'm a hot pot fan, this little place is super friendly with high quality beef, the soup is great and I sure left the place happy and full!
author: Thanathip A.

description: This place is amazing!! My husband and I come here almost every other weekend. I'm originally from Chongqing China, I'm a huge fan of spicy hotpot, this place is my favorite hotpot restaurant in SF. Food is very fresh. Service is good as well. Strongly recommend!! I would recommend people to come before 6pm because after that you might need to wait for 1-2 hours on the line.
author: Xia H.

description: Just moved back to US after living in Asia for a few years. Thank god this restaurant is legit Chinese hotspot (every other spots have been disappointing). Highly recommended!
author: Jimmy Y.

description: Tell you what.... best hot pot this side of the city. Amazing servers, delicious food!! Come here and get stoked!!!!!!!
author: Mark D.

description: 1st time here. Great food great service! Meat quality was top grade. Highly recommended
author: Bailey L.

description:
It's alright. The food taste decent, and it's all-you-can-eat. But the service is pretty slow so the speed of serving end up being the bottleneck on how much you can eat.

My group gave up on ordering certain dishes because they are small ones and we really needed to optimize for large plates of meat so we wouldn't starve.
author: Joseph L.

description: The best hot pot I ever had. I especially love their beer beef and the way they cook their soup. Hardly find a good hot pot like this in Bay Area. Customer service is wonderful. Thanks Jessica for helping us to find the best food we want and recommending the soups. Definitely going to be back to this restaurant again in the future!  Addicted to this restaurant after the first try!!
author: Jiaqi P.

description: A good place to have some testy Hotpot dinner and singing Karaoke with friends. Plus the drink is free.
author: Cathy R.

description:
I looked in Yelp to find a new hot pot place. They got 4.5 starts on Yelp so I give it a tried. We sat down and the woman work there asked me if I want to write them a 5 stars Yelp review to get a free beer or soda. I thought ok, I will write one for them if they are good but I dint take the offer of free drink. Turn out the hot pot is not good at all for many reason and I had hot pot all the time. 
What upset me is they  not honest with the business. Try IPot if you want a hot pot. They have 4 stars on Yelp but it way better then this place.
author: Mai T.

description:
The soup broth is probably the best I've had in the Bay Area so far, however the meat/vegetable selection is limited and quality falls below standard for me.

Seems like a place for college students. The restaurant itself is a little dirty. Bathrooms are dirty and the sauce station is buffet style, could be maintained a little better. 

The service is great. The servers are really friendly and take care of you. I would give the service 4-5 stars.
author: Mimi T.

description:
Another long overdue review haha. I wish Yelp would give us the option of giving half stars. This place is a 3.5 instead of a 4.

Hot Pot Island, sounds like a place where all people do is bask in broth in a hot pot. 

Tried this place out sometime during the summer last year with a couple of my girlfriends. We were the first group to come in, so we didn't really know what to expect.

Pros: 
- Located along Geary by other restaurants and dessert places.
- Rather than picking what broth you want, you are given the best of all worlds. Meaning, you get ALL broths! (Tomato broth, House special broth, Spicy miso broth, and something called "Nourishing broth")
- Unlike traditional Hot Pot places, YOU are in control of what you want by simply marking down what veggies, seafood, condiments, and meats you want.
- Nice atmospheres with comfortable booths. They can also accommodate bigger parties since they have round tables. 
- Accepts cash and card

Cons:
- Workers are a hit or miss here.
- Parking is hard even though you have the option of street parking or parking in a nearby public lot (it costs moolah though)
- Not a big fan of some of their broths.
- The quality of some of the foods were superb as compared to others. It depends on when you decide to go here, I suppose. 
- Business was slow despite only about 2 groups, including my group, dining at that particular day. 

Overall, another decent hot pot place with a nice concept of giving diners an opportunity to try out different broths rather than being limited to two. The service could use some work, but otherwise, it's an O-K place in my book.
author: Jerianne G.

description:
Best Hot Pot In SF!!!!!!!!!
Awesome Service and Variety!!!!!!!!!

David the waiter is super nice and helpful, I have been to several hotspots in SF and NY and Massachusetts!!!

This place is impeccable and delicious!!!!
author: Charles B.

description:
This place is bomb.com! At $30 per person after tax :p there was no wait when we arrived at 7:00pm- busy but not crowded- the rooms are well ventilated so feel free to wear work clothes in.

Favorite items are the fish paste, lamb, and exploding fish balls (couldn't order them but our pot came with 5 large balls w/ roe in them)

All-you-can-drink is an additional $10- pretty good deal for SF- maybe not the best for putter Richmond AYCE spots :p I'd come back though!
author: James L.

description:
Two of us came here around 8pm on a Saturday night and were seated at a communal table with another couple within 5 minutes.  For $28 for all you can eat, we had a very satisfying dinner.
- Soup bases - you can try four different ones with a single pot.  We had the spicy, beef bone, pork bone, and Miso.  All of them were pretty good, but none of them were outstanding.
- Dipping sauce bar - a pretty decent selection of condiments that you can mix together to make your own unique sauce.
- Meats and vegetables - we tried a ton of stuff ... Lamb, pork belly, beef, tripe, fish balls, winter melon, corn, spinach, Napa cabbage, enoki, egg noodles.  The lamb was definitely the star - really well marbled and absolutely delicious.  I'd come back here just to eat a few plates of the lamb.
author: Simon L.

description:
Came here a year ago but just never got around to writing a Yelp review for this place. 

My friend and I were going to go Little Sheep for dinner but when we got there, the line was cray cray and the wait to get a table was like 2 hours long so I hopped on Yelp to look for another place to eat. This place popped up under Hot and New, so I called them to ask them how was the wait, to which she replied "No wait." So my friend and I got back into her car and drove all the way from DT to Richmond. 

Upon our arrival, we were seated right away and had a comfy booth. My friend and I had some soju cocktails as well. 

Things I love:
1. The different kinds of soup!!!! So unique! Usually places charge you more if you want more than one soup but here, you get 4!!!
2. They have a sauce bar so you don't have to keep asking for sauce.
3. The menu here is extensive! There's different kinds of meat, veggies and noodles.

I've been wanting to come back to this place but I've since moved to San Jose but this place is definitely on my list of places to go back to if I ever crave hot pot in the city!
author: Kelly L.

description: First time at a hot pot style restaurant and I had a great meal!! Got the Kobe beef combo plate and split it with a friend. Very good deal for a dinner under $25 for 2! You get a choice of 4 broths and we chose the beef bone broth and the tomato, miso and spicy with a pork bone base. Looking forward to coming back!
author: meg r.

description: Boiling Hot Pot is an awesome place if you're looking for home-y delicious hot food for a good price. Don't be fooled by $27 menu, WE ATE A RIDICULOUS AMOUNT!
author: Hande T.

description: This is a post meal review and I'm so full and satisfied right now. I waited for more then an hour but it was actually worth every minute! Will be coming back for more
author: Kevin K.

description:
All you can eat hot pot for $27.99!
If you want to also add on all you can drink it is an additional $10.00 which includes sake, beer and soda.

The all you can eat includes 1 to 3 different soup bases and we tried:
Water, beef bone soup, miso soup and kimchi soup.

Some of the proteins you can choose from are lamb, Kobe beef, beer beef(which was tender and tasty) pork belly, all sorts of fish or lobster balls and beef tendons.

Some other ethnic meats include tendon, tripe, pork blood rice cakes and spam.

Some of the seafood variety include- fresh shrimp, octopus, mussel, fish tofu and fish gluten. 

Some of the tofus they have are- fresh, frozen and fried tofus. Enoki, oyster, shiitake mushrooms. Veggies include Napa, tong ho and spinich to name a few.

There are other al a cart items which include cold sales, beer pitchers, snow ice and other juice drinks.

One last observation- there is a sauce bar that includes do it yourself sauces.

Overall- this place is decent and for the price value and variety- not bad. It reminds me of fiery hot pot in the sunset but at a cheaper price.
author: Yvonne F.

description: OMG, every time, this place can surprise me, good food, good service and a welcoming environment. Ok, firstly, they have a TON OF FOOD OPTIONS, they have seven or eight choices even just got hot pot base soup, and they have the great meats which are fresh and also they have fresh greens, and the good thing is they will give u anything in a great portion, you know, some hot pot places, they are like so concerned about we canny finish, but not in this one. And really good service. Definitely I will go again, and recommend my friends to go
author: Yih R.

description: One of the best places in SF for chinese hotpot. Special pot design allows you to have four different flavors of soup. The house special beef is my favorite, thinly sliced beef dipped in garlic soy sauce is pure AWESOMENESS!!! Only thing is make sure you make a reservation or prepare fpr a long long wait
author: Ivan T.

description:
All you can eat at a reasonable price sounded great until you realize only half of your orders make it to the table.  I had to constantly remind staff or reorder from the menu because the orders were 'forgotten'.  Service was slow and staff seemed overwhelmed.

Also steam from hotpot formed condensation on the ceiling and were dripping down into my husband's plate. gross.  Thank goodness it was after we finished the meal.  maybe some ventilation?
author: Angel W.

description:
Very good hot pot, all you can eat in a very reasonable price
There were a variety of meat and vegetables that I've never tried before and it was fun challenging new stuff! 

yay for free shaved ice:)
author: Miki T.

description: Service were the best of all the hot pot place I have been to , good vibe , good soup base and good people there
author: Jamie Y.

description: Really good! I enjoyed their spicy soup and their selection in meat. Price is decent. 27.95 all you can eat, cant complain .
author: Jasper Y.

description:
It was my very first time visiting in Boiling Hot Pot and We were really impressed. We arrived kinda late around 9pm since they close at 10pm, the waiters tried their best to extend our last call to have enough food for us to have. 
Not only the services, but also the food was really good too. Especially the soup bases are awesome!! You guys must try kimchi soup and port bone soup definitely.!!
author: Go Eun L.

description: Decided last minute to go! Worth the wait! Love going here. Long line! We stay long though to eat a lot! I'm stuff! I like the tempura. Love my custom sauce!
author: Krystalle Jayne M.

description: Awesome place, great service, love all you can eat and we will defos be back :). The pork gone soup is amazing l! Get it! # foodcoma
author: Shiyu Z.

description:
Really nice that you get to have four soup bases! The Kim chee and miso bases are my fave. The sauce bar is really nice too with all the standard options: satay, sesame oil, garlic, and a few different spicy options. Their yogurt soju is so so tasty!! 

Would be nice if they had dumplings on their menu, but otherwise it is a very full, love the bamboo and pumpkin! And yummy mango fluffy ice!
author: Katherine C.

description:
My wife and I visited this place last night for the first time. They offered all-you-can-eat hotpot for $27 and you can pick whatever sauce you want. All you can drink comes with additional $10

Food is good but the staffs had a few times missed our selection on menu, and to order you have to write on the menu, however the pen given to us was not smooth to use.

Also, the place is too small... Come on, all you can eat, which means people would like to challenge their stomach limit and it can take 1+ hours. They only have about 10 tables in total, and we waited more than 1 hour to get our number called
author: Jiangyue Z.

description: Great Hot Pot place located in the Richmond district! The meat and vegetables are fresh. Quality customer service and great experience overall.
author: Willis C.

description: Great hotpot place.  Waited around 2 hours.  Worth the wait.  I wish there was more hotpots like this in Washington DC area.
author: David N.

description:
I came on a Saturday at 7PM without a reservation and got seated in 10-15 minutes. 

I was excited that we had the option to choose 4 different broth flavors as most other hot pot places are usually 2 flavors max. My most favorite to least favorite flavors:  Beef Bone, Tomato, Miso, and Kimchi. I love kimchi BTW (I'm Korean), but the soup was intensely spicy. I have a high tolerance for spicy food but it wasn't kimchi-spicy, more like a deep heat from pepper flakes spicy. 

My favorite meats were the Kobe beef, special beef, beef tendon, and pork belly. There's tons of veggie options but I'd recommend to be adventurous and try some of the unusual choices - woodear mushrooms (yum!), lotus root, taro, etc. 

Service was attentive and not passively pestering you to leave as the line of customers grew. Overall great experience and will be coming back.
author: Jennifer C.

description: Located on Geary Blvd. in the Outer Richmond Boiling Hot Pot is very good. The veggies were fresh and ample selection of meats. However this best thing about Boiling Hot Pot was their multiple (4) soup base pots. You can get more than the usual 2 types of soup bases. It is AYCE at $28 which is a bit high but it's San Francisco. You make your own dipping sauces. The restaurant is not big and business is brisk so in peak hours expect a wait. Service was friendly and good, street parking so you get the luck of draw. One draw back is the ventilation. The room is steamy and at the end of the night your clothes will let others know you ate Hot Pot for dinner.
author: George F.

description: Great hot-pot place! I'm not from the area but I always come here when I'm visiting SF. The wait sometimes sucks but I love the meat and all the different sauces that you can make on your own as well as all the different soup bases. I love variety and choices! Perfect place when you have a large group
author: Jennifer N.

description: group of 5 of us tried this place first time and we all enjoyed the food. they provide 4 different soup base and there are many options to choose from. Meat and Vegetables were fresh, seafood was pretty good also. Very friendky waiter, place is a bit loud but all good. Definitely recommend this place!
author: Lily W.

description: This establishment deserves an award for the best restaurant in town. It is staffed with very professional and friendly employees that just brings your mood up as soon as you walk through the door. Very clean, safe, family friendly. They really care about their patrons. I haven't even started on how Magnificent the food is. It is not only eye appealing but yummy for the the tummy. This place is a must try if you are in the area. I'd give 10 stars if I could. Just pure awesome, drinks and ALL.
author: Jerry P.

description: This is one of my fav hot pot. There are varieties of soups, especially the spicy soup is the best! All meats are in good quality. They also have an alcohol buffet just for $10!! Overall, the service mind of staff here is so helpful.
author: Belle R.

description: One of the best hot pot places in town. Super friendly staff and not to mention quick with the orders and beverages.  All the food are fresh and a delicious base broth. The sauce bar has also many options to make your own magic dipping goodness! Oh the dessert shave ice is also a great cap on an overall great meal!
author: Jeff S.

description:
I love hot pot! So when a new place opens, I always try to check them out. Hot Pot Island just started offering AYCE every Tuesday and Wednesday. Perfect time to go, right?!

All you can eat: $25.95
All you can eat & drink: $35.95
Time limit: 2 hours

Soup bases: House special spicy, Nourishing broth, Japanese spicy miso, Healthy clear broth
Dipping sauces: Sesame, Garlic, Satay

Drinks included:
*Beer - Sapporo, IPA, Hefeweizen, Blue moon
*Hot & cold sake
*Soda - Coke, Diet coke, Sprite, Fanta
*Plum juice

Food included:
*Meat - House special slice lamb shoulder, House special beef, Kobe beef, Highest grade pork belly, Premium chicken breast
*Meat ball - House made fish paste, House made shrimp mix, House made chicken mix, Lobster fish ball, Cuttlefish ball, Fish ball, Beef tendon ball
*Seafood - Fresh shrimp, Fish filet, Fresh octopus, Mussel, Tempura, Fish tofu, Crab stick
*Other meats - Beef tendon, Beef tripe, Honeycomb beef tripe, Pork intestine, Pork luncheon meat, Pork blood
*Tofu/Fungus - Fresh tofu, Frozen tofu, Fried tofu, Bean curd stick, Enoki mushroom, Shiitake mushroom, Oyster mushroom, Fried tofu sheets
*Vegetables - Napa cabbage, Green leaf lettuce, Spinach, Winter melon, Pickled cabbage, Tong ho, Sliced potatoes, Lotus slices, Seaweed bow tie, Woodear mushroom
*Other items - Bamboo heart, Corn, Taro
*Noodle/Rice - Vermicelli, Udon noodles, Rice cakes, Egg noodles, Rice

I love that they have four different soup bases. I like trying different soups. Ultimately, I liked the House special spicy the best since it flavored the meat well. For sauces, we ended up asking for Soy sauce, Green onions and Hot sauce as well to complement the provided dipping sauces.

Service was a little slow. We had to flag people down for drink refills and it took a while for the food to come out. The space is small and they had a number of servers, so I wasn't sure if the servers also prepped the food since it took so long to get everything. But everyone was really nice. As other tables filtered out and it neared closing, service was super attentive.

Glad there's a new hot pot place by my house! I'll definitely be back!
author: Elena N.

description: Absotively treacherociously good!! They feed you to the moon and back fam would recommend
author: Cindy W.

description: Good food. Friendly service. Nice place to have either lunch or dinner there. Love their plum juicy!!!!!!!
author: Chen S.

description: Such a good hot pot! Great service and great food!! Mason was the best server and made us have the best time. We will be back for sure!
author: veronika k.

description: Really good hot pot place. Has a sauce area where you can make it yourself. They give small meat portions so you can pace yourself well. There is plenty of variety here in terms of meat seafood and veggies. This place is really popular so you had better make a reservation or be prepared for at least an hour wait.
author: Lewis T.

description: A lot soup option and sauces option. Wide range variation if meat, seafood, and veggie. Good price for all you can eat hot pot. Nice servers and most important no loud edm music!
author: gema p.

description: Great Hot Pot. It is very tasty. I would recommend it if you're in San Francisco to check it out.
author: Joe B.

description:
So cheap compared to all the other AYCE hot pot places in SF! I was dragged here by my friends so I gave it a try. Personally, not a big fan of hot pot, I prefer shabu a lot more. I thought it was cool because a lot of hot pot places have 2 types of soup but we were allowed to choose up to 4. How cool is that?

I also loved that they had a lot more variety of meat and seafood. Def would come back here if I ever wanted hot pot.
author: Elaine C.

description: Great place for dinner, all you can eat with quality meats. Normally not a fan of Chinese but this place really exceeded my expectation!
author: Charlie T.

description:
I loved this place. How have I never come here before? Aside from being at a great price point compared to shabu places, they have so much variety and the broth were all really good! You pick 4 broths - we picked pork bone, kimchee, tomato, and spicy. ALL were fantastic, I think tomato might have been all of our favorite. It's $28 per person for all you can eat. We didn't add the $10 for all you can drink because it only really included beer and sake, so we ordered sake and flavored soju in the individual drinks section. 

Get the house mix fish paste. That was so delicious. I really liked the lamb, all the enoki mushroom, tripe, tendons, fish, mussels, spinach, everything! But note, only order what you can eat! 

They have a sauce area where you make your own. I like to add some black vinegar to my mixture. They also have kimchee and pickled cucumbers there to take. We had the green tea snow ice at the end. It had popping boba on top! It was no class 302 in socal, but it was still pretty tasty!

PS. the place looks small but they have a back area! Great for group dinners!
author: Joanna S.

description:
The food is pretty good, but the wait is pretty bad. We called in to check if there were seats available and were told that it would be a short wait (15 min). We ended up waiting a bit over an hour after writing our names down; there is no seated waiting area. Luckily there is a bakery next door to browse while waiting... Although eating dessert before hot pot buffet isn't exactly the greatest idea.

There is a wide selection of meats, veggies, noodles, and sauces. Pretty decent food for unlimited hot pot. The soups are also pretty good- you get to choose several flavors in a divided pot. The tables for two are in booths, which is nice. Service is decent.
author: Anna C.

description: Was convinced to come here because of the 4 star review. It's all-you-can-eat. I have to say that from the sauce selection to the meats and freshness of vegetables, this place was pretty horrible.
author: Anthony W.

description:
My first time getting hot pot, my boyfriend's first time here. The best part is the service. The worst part was the wait. The food was good. All You Can Eat food ($28) & drink/booze ($10) is a good value. Expect $100 for two people, including tip. Highlights were the lamb, Kobe beef, and taro. Unlimited mix-ins, four choices of broth. You can grab bowls of sauces (oyster, garlic, etc.) and scallions in the back. Two hour limit, which we reached naturally. 

My boyfriend adds: "This is the only place that deserves your hot pot business. It puts all other hot pot places to shame. You'll understand once you go."
author: Anna K.

description: Had a pretty good experience at Boiling Hot Pot. They have a wide variety of soup broths and the pot that they provide you with allows you to choose 4 broths at once. They have a dipping sauce station with all types of sauces to mix together. Meats and veggies are farily fresh and service is fast and attentive. The quality of the meat is decent but not as marbled as other places.
author: Lester W.

description: Pretty standard hot pot place. Just ordered a few things on the first order to get things going, but after that service slowed to a halt and it was hard to get a second order in. They also sneakily delay bringing out the meat you order so that you fill up on noodles and veggies. Lesson learned: order big on your first round with lots of meat. I liked the sauce bar a lot. After all the spicy food, it would have been nice for a little scoop of ice cream or mochi to be included at the end.
author: Ross R.

description:
This shabu place is legit! It's not a very big restaurant, so big parties, be prepared to split up! They're very modern looking on the inside, very clean place. Always a big plus when they're clean! Seating could get a little cramped if you have a big party like we did.

You can make your own dipping sauce, they have a wide variety of ingredients for you, almost everything you need to satisfy your dipping needs. They have a huge selection of meats, from beef, pork, chicken, to different seafoods, so that was a big plus because everyone wanted something different. The staff was very helpful and polite, even though we were ordering like machines. It's AYCE, so of course you're suppose to take advantage of it! The pitchers were buy one get one free at the time, so we definitely took advantage of that! We stayed basically until closing, and the staff weren't in a rush or anything.

Highly recommend this shabu! Good service and good food, what more can you ask for!
author: Hev Z.

description: Service is always great and they are really efficient in bringing us what we order in a timely manner. Our favorite hotpot place to go to. 5 stars for every visit!
author: Wayman D.

description:
4 stars is a bit high, but 3.5 is too low. 

Another hot pot place? AND in the Richmond? Yes, please!

I was surprised and ecstatic to find out that they were opening a hot pot place in my hood. Finally tried it a couple weekends ago and it is definitely a solid hot pot place. It's not as good as Little Sheep (but what is, really?) but I like it more than Hot Pot Garden (everything starts to taste the same after a while there).

I like that they give you 4 different soup bases; I forget the exact names but they have the typical Little Sheep wannabes, a spicy miso and then a tomato broth.
