The spicy Little Sheep wannabe soup was really Chinese tasting, and there was a ton of chili oil -- still good, but not great. The other Little Sheep knock off was okay, not too flavorful. The spicy miso was meh. The tomato broth in the middle was AWESOME. It kinda reminds me of tom yum, but not as sour and not spicy at all.

The menu is a little book that's been laminated so you can mark off what you want with a dry erase pen. It's a pretty extensive menu with plenty of options, though the quality of the meats and what not are not as good as Little Sheep.

The server was very attention (maybe a little too much?) and asked us several times if we needed anything. But when we needed water, she stopped coming around haha And by the time we were paying, they were closed and eating so that was a bit awkward.

As for pricing, it is a little expensive. Between two people, we had two orders of meat (beef and lamb), lobster balls, some veggies and mushrooms, corn, udon and maybe one or two others. It came out to be 28, including tax and tip, per person.

Overall, good hot pot experience and will be back.
author: Doris K.

description:
Very good all you can eat hot pot. You get up to four different soup bases and as many of the various meat and vegetable plates as you want. Nice sauce bar to make your own dipping by sauces.

At $27 per person, it's a little on the high side, but the quality and selection are good. It'd be nice if the price included a drink (drinks are extra and all you can drink is $10).

The yogurt soju is amazing...and strong.

Friendly service too...a little stuffy in the restaurant with all the hot soup steam.
author: David H.

description: Did the AYCE hotpot for $27.50/person. Had a party of 7 and was seated right of way (only bc we made reservations can ahead of time). What cool was the 4 split broth, so we got to taste all the foods in multiple broths. They had a wide variety​ foods o code from and they we're all proved well. Our server tonight was Sohand, who was kind enough to drop by our table to help take empty dishes or to get us more dishes. Thank you for filling our stomachs!
author: Rachel L.

description:
- THE FOOD
Of the different AYCE hot pot places I have tried in SF, I think Boiling Hot Pot is my least favorite. Their broth choices are rather limited and there's not a lot of different things to eat. Although their pot design is rather unique, the only flavor I enjoyed was the miso soup. We also tried their pork bone (the small circle in the middle), spicy soup, and kimchi soup. The pork bone is really bland, spicy wasn't as spicy or salty as I expected, and the kimchi was all around strange. The meats here aren't the freshest and there's not a lot of options for other items, compared to other hot pot places. One of the more unique meats we tried was the beer beef. We had a group of 6 and it was rather difficult to share from one pot since everyone had to climb over to reach things. They also lacked cooked appetizers, which was a huge thing I loved about the other hot pot places in SF. For the amount of money I spent to eat at Boiling Hot Pot, I would rather wait for some place better.
author: Cindy C.

description: This is the best hot pot place in San Francisco! Perfect place to have a group dinner with friends or family. Will definitely come back again to this place!
author: Atmanjaya R.

description: One of the best hot pots I have tried ever! For only $27.95, you can eat all you can as many as you want for 2 hours! Definitely worth it. Service was excellent as well. If only I can give 10 stars!!
author: Gino F.

description: Shit was good, yo. Lit af. And free shit. Fuck yeah. Real talk tho, nice staff, taste good, but long wait.
author: Jeff H.

description:
Every once in a while, I would feel crave a big meal. And hotpot is always my choice. Ive been to a couple of hotpot but this one is really legit. The meat and soups are pretty tasty. They also have a sauce bar, which is what I like the most. Nice service and calm ambience for lunch.
Truly recommend!
author: Vu L.

description: All you can eat chinese hot pot, add all you can drink for extra $10. 4 soup flavors in 1 pot with no extra cost. Meat was fresh, lots of selections including Kobe beef.   Service was great. Would definitely come back.
author: Cal C.

description:
Visiting from Italy! My family took me here and it was my First time trying hot pot. Really good food with a wide variety of food! All very amazing flavors and best of all it's all you can eat!!
Highly recommended
author: Nana C.

description:
I am visiting from Austin TX and was unprepared for how chilly it can get in San Francisco!  Hot pot sounded like the perfect antidote for the chilly weather.  

There were many broths and cooking items to choose from and all you can eat is the only option on weekends- so my best advice is to come hungry, but overall - this is a good place to come with 2 or more people to have a  long and enjoyable meal.
author: Harley D.

description:
Great food!! Service is great as well! Our server is very great! The servings are great!. The sauce bar was amazing! They have suggestions of mixes you can do. Me and the hubby loved the spicy oil and ponzu. And the garlic, seafood,band soy sauce next. Oh! And drink all you can for $10 was not bad!!!

I recommend this place!!
author: Jesca M.

description: I think there are a lot of choices on the menu, and I can get what I want for enough. Moreover, the service quality is good, I can get food as soon as possible. I think the meat is tasty, and also I can get as much as I want. The favors of the soup bases are good and I can pick four favors on the same time, which is very good for me because I can taste different one with the same food. I like this store, and I recommend to come back again. And also I feel the fee is not that high, not that expensive, it deserves this price.
author: Jialing H.

description: Trying a new Hot Pot place.  All-you-can-eat and we definitely ate all we could! Hum...dessert is available too.
author: Melinda Y.

description:
One of the better hot pot places in SF! Personally, I felt like the soup bases were more unique and flavorful and the dipping sauces were also very fresh. 

The quality of the lamb in particular was good, the other ingredients were reasonably good. Also, the service was great!
author: Michelle Z.

description:
Good place for hot pot in San Francisco! 
You can have lot choices on food that you choose! All you can eat! delicious!
author: Kermit L.

description: Great service. variety of food options. Food is delicious. Friendly staff, always in a upbeat mood. In a good location , easy access. Rarely have to wait to be seated. Induction Cooking product is cool too.
author: Dev G.

description: Food is good and tasty. Lots of choice of soup but only one waitress on Sunday!!!? Have to wait for food and ordered kinda on and off. Should hire more waitress or waiter tho. Seafood is fresh and also vegetables.
author: Aunggie N.

description:
I started the meal hangry; I ended it only angry.
This is a bunch of nasty (read: awesome) food.
Out of oysters and pickled garlic when I went.
Still had blood, boneless chicken feet, cow tendon.
X-Men film on TV. Like eating at a friend's home.
Dry erase marker menu was cool but a bit odd.
The server keeps reviewing it with you anyway.
author: Dan B.

description: Delicious! Great customer service and great food. I came with six friends from high school and had a great time. This was the perfect place to laugh and chat over delicious steaming foods!!!
author: Melissa D.

description: The food was great and the service was even better! You can order as much at a time as you like and the food comes out very fast. The staff is extremely polite and attentive. Definitely coming back!
author: Ryan Q.

description: Live Cockroach on our plate of food!!! If I could give a negative star I would. My wife is pregnant for *@&$ sakes! We all wanted to throw up! I didn't have the heart to scream it out load to the other patrons. Sorry guys, now reflecting, I should have! The only positive I can think of is we don't live here so we'll never have to go there again.
author: AJ S.

description:
PROS: quality food, tasty soup base, many options for dipping sauce, attentive service, good value 
CONS: very long wait without reservation, condensation on low ceiling from hotpot that drips down on you (ewwww). They really need to do something about this because the ickiness of this is a deal breaker for most people
author: Chloe D.

description: Some of the worst hot pot I've had in this country. The soup looks fancy but has no flavor, and the meats are mediocre quality. Much better hot pot can be found in sf Chinatown. 2/5 would not recommend.
author: Alexander W.

description: First timer here and I would definitely come back! This is a super fun place to eat and hang out with friends! Everybody is nice and helpful, and the food is delicious. You should try the Beef Beer! 5/5 will eat again!
author: Jessica F.

description:
I recommend this beer beef is so great.  I ate twice. The service is good too.
Next I would like to try different meat.
author: Min Chuan H.

description: One of our favorite dishes is Chinese Hot Pot and this place is the best in San Francisco. Just like sitting in Shanghai (but less crowded). We love the classics like lamb, fish balls and the wide vermicelli noodles. And to finish it off, they have the best mango ice flake dessert!  We highly recommend this place.
author: Marvin C.

description: This is my first time in here. Good place and great meal. Nice staff . Highly recommend to be here.....yeah yeah yeah !!
author: Tanasak I.

description: Fast, attentive service, good quality ingredients, and broad assortment of items! Also broad assortment of sauces! $27.95 for all you can eat dinner. I would recommend the kobe beef and try their housemade stuff. Had a fun time here. The spicy sauce is a must have!!
author: Y W.

description: Very long waiting time (~2hours), food of not good quality, bad service, extremely strict leftover policy. There are lots of good hot pot places in town so don't waste your time and money on this one.
author: Lorenzo M.

description: So far so good the seafood is great and also they have got lots broth to try would come next time for sure ;)
author: Nantaphan C.

description: Best hot pot. 4 soup bases! All you can eat at a great price. Place isn't too hyped yet.
author: Jon T.

description: First time here!!! Very new to hot pot but boy oh boy this place is as great!! Multiple soup options, meats, and veggies. Come early because it gets busy and popular!!
author: Brent M.

description:
Great place with great food! Large selections of meats seafood and vegetables as well as a few noodles and rices. Pretty standard in most hot pot joints though right? I still remember when the place first opened as hot pot island and they didn't offer the ayce option but instead sold by plates. After a few management changes I believe they came to be where they are now.

The meats that come out are usually never frozen sitting on the table but already completely thawed. If I were to compare that to let's say hot pot garden that has now been moved to millbrae... well let's just say their food comes out hard as rocks till it hits the water.

Seafoods are usually frozen and their vegetables are relatively fresh. I also personally like their choice of udon and vermicelli. Their rice isn't that great though.

As for drinks I don't actually drink anything other than soda water and their watermelon juice.

Their servers are great as well but sometimes slow because there's only about 2 or 3 servers for a full house and they'd bring people from the kitchen to help sometimes.

The only downside is the ventilation of the place. They don't have vents(or efficient ones) so the place would always be really hot and stuffy but if they were to leave the door open it would get really cold. There's not fine line in between.
author: David N.

description: My goto place for hot pot buffet. A lot of food choices with good quality meat. The soup bases were awesome. Price is reasonable. Service was good. There is usually a long wait though.
author: Dylan X.

description: Favorite hot pot restaurant in San Francisco. For around ~$30, you can get all you can eat hotpot. You can choose up to 3 soup bases, and get ALL SORTS of items to put inside it. This includes meat, veggies, noodles, and even seafood. Worth every penny.
author: Do P.

description:
Very satisfying, good food quality, fresh!
Great choice for friends union.
Love this place, definitely will come again!
author: John H.

description:
One of my favorite hot pot places in San Francisco.  Food quality and service are on point.  Broth options are plentiful and you actually have option to choose 4 different types.

Also love that you can create your own sauces. Would highly recommend coming here!
author: Jess C.

description:
Wow this place is amazing for hot pot! Came here with a group of friends, super hungry and excited to try a new place. First of all you get to pick 4 soups! WHAT? Yea you read that right, you get 4 soup choices, so basically everyone can have what they want. There's also a sauce station to make your own personal sauces, which I really appreciate since other hot pot places don't even have such a thing! Servers were fast and friendly, coming around to refill drinks and pick up our menu if we were ready for another round. Oh yea, this place is an all you can eat hot pot, so order away! However, there is a extra fee charge if you don't finish the food you ordered, so eat as much as you can. 

What really set this place apart from the other hot pot places is that you could literally order as much meat as you want. Other hot pot places limit you to like maybe 2 plates of each meat or have restrictions on how much meat you can order each round. Not this place! At one point we put down a "4" next to each meat listed on the menu and THEY LISTENED! What a beautiful sight to see piles and piles of meat on our table, thus killing the need to keep asking the server for a new menu to order more. At the end of our meal I think we destroyed like 56 plates of meat, so we really got our moneys worth! Price range is in the $30-$35, that's including tax and tip.
author: William E.

description: Awesome place for AYCE and AYCD. We hit the 2 hour time limit for the first time today though, so plan accordingly!
author: Eric K.

description: Decent food, very fresh meat. The spicy soup base is a little too much on the salty side than spicy.
author: Melody Y.

description: Compared to other hot pot places this one has alot more options . Love the sauce bar. Efficient service .
author: Amy B.

description: I'm a huge fan of all-you-can-eat hot pot and have been to most of the popular spots in SF. Came to Boiling Hot Pot with some friends for the first time, and this is unanimously our new favorite hot pot place in the city. The quality of meat is great and the soup bases so flavorful. We'll definitely be back.
author: em c.

description: First time here, wait time was a bit long but worth it!  The tomatoe, kimchi and miso is the bomb. Only complaint is that their table is a bit too high making hard for you to rest your arms.
author: Eduardo C.

description: The waiters here are very unfriendly, and the food is not very fresh. Besides, it takes more than one hour to dining, very bad experience.
author: Biao H.

description:
Super good! This place is better than The Pots, which is hard for me to say cause I've been a devoted Pots fan for a long time.

Really good, consistent service. High quality meats and veggies served in a clean environment! Tons of food choices and the best part is that they give you four different soup bases. Four! Also, they have a sauce bar where you make your own sauce (sesame oil, cilantro, garlic, oyster sauce, etc). This is awesome and super convenient because you don't have to keep asking for more when you're running low on your delicious dipping concoction!

Major nomz!
author: Yanni L.

description:
"A" and I both love hot pot.  When I found out about Hot Pot Island, I had to check it out.  For those of you who love AYCE, this isn't the place for you as everything is ala carte.  

Most hot pot places give you two soup bases, but HPI is different.  You get four soup bases in an octangular pot: 1) House Spicy, 2) Nourishing Broth, 3) Japanese Spicy Miso, and 4) Tomato Broth.  You don't get an option to choose what soup bases you want as you're automatically given all four.   BUMMER!   The tomato broth is topped with cilantro, so if you don't like cilantro like me, make sure to ask that it be omitted.  Of the four broths, my favorite was the Japanese Spicy Miso.  The tomato brother was good, but after a while, it made me feel sick..not sure if it's because it was too acidic.  Most places charge for their sauces, but it's complimentary here.  The sauce includes satay, sesame, and garlic.    

The service was mediocre.  The waitress passed by our table and I know she noticed that we were running low on soup base, but she never attempted to refill it.  We had to flag one of the guy's and ask him to do it.  

The quality of food was okay, but I would still prefer going to Hot Pot Garden or Little Sheep.
author: Candice H.

description:
Came here with a big group!  Made a reservation and we walked right in.  Wait staff is great and highly attentive.  Meat was high quality and broth was tasty.  So much variety!  100℅ coming back! 

Fyi, group recommendation is 6 minimum.  All you can drink is 10 more!
author: Richard Y.

description: Service was great, really quick to respond. Came with a group of six - absolutely amazing. Definitely come with an appetite. Our group of six arrived and was promptly seated - thank god we had a Taiwanese girl with an endless stomach destroying all the vermicelli noodles and Kobe beef. You're able to sample sooooo many different soup bases and the meat quality is solid. My personal fave was the mini-octopuses. Yep. Dip that shit into a little satay, fuckin bangin. Good for groups, great for dates.
author: William Y.

description: Delicious! My husband an I tried this place for the first time! Man this place is amazing a great experience. Nice portions. Will be back!!!!!
author: Christina H.

description: i had five plates of beef and the sauce was really good, the beef was tender, and vegetables are fresh. I like the fact they offered three options for soup base.
author: Momo P.

description: Service totally sucks here. Charging 14 bucks for 3 year olds to eat?!? I think all three kids had a piece of chicken. We asked for extra utensils for scooping out food from different broths and that never showed up after 3 attempts. We asked for spoons and they never came. Although the waiter had the audacity to say its "last call" promptly.
author: Paige D.

description:
We come to Boiling Hot Pot when we're craving for hot pot and we love that it's close by. The ingredients are fresh overall, but the beef can be a hit or miss. Sometimes it's fresh and well marbled, other times it can be grossly fatty. Maybe some folks prefer a huge chunk of fat in their beef slices, but I certainly do not. 

You can select up to 4 different soup bases, making it a fun experience trying out the different flavors. Our favorite is the pork bone base, but for some reason, that particular soup is limited to the middle, circular section only so you get a small amount. Is pork bone soup that much more expensive than the others? Weird. The soups also get really, really salty after while. 

Wish this place also had a lunch menu; they still charge the same ($28p/p) for lunch, which is a little crazy because $28p/p + tax + tip is pretty expensive for lunch in the Richmond and who can really eat that much for lunch?! They should consider lowering the price for lunch. They can even offer fewer menu items during lunch time. 

But overall, the food is good and service is friendly and that's why we keep coming back.
author: Cee J.

description:
Wow this place is fantastic.  U can try four soup in a pot .
Staff are very helpful and friendly. But sometime need to wait for 30 min
author: James T.

description: Our fav hotspot in SF！good service and environment !! you can choose four favor soup that you really like. Especially for the rainy times, it's warm stomach and heart. Best choice for you.
author: Shuaicheng L.

description: This is the best hot pot in the city, bar none. The broths are perfect and tasty. They have an assortment of meats and seafoods to choose from, vegetables and other fun additions. Customer service is really friendly and attentive. Always quick to give us exactly what we ordered. I highly recommend this place! Do make reservations, especially during the weekend, as it does get pretty busy.
author: Brandon E.

description: Favorite hot pot place in the city! Been here 3 times in the last month. They have a great selection and all their food is very fresh. Highly recommended!
author: Briana L.

description: Great value and service. Excellent variety and quality of ingredients. $10 all you can drink beer is a nice bonus!
author: Haven D.

description: Best place for hotpot in SF! Sauces galore, to dip the unlimited all you can eat meats and veggies. Don't miss the Kobe beef and bring all your friends for a classic Chinese dining experience!
author: Tony L.

description: Amazing broths and great service. It's a little hard for vegetarians to enjoy here because the broth is mostly pork bone based but it's still super yummy especially the tomato. Step aside Campbell soup, someone got you beat. Definitely check them out.
author: Janice F.

description: All you can is around $27 person. You get to choose 4 different broths ! So worth it in my opinion. Once you are seated, you mark how many plates of meats, rice, noodles on a laminated menu. So much food! Go here on an empty stomach. The only thing I didn't like was the fact that I felt rushed when I was eating. I went in around 9 pm. Last call for food is at 9:30 and they close at 10. They WILL shut off the music to make it awkward.  Other than that, the broths were flavorful. Careful with the spicy soup (my mouth was on fire) !
author: Katherine H.

description: Friendly staff and good food. Two rooms to be seated in with a tv in each for entertainment. We ordered from the all you can eat several times and got filled up. Tasty beef, veggies, tofu, and 3 soups to partake in. We didn't use the spicy broth much because the heat from the kimchi broth was hot enough. If you meter park, make sure to pay by phone so you don't have to run out and feed meters, especially on a cold day or night.
author: Thurston W.

description:
Came here with a group of 6 and sat in the back room where there was an additional 5-6 tables. I was impressed with the tufted black faux leather seats. My first impression? Looks comfy, a stylish place to hang out with a large group. 

My impressions of this joint turned sour as the food came out. The meat was blah (I didn't know chicken could be so rough), the vegetables were not fresh, and the broth was nothing special. The service was okay though, but that is about it.
author: Judy M.

description:
We rarely gave 5 stars.
This is the 2nd time we went to the Hot Pot Buffet.
Before we used to go to other restaurants on Clement street for shabushabu.
Their service is very nice and quick.
The meat is wonderful! We especially love pork and lamb.
We like sauce station that you can mix it by your own. 
The spicy soup base is quite good!
author: Cha Y.

description: This place is great. The customer service was on point. The waiter serving us even hooked us up with free desert.
author: Nami K.

description: They need better ventilation but great service and decent price for all you can eat. My friends and I loved the quail eggs, house special beef and udon.
author: Duyen T.

description: Best hot pot in SF！！Four flavors can be selected in one hot pot. Very good taste。will come here very often
author: Paine W.

description:
Jessica, Pak, and Mason are great.  The pot is delicious.
We love this place, and for sure we will be back soon.
author: Nguyen H.

description:
Best hotpot in town everybody!!!
27.5 and All you can eat which is awesome!
The food portion is very decent and the staff are absolutely amazing and friendly!

This is my go to place when I have a bunch of friends gathering. 

I used to go to little sheep for hot pot until I found this amazing food spot!
author: Stella S.

description: Always happy to stop by this place whenever we are in the City. One of the better tasting hotpot restaurants in the bay! If you're hungry, I suggest getting here earlier right around 5pm. It can get busy and you don't want to be waiting too long as there is no waiting area and it's cold outside. Being a hoodie if you're planning to come later at night. It's not as authentic as the ones you get from China, but then again, if you're craving, the. This restaurant will surely hit the spot!
author: Wei L.

description: Food was great! Service was quick and servers were very friendly. I recommend the green tea snow ice for dessert!
author: Melissa L.

description: Last night 7 of us went here. All of us have a blast. The food is great, it is fun and the service is excellent for an all you can eat concept. We will definitely go back again. This place is a gem in Richmond and the city.
author: Yashar M.

description: I've been here three times and every time is better than the last! Top notch broth, meat, veggies and sauce! Just remember to only eat lettuce, drink water and do lots of exercise to prepare for ayce!!
author: Carolyn K.

description: I love this place. Highly recommended. Their satay sauce is absolutely bomb! Only downside is that reservations need a minimum of 5... like wtf. 5 stars.
author: Michael L.

description: Amazing service and amazing food! If you're in the mood for hot pot, this is the best spot in San Francisco.
author: Ian Y.

description: To be honest it was the best hot pot restaurant in SF. Very good quality fresh seafood, meat, broth, and the service was great! Very very satisfied. It was all you can eat and it was a good price. Highly recommend this place.
author: Jason L.

description: This was a great place to try Hot Pot for the first time. The staff was very nice and understanding of all our questions. There are SO MANY options and it's just awesome! Be sure to know going in, that if you get "All You Can Eat" you have to choose 4 broths, so if you already have a favorite maybe think about just ordering that and a plate of meat/veggies. The sake is great too, we'll priced!
author: Alex H.

description: This place is unique with their four soup base pot.  Beef was good quality but not the pork which seems way to thin and small. Once it's cooked it shrinks to a tiny piece.   Selection isn't as great given the price.    Some stuff like beef tendon and pork intestines were cut into pieces so it makes it difficult to cook and eat.  The spicy soup base isn't authentic.   It didn't have the peppercorn numbing affect.   It's just spicy and covers all of the taste in the food.  Beef broth has literally no flavor.  The only soup base that stands out is tomato.  Service is better first half then it became scatter afterward.
author: Janita s.

description: Four stars for the big selection, great price(27.95) group friendly atmosphere, and polite customer service. This was a great first experience, I would definitely come back. I recommend the miso or kimchi broth with the Kobe beef. Although this is a great place for groups and for the price, I thought the meat quality and the broths could have been a bit better, but overall it was pretty good.
author: Lexi J.

description:
Great food and service. This is the best hot pot place Ever. Love it. 
We have come here few times now, and every time we come here, we want to come back again and again. I never get tired of this place. Great price as well, we had so much food and drink for just $67 for 2 people.
author: Tseji L.

description: Very good quality hot pot beef, pork and lamb. Overall good service. Also their hip hop playlist is
author: Alex G.

description:
I came by this hot pot place because I didn't have anywhere else to eat for lunch and this was across the street from my work place, so I was like "why the hell not?!" It was noon, so there wasn't anyone else there besides another guy dining away, so you won't have any troubles getting a table to yourself or with your friends if you come in Friday from 11:30 am to 2:30 pm. They do reopen in the evening too!

When I came here, I didn't have high expectations because I thought it was somewhat similar to iPot because they had a sauce bar too, but I thought the sauces tasted a bit better here.

It didn't take that long to get my meat plates, which I got the kobe beef and the new beef plate which I forgot what it was, but they give you a small amount to start with, but it's all you can eat! Remember that! 

**also, since the new beef dish that they had was a bit thicker, it took longer to cook but I ended up not eating it because I had to rush back to work. Have the patience to cook thicker meats because I didn't :( 

But holy shit. The soup bases themselves were HUGE. I couldn't believe that I was able to choose four soup bases and AHH. I would definitely recommend coming with friends because there's more than enough to go around.

My total came out to be around ~$31 with tax. Definitely come here with a group of people and make sure you get the thinly sliced meats! They cook a lot faster!
author: Trisha L.

description: Came here at 7:30 on a Friday night and there was a small wait about like 15-20 mins we were seated. I love how this place lets you choose up to 4 soup bases. There is AYCE & All you can drink! Overall the food here is pretty good. I would return if I'm craving for hot pot! :)
author: Tina C.

description: Real awesome place come here other Friday for hot pot. Even better to go when it is hot and raining. Shave ice is awesome!!!! The price is real good too, and my friends and I love he place. It the only one I will go to hot pot at.love the place!!!!!
author: Calvin T.

description:
I'd give it a 3.5 if i could.

I think the soup base is only 3 stars which is why I didnt love it. But the meats are 4. For all you can eat its not a bad price, if they didn't put a time limit on it.

I do think I will revisit though.
author: Danielle A.

description:
This place is awesome! 
Delicious food, friendly staff and very good price. I recommend to anyone who likes hot pot and I will definitely come back
author: Wim D.

description: The all you can eat is great. I love hot pot that give more than one type of broth to cook with. The service is quick and there is a wide selection of meats.
author: Matt L.

description: Pot flavor was ok, and gets 4 stars because of the quality service and great all you can eat option on Saturdays.
author: Robyn L.

description: I've been searching for an AYCE hot pot place recently and I think I found the one. My bf and I came here on a Tuesday night and we were seated right away. The waitress explained that we were getting 4 soup bases and the sauces were at a corner. They also gave us a menu and we can add/check off what we wanted. They offer a variety of meats, balls, veggies and others; I definitely ate to my hearts content. I haven't been to any other hot pot places so I can't compare, but with this being my first experience, I throughly enjoyed it. I just wished they offered AYCE everyday instead of just certain days. I will definitely be back!
author: Renee Y.

description: Great hot pot restaurant! You really need to give it a try. I will recommend you to order tofu, youtiao, lamb. Great service as well.
author: Qiyuan L.

description: It's good hot pot places in San Francisco. The soup bases were very good and the dipping sauces were very fresh. All the meat and vegetable were fresh too.
author: Kaori C.

description: super nice service and good quality food. Definitely come back again! Especially the shrimp paste, and vegetables !
author: Monica Z.

description: Our go to hot pot place in SF. We come here all the way from the Mission. Broths are flavorful and the selection of meats and veggies are fresh.  Highly recommend. Also - ice milk dessert!
author: Clifton T.

description: Bad service, host with glasses was rude. Never ever coming here again and would not suggest it to my friends too
author: JC N.

description: As good as it gets! This place is definitely my go-to spot for some spicy hot pot whenever I'm in San Francisco. My boyfriend and I have gone here a number of times and every time, we come out full & satisfied. Their meat choices are plenty and always fresh. A plus is you don't just get one or two soup choices - you can pick four! Our favorite would have to be the spicy soup. Soooo good with the perfect spicy kick to it. Although a little small, we have never had any problems getting seated immediately. Definitely a must try if you're craving for hot pot!
author: Lang N.

description: This is the only hot pot place we go to in the Bay because it's so much better than anywhere else. They don't try to pressure you to order less meat or anything shady like other places do (when you get the all-you-can-eat). Great selection of meats and vegetables.
author: Abi W.

description:
+ fast and prompt service
+ hot asian guys as servers
+ really good food, especially the lamb shoulders and beef
+ nice selection of vegetables, including mushroom varieties and tofu varieties

Overall a very good experience. The servers were all very polite and willing to help, which I was impressed with given that this service level is atypical of other Asian establishments. There is a 2 hour limit, but honestly that wasn't an issue; my friend and I finished in 75 minutes and were stuffed
author: R L.

description: The service was amazing the food was even better.  I would choose to Cook everything for the rest of my life in the spicy soup base... it was so amazing! And let's not forget the sauce making stations! I love this place it's perfect for any large groups
author: Deborah O.

description: Great service form David the server . I love the 4 different chooses of broth and soup. you can get spicy and kimchi soup . Great for date nite . I will be coming back very clean as well .
author: Carmen C.

description: Awesome spot. All u can eat is legit. But 2 hr limit. Kobe beef is good and the lamb is bomb.  I would come back.
author: Dion O.

description: Solid solid AYCE shabu restaurant! One of my top 2 shabu places in the city (other being The Pot's). For $27.99/person, you have access to a vast selection of meats, veggies, & noodles. My personal favorites are the pork bone soup & spicy soup, with Kobe beef...
author: Kevin Y.

description:
Just finished another hot pot meal. This was a particularly interesting place that our group finally decided on. Well L choice spot on and the meal was well worth the trip into the city for. Great service was key, as our waitress Shirley too good care of out table. What was so impressive about the selections were the various tofu selections. 

Meat selection was typical of most hot pot establishments. Seafood were well prepared with each shrimp well cleaned and trimmed. Four selection of broth, yes that's right 4! The spicy broth wasn't anything that was super impressive. But the pork bone broth I thought was a winner. Plus a sauce station which provided the finishing touches to the cooked meats and vegetables.

Complementary shaved ice cream was provided at the end of our meal. What a perfect finish to the meal!
author: Jack T.

description: This place is not that big compare to other hot pot places out there but they serve the best food in San Francisco, and they have the unique pot which include four soup bases , my favorite one is the miso. I'm glad that I made a reservation otherwise the wait might be a pain. All the servers are very attentive and trying their best to satisfy everyone. The sauces bar is another interesting thing because you get to mix your own sauces!!!! They have many kinds of sauces such as sesame , ponzu , garlic...etc. I would suggest try to come a little bit early to avoid the crowd. Otherwise you might stuck in the line for a while.
author: Mason M.

description:
wow nice hot pot ever!!! i will come back again!!
every meat was great . you should come here and enjoy real hot pot
author: Kim M.

description: The portion size is really good for trying different meats! It wasn't too much. I love that they had a sauce bar! I really like their miso and their tomato broth!
author: Gina P.

description: The best hot pot place I've ever tried. So many food options with amazing broths. Service is excellent! Feel satisfied every time when we eat here.
author: Heidi L.

description:
All you can eat hotpot and all you can drink beer is incredibly hard to dislike.

And this place delivered pretty solidly.  I came with 8 other people.  We ordered a ton of food (beef, veggies, mushroom, pork, pork belly, fish balls, fish paste, shrimp, tofu, etc...) and the staff was pretty quick at bringing it out and the portions were generous.  The quality of the food was decent.  It looked and tasted fresh.

You are allowed to choose three soup bases per pot, which was good because it gave variety.  There is a sauce station where you can set up your own dipping sauce and there's a number of things to choose from for making your sauce.

The soup base isn't quite as flavorful as Little Sheep and they are missing some of the items I like (there's a certain fish cake they didn't have and they didn't have the roe filled fish balls), but I would come back.  

The seating was also spacious so you don't fill cramped although we did have to go all the way to outer richmond for this.
author: Carrie L.

description: This is my favourite Shabu Shabu place in the city. Ive been here twice and it was great!! I will come here again soon with my friends and recommend this place to anyone who loves to eat Shabu Shabu. Food is amazing, the service is great! Thank you so much. I also love ice cream here!!
author: Jar N.

description: A lot variety in terms of soups bases and side dishes. Fast and friendly service too!
author: David C.

description:
For $28 per person, you would think that includes the eggs. Nope. Eggs are $0.50 each! Also $28 used to include Taiwanese style snowflakes shaved ice dessert. They took this away!!!!!!!

Service was extremely slow, and it's an understatement. I was there for FOUR hours.  We were served rice. No broth. No meat. 45 minutes later, the broth (hot pot) came out, some vegetables followed 15 minutes later. I did not come for vegetable hot pot. I waited for meat. Which came after an hour and 30 minutes later after we were seated. This is ridiculous.  I had to remind the staff again n again n AGAIN about my shiitake and oyster mushrooms that they forgot from 3 orders before. 

Who wants to waste 4 hours here waiting around for the staff to bring food?  Maybe they want you to eat the unlimited saucebar for $28.
author: CherryIcee S.

description: Legit hot pot, meat was really good and service was on point. Would take a date here. Got a booth for 2 and finished our dinner in an hour and a half
author: Steven C.

description: first time here and i'm very impressed with the service and quality of the food. there mush be at less 4 different hot pot joints within three blocks around here and this place is the best so far. they are armed with their own self severing ponzu sauce station that they keep well filled with fresh green onions, minced garlic, kim chi, etc. Your choice of 4 different soup base. Our server Mason and the staff was quick and efficient,  Thank you for all you guys help! keep it up
author: Bee Z.

description: Really great service and good meat! The broths were good and they accommodated a large group! Would recommend
author: Alex L.

description: Great dinning experience! I've never had a hot pot meal before and this was an excellent way to spend an evening with friends. Good food and a good atmosphere! The staff was incredibly friendly and helpful. Would recommend!
author: Hannah N.

description: Da Best Hot Pot EVA!!!!! you get to have 4 different soup bases at a time and the choices are delicious!  you cant go wrong.  they also have an awesome beer selection- drafts and bottles.   the staff is nice and attentive.  overall a perfect dining experience for any occasion.
author: Phon H.

description: This is my favorite hot pot place. They give you four choices for broth. The quality of the meat is great. They have friendly and quick service. Overall 5 stats!
author: Sophia C.

description: This restaurant is pretty decent in terms of selection of food items for a hot pot place. I like how they have a large pot and you can have 4 different broths to cook your food in. I wish they had a bigger sauce bar available but at least they have a sauce bar there for you to make your own dipping sauce. I bought a groupon for this place and for the groupon price it was worth it. I probably didn't like this place so much as to pay full price for it.
author: Lynn T.

description: The hot pot here is legit good! Because the place is so popular, there's a bit of a wait, but worth it nonetheless. Oh and they have their own sauce bar!!
author: renee m.

description: Highly recommended to have something hot for your dinner! Good food with reasonable price both Ala Carte and Buffet!! :)
author: Kwang O.

description: Came here for my sisters birthday for her first time at hot pot and she loves it! Servers are super nice and the food is bomb, definitely recommend eating hot pot with a nice cold beer on the side.
author: Charmaine S.

description: Second time here now even though we live so far because this is a very legit hot pot place, we try to come here after biking nearby in golden gate park! They serve you four different sauces with no extra charge!
author: Danika Z.

description: The restaurant was small and quaint. We waited about 30 minutes which wasn't too long considering how busy it was. My friends and I went crazy with the all you can eat and drink option. I was a bit skeptical at first to cook meat in broth but it actually was quite delicious.
author: Damian C.

description: Good service.   I like fried tofu sheet.  Good varieties of food. Parking a little difficult.
author: Hi I.

description:
Terrible service.
I'm commenting on the service not the food because I didn't even get to eat here.
When I got there I asked how long the wait was and he quickly glanced over the wait list and said 20 minutes.
It clearly didn't look like 20 minutes because there was a bajillion people ahead of us but we trusted the waiter thinking he knew the list better than us.
30 minutes after, the wait list didn't change. We went up to the waiter and ask how long the wait was and he said I don't know without even looking at the list.

If we knew that the wait was way longer 20 minutes, we would've left. Don't give us false hope :(
Totally ruined our night!
author: Nerissa I.

description: LOVE this hotpot place. Expect to wait in line maybe 30 mins. Its fun when they roll the cart to your table. Their meat selection is good esp the kobe and house special beef and the serving is quite generous. tried the miso, beef, pork and spicy broth which has quite a kick. They have all you can drink beverage menu too.
author: Bianca R.

description: WOW this place was so good! All of our broth were flavorful, but the best was the tomatoes. Our servers were very attentive constantly checking on us throughout the night. The place is pretty small though, so there was quite a wait time(45 minutes) for 2 people. Definitely worth it!
author: Trong N.

description: Can't get enough of this place! I've been here literally 3 times in one month cos I crave it all the time lol. The service is awesome, everyone is very friendly and attentive to the customers. They're really quick on refilling your orders so you're never waiting for your food! There are many options on the menu and everything is pretty tasty. I recommend the premium beef and pork belly with the miso broth. The only con is the place gets pretty packed because it's pretty small, so the wait can be pretty long. But that's just because this place is delicious and popular :)
author: Kelly R.

description: Great food and great service. Very timely and accommodating. Highly recommended! The food is fresh and they have great options. Would recommend for anyone who hasn't had hotpot before.
author: Kriztian D.

description: Probably the best hotpot in the city. And it's all you can eat. The waiters are really nice and responsive to my request. Will definitely come back again.
author: Tran N.

description: My fav hot pot place in SF! I can eat Kobe Beef non-stop. The service here is also pretty good.a suggestion would be getting here early than 7pm or you may need to wait around 30 minutes. But it totally worths it!!!
author: Bingqing W.

description: One of my favorite hot pot places in SF. Good food and fair price. Great for medium or large party. Sometimes they do happen to forget one or two of your orders, but the servers are overall friendly and attentive. Must try the beer beef!
author: Jerry H.

description: Never been to hot pot before but this place was amazing! Great variety of soup bases and loved the sauce bar
author: Charles P.

description: It was gr8. Perfect 5/7, would come back. Service was da best. I was constantly saying not baaaaaaad during the meal. Shirimp mix was hmmmmmm. Very good cow meet. Server was really helpful and nice. Short wait time.
author: Jason L.

description:
There are a lot of variety of foods. I was glad they take reservation. A lot of option to choose from for sauces and the cool thing is you can make your own. The staff was friendly. And I am sure like most people we got a deal off of groupon.com. However the service is really slow. It take roughly 15 minutes just for a new plate of food. While there are 6 hungry people in the table eyeballing a plate of beef. It makes me feel like they are not doing a good job for all you can eat. 

Furthermore, the soup is tasteless. Then again I am comparing this place with little sheep. Most places in general have blended soup but this place is really bland. I have to say the price is not the problem here, it's the quality of soup.
author: Michael Q.

description: Mason is the best waiter ever. He speaks Chinese and English. He helped us with our choices. He got us as many drinks as we asked for. This restaurant is a great deal and Mason is a great waiter. I will come back here again and again. I recommend the all you can drink and eat special. AYCE. AYCD. Great deal. Go Mason!
author: Trevor W.

description: Probably one of the best restaurants in sf. Their beef sashimi is my favorite, but the sad part is they don't provide wasabi for the beef;((
author: Qihao X.

description: Two of my friends and their kids went here to celebrate our birthdays, and we had such a great experience. There are so many options to choose from and it's all you can eat. We got the beef broth, miso, tomato and cabbage broths, and a number of meat and veggie selections. My favorites were kobe beef and fatty pork belly. Only downside is that the price is high, so come hungry so yoy get your money's worth!
author: Tina S.

description: Excellent dinner and service. We had a party of 6 (3 kids with us) and the waiters were very patient and helpful. Food came fast and the our three little ones enjoyed it so much. A little pricey including the kids, but a good experience for the right occasion.
author: Melissa R.

description: The 4 soup bases selection is a nice gimmick! Food consists of a large selection and service is great ! We came on a weekday night so there's no wait. The server refilled our water and soup quite frequently even though we were seated in the back.  Don't forget to write a review to get some free shave ice at the end of the meal :) !!
author: Joey K.

description:
4 stars for the food and variety of broths. They are so yummy and delicious. 

But their seating systems are very odds. Two times I had been to this place, a whole bunch of people waiting at the door. The server told us all tables were full and we had to wait 30-45 minutes. Then I figured, on my way to the restroom, I saw there is a back seating area where there are about 5-6 tables with NO Customers there. 

First time I've been there, I asked if those tables are reserved as I was coming out from the restroom, the server in the back said NO. I asked I have been waiting for 20 minutes, can we sit there? The server paused and another serve came and said something about they didn't want to open that area, but will sit us there now. I mean, I am glad they are willing to open it up for us, but wait, we waited 20 minutes!!!!! 

Second time, same situation happened with bunch of people waiting outside. After waited for 30 minutes I took a peak at their back seating area, VACANT, again!!!!! I asked the servers why no one is been seated there. The servers told me those tables were all reserved, but if we want to be seated we have to finish our meal by 8pm which left us about 1:15 minutes. Because I was starving, so I agreed. By the time we finished and paid and everything it was 8:15pm. The area was still vacant. 

Where are the reservation???????!!!!!!! Why do they like to keep customers waiting outside while there are plenty of seating area in the back????
author: Rebegi G.

description: Great buffet style hot pot! Came here for my friend's birthday party! Perfect place for group dinner.  Nice service, great food , make sure to house made fish mix!
author: Hanlin L.

description: This is first time I came to this hot pot joint. Really good experience. Great food and service. Will definitely come back again~
author: Minjie S.

description:
This place is okay; it has its pros and cons. 

PROS: Nice new interiors with comfy booths and clean tables and hot-pot setup. Great default broth selections that vary seasonally, and you get 4 of them in your hot-pot carousel (we had spicy broth, nourishing broth, pickled cabbage broth, and tomato broth). Veggies were crisp and fresh, and the presentation of all the food was great. The price was pretty good too, our bill for 2 was right around $40.

CONS: Service was not great and pretty slow, outside of the food (which arrived fast). But the real problem was the quality of the meat... we ordered the beer marinated beef and left almost all of it in the jar because it was butchered so poorly that there was silverback/hard white fat on every piece that you just can't chew or get through. We ordered the "Kobe" beef instead, and it's not real Kobe... not even close; it was also a lower quality cut of meat than we expected. 

I'd go again for a veggie only meal -- udon, cabbage, tofu, all cooked in the spicy broth and it'd probably be great. But the meat quality was low. I've been to more than a dozen hot pot places in the bay area, and this place has some of the best and cleanest decor and setup, but some of the worst meat.
author: Laura J.

description: Loved it! Great soup bases and excellent flavor. The service was good
author: Jaime J.

description:
Living in the richmond almost a year now, I've never had hot pot in my own neighborhood. Amazing service and a reasonable wait time. Sohana was super helpful and sweet and we'll definitely be back again soon bc of his great service and suggestions!

The sliced lamb shoulder, house beef, and pork belly were our faves. 

A real local gem, happy to have stopped in today.
author: S G.

description: Awesome place service is great lots of choices for soup bases and great quality of meats will definitely come back!! Sohand was excellent! Really nice staff
author: Jay O.

description: Came in about 30 minutes before closing, and DT was kind enough to let my family of 4 (including me) in. I experienced a great time here, food was delicious and DT's hospitality was excellent. Prices are affordable and are well worth your meal. Will definitely come back again!
author: Josephine J.

description: This is my favorite hot pot place in the city! Great customer service & amazing food!
author: Isis T.

description: Aye I didn't know what hotpot was aight. But this place my people...this right here is the shit. I fucks with this place. Come through one time if you a real one. The meat was lit. But on the real note. Shit was amazing. Must stop by
author: Divya A.

description: I came here with a bunch of girls on a Saturday for dinner. The pot is very special. We chose 4 different soup bases: tomato veggie, miso, spicy and pork bone. The pork bone and tomato veggie ones are really good. All the meat we ordered is fresh and very tasty. Highly recommend!!!
author: Emma W.

description: This restaurant is located in a very convenient place in Geary blvd. I ordered all you can eat meal and the meat is very fresh. They provide food to us very fast. I love this place. I will definitely come back again. This restaurant has a lot of food choices and the beef and lamb is very tender. Strongly recommend this place to everyone.
author: Bella Z.

description: Came here on a weekday to have dinner with some girlfriends and got seated right away. They have additional seating in the back which were long tables to fit lots of people! I loved that you had a choice of 4 different soups and we had the pickled cabbage (my favorite out of all of them), the spicy base, tomato base, and pork bone base. They had laminated ordering sheets which is a great way to be green, so +1! It was all you can eat for $27.95 and left super full. Service was fast and friendly too! You got to create your own dipping sauce at their sauce counter, which I found that the ponzu sauce was my favorite. Will return!
author: Amanda C.

description: I love this place! It maybe the best place in San Francisco for me. They have many type of salad veggies here, but they don't have salad sauce, I just mix them with oyster sauce. :(((
author: Leo L.

description:
Hot Pot Island 

So Hot Pot Island officially opened to the public last Wednesday, May 21, 2014.  I decided to try this place out a few days later.

Upon my entrance to the restaurant I was greeted and seated.  The Hostess / Waitress seem to have a difficult time explaining to me how this place works.  Probably because of a language difference.

Basically, this is not an "All You Can Eat" place.  So you have to go through the menu and use the special marker to mark on the menu what your order is.

To Start.... Broth is brought out and placed on stove.
You get all 4 flavors of Broth:

1.  House Spicy Special Broth
2.  Nourishing Broth
3.  Japanese Spicy Miso Broth
4.  Healthy Clear Broth

You also get 3 types of dipping sauce:

1.  Sesame Sauce
2.  Garlic Sauce
3.  Satay Sauce

Mix them or use them as you like to your taste.  You can ask for some Green Onions as I did.  

Next you select your meats and veggies:

I had selected:

1.  Lamb Marinated in Red Wine
2.  Spinach
3.  Shrimp Meat Balls
4.  Udon Noodles
5.  Half order of Tofu and Half order of Fried Tofu

Everything came out pretty fast and my meal was very delicious.  The Broth was very tasty......(Best flavor in broth before they add more soup to the broth).  

I guess they were watching over me very carefully and being very attentive to me since it's their first week in opening.

This place is highly recommended especially if you've had the Hot Pot experience before....otherwise go with a friend who has the Hot Pot experience.  The cooking technique, mixing of the dipping sauce and what you order all plays a critical roll in having an awesome meal.  

Complementing dishes and sauce is what makes your meal a great meal!!

I loved how they gave me a lot of Spinach compared to other places.

Give it a try!!
author: Alan L.

description:
Mr. J and I love hot pot, especially me!  So, when we learn about the new Hot Pot Island, we gotta go try try...

Why have two soup base when you can have four!?  The funky octangular pot is divided into four sections with "house special spicy", "nourishing broth", "Japanese spicy miso" on the outside and "tomato broth" in the middle.  These are the only four soup base they have and it comes with every pot.  The tomato broth is my favorite so far.  Their plating is very similar to the Little Sheep Mongolian Hot Pot.  Some of my favorite items (fish tofu, fried tofu sheet) even taste the same.  Although their nourishing (herbal) broth can't compare to the Little Sheep, this still could possibly be open by a veteran of Little Sheep, maybe?  The quality and the quantity of their food is probably not the greatest.  But hey, at least you don't have to pay for the dipping condiments.  Btw, this is not a place to be compared with an AYCE place.

Mr. J and I have been here twice already and I do see us coming back for another casual meal.
author: Kay Y.

description: very good hotpot.  I love hotpot and I will come here again and again.  I like the spicy soup a lot .
author: Van V.

description: Amazing place to go with a group! Great service too. Thank you for helping us celebrate the new year!
author: Rebecca M.

description:
4 soups and all you can eat hot pot! Taste amazing and the atmosphere is nice. Gives free ice cream also~ will come back next time! 

Make sure to reserve a table first, because the wait is about 1 hour long...
author: Mimi T.

description:
Racist place. Me and my boyfriend (who are not Asian) came in to eat. We were standing there and even signed in to eat. The waiter looked at us and we said "two". He looked at us and walked away. When three Asian people came in, they were seated right away. 

Very annoyed! We were clearly standing there for 5 minutes and nothing happened. When these people walked in, they were seated right away.

Bad service. Would never want to try to eat here again.
author: Mimi B.

description: Very good hotpot! I find the variety of broth flavors here to be an advantage over some other places I've tried. The service was prompt and attentive and we'll definitely be back.
author: Dave D.

description: Good quality food for all you can eat, and add $10 for all you can drink. Great service!
author: Carol T.

description: It's nice to have a variety! I love how you get 4 soup base. The service is what you expect from an AYCE restaurant. Aside from that, the food came out quick and plentiful. Would come again and recommend to friends.
author: Stephanie V.

description: AYCE for $27.50 for a good variety. Comfortable booths and attentive service. The spicy soup base needs a kick.
author: Yvonne L.

description:
Crystal and Ashley took care of our large party of 12.  Friendly and great service.

Broths surprising rich and the spicy broth surprising spicy.  American Kobe, Lamb and pork belly meats were all on point and portioned the the perfect bite size.

Many vegetables, noodles and meatball options.

Japanese sake available, Sapporo draft are all plus'.  They also have IPA and some American beers that I don't agree goes well with hot pot.  All they need is two Japanese beers on draft and they're set.

They are considering all you can eat on Tuesdays and Wednesday in the near future.  

Chinese doing hot pot, excellent - Chinese doing Shabu Shabu (Japanese) kinda whack.  Keep it real like they say, aight.
author: Kevin L.

description: Best hot pot in the city! I come here very frequently. Ayce for a good deal! The food are super fresh!
author: Ivan Y.

description: I had no idea it was unlimited! You get a choice of four different broths and the price is great! I'd definitely come again :)
author: Cyrille V.

description:
Came Friday evening at 6:00PM; which the place was already half full. By 7:30PM when we left, there was a short line waiting to dine. Ordered the all-you-can-eat for four; total roughly $170 w/ tip. Overall; the food was good and flavorful for hotpot, and what made it even better was that there is almost an entire page of fare to choose from for the AYCE.  I would come back again.


[ The "Affare" ] 
4 soups: Spicy Broth, Beef Broth, Pork Broth, Miso Broth 
- Beef Broth was very light and clean
- Pork Broth was infused with dried jujube, dried goji berry, and ginger 
- Miso Broth was a bit light on the miso taste 
- Spicy Broth was my favorite; good amount of heat without it being overbearing

Kobe Beef - Average amount of marbled fat [ 3 stars ]
Beer Marinated Beef - Tender but a lighter beef flavor [ 3.5 stars ]
Marinated Tenderloin - Smooth, but probably not tenderloin [ 3 stars ]
Premium Pork Belly - Much more lean than fat ratio [ 2.5 stars ]
Chicken Breast - ehhhhhh [ 2.5 stars ]
Shrimp - Previously frozen, peel yourself but no mushy ones [ 3 stars ]
Mussels - Previously frozen, but tasted "fresh" for frozen [ 3 stars ]
Bamboo Shoots - Whole baby stalks, nice and crispy [ 3.5 stars ]
Spinach - Just spinach, was clean [ 3 stars ]
Shitake Mushrooms - Fresh whole musrooms [ 3.5 stars ]
Mango Shaved Ice Cream - Light mango flavor, topped with popping bolba [ 3.5 stars ]
Green Tea Shaved Ice Cream - Strong green tea flavor, topped with popping bolba [ 3 stars ]

[ The Service ]
The service is what bumped this place from a 3-star to a 4-star place. The waitress was very attentive; came to check up on us whenever we needed without us having to flag her down. She kept out water glasses full and our soups stocked to the brim. As soon as we pulled out the menu to re-order, she head right over and asked if we were ready for the next round. 

[ The Setting ]
Walking you in get a strong whiff of all the broths boiling, so be prepared to have your clothes smell like food when you walk out. Despite it's smaller size, it was not feel overly crowded nor did it get too stuffy as some other Hot Pot / Shabu places get. A majority of the tables are booth style, the seats are comfy and they are also booth style seats. They also have the top-30 songs playing in the background, but just loud enough to know that its playing. The ambiance is a bit cozy, especially since the lights are slightly dimmed.

[ The Tid Bits ]
Their primary draw is the fact that you are able to chose four types of soup out of six. The all-you-can-eat is worth it for ~$27 a person if you eat as much as I do (which is quite a bit), but you can also add a all-you-can-drink option for extra $10; limited to draft beers. Over the span of 1.5hours we had the service drop off more plates of meats three times. They also have a small sauce bar with about 12-15 condiments where you can mix and match your own dipping sauce.
author: Derrick W.

description:
I came here for dinner on Tuesday, so it was AYCE! I don't think I ever get my money's worth with AYCE, but it's a nice thought that I can eat whatever I want. 

My friend and I came after working out, so we ordered a lot! The meats are really delicious here. We got the house special beef, Kobe beef, and pork belly. They were seasoned so well and had great flavor. This place also has a wide variety of vegetables! I've never seen so much offered on a hot pot menu before. And the broths are good, too. 

The only negative is the booth seats were pretty far from the tables.
author: Rachel H.

description: Boiling Hot Pot is a fabulous restaurant. The flavor is exquisitely nice. Everything is precise and correct. I rate Boiling Hot Pot five stars. Great restaurant to come and visit.
author: Anthony H.

description:
The restaurant is nice and clean. Staffs are kind and promptly respond to our need.

The food is good, especially Kobe beef.
author: Binh V.

description: First time had hot pot and it couldn't have been better. Service was excellent and food was as well. Highly enjoyed the Kobe beef and lamb. Broth was great. Would seriously recommend this restaurant. Make sure to pace yourself and be vigilant of how much you're ordering. Don't want to end up with a mountain of fish balls that nobody can finish.
author: Miguel A.

description: Great service and fresh food. A lot of soop bases to choose！You should try the Beer Beef and Kobe Beef！
author: Risa X.

description: Great spot! Sauce station! Awesome selection for AYCE! AYCD for only $10?!?! I'll definitely be back!!
author: Joyce C.

description: Had a great time with a group of 8 people here. They have two large tables for bigger groups. They were a bit slow getting us veggies, but they were really nice about it and promptly fixed it. Their lamb was especially delicious. Left very happy indeed. ^_^
author: Joel V.

description: One of the best hotpot places in the city. Great selection of soup base and meat! they serve the food really quick. we do want to try the mango n strawberry milk buy they run out, maybe next time.
author: Jessica L.

description: Great quality beef!!!! And veggies and broth is delicious; there is a sauce bar (like taco shops)! We got the kimchi , pork bone, spicy broths!
author: Annie K.

description: Came to Boiling Hot Pot with my French friends, and we had a lot of fun! Plenty of food and it is delicious :). Everyone is the cook and we all try it together! A must do!
author: Thomas L.

description:
Excellent choice of soup base and sauce bar.
I enjoyed the Kobe beef in hot soup with enoki mushrooms, lobster balls, veggies and frozen tofu. Our party of 16 had 4 boiling pots which satisfied everyone. I like how they bring the refills of food efficiently so you won't have to wait for them to slice the meat like some other buffet places.
Definitely coming back really soon!
author: SJ L.

description: Very generous servings. Great variety of meats, seafood and veggies to choose from. Soup pots have four sections so you get to choose four soups from seven for your meal. The prawns are big, fresh and juicy. Get the beer beef, lamb shoulder and Kobe beef. Plus write a Yelp review and get free shave ice for dessert. Good for large groups and hungry people.
author: Chris T.

description: Hot pot after a looong week is always awesome, but boiling hot pot is another level. You get four types of broths, your own sauce bar (be as adventurous as you want!), and copious amounts of meat, seafood, weird things, cool things, new things, etc etc. you won't regret the line, but make reservations first, it will come in handy :)
author: S H.

description: Good stuff but the wait is just so long since the place is so small and people longer since it's all you can eat. Make a reservation. Plus parking is not always so easy so maybe take a lyft. Spicy broth is good and the m broth was surprisingly great. Good selection and pretty good quality. A solid place.
author: Robert K.

description: I wish I could have come to this place much earlier. The most unique thing about this restaurant is their broth! You get to choose up to 4 different kinds of soup at a time which solved my problem because I am always confuse on what to get! Also the staffs were very helpful on explaining the sauces bar and some of the items that I have never heard about! I will come back!
author: Shuyuan W.

description:
Amazing place! Authentic soup bases and dipping sauces (seafood sauce was the best). All you can eat is a great deal too.

The frozen tofu and rice cakes were our favorites!
author: Cheng L.

description: Really good place! Amazing service! We got a reservation and they sat us and brought our food quickly. We came as a big group with short notice. We will be coming here again!
author: Ulises E.

description: I came here for dinner with my friends. The food tastes decent and the service is great. I love this place!
author: Thng B.

description: Delicious and unique soup bases. Staffs are super friendly and informative. I definitely will come back!
author: Dung T.

description: Awesome experience, u must only have a light breakfast the day u plan to come here for dinner!!! yup its a loooot of food :) great for groups.
author: Hind A.

description: Reservations for the weekend are highly recommended for the weekends as this place does get packed.  Good thing we did that!! Food was great and came out at a timely manner.  Service was also great as they did come by often and asked us if we needed anything, highly attentive.    I would say this is my go to place for hot pot!
author: Ming S.

description:
AMAZING! OK, the low down is.. 

- you get a pot with 4 divisions which offers everyone unless otherwise specified: spicy mala, house special, tomato broth (mm!), and spicy miso.
- typical (and great!) selection for seafood, meat, and veggies. everything came out in a timely manner
- sauce station!!! so fun! the challenge is putting together a dipping sauce that is good!  they should have suggestions for sauces..
- comes out to be around 37 per person including tip and tax.
author: Monica H.

description: Great food accompanied by excellent service! Fresh ingredients! Must try when you get a chance!
author: Bebe W.

description: There's still a bit they can improve on but it's probably the best hot pot place I've been to in San Francisco as of now. They have decent quality meats and really good sauces/brothers.
author: Leanne P.

description:
Excellent experience overall. Great food, very  authentic northern China style hot pot. I would certainly compare this restaurant to hot pots I have had while traveling in China. Very friendly wait staff, they have no problem helping out a beginner. 
Awesome new restaurant we would recommend it to everyone. Can't wait until they get their beer and wine license.
author: Andrew C.

description: Jessica, Pak and Mason were terrific!!! It was my little sister's birthday and they made her night wonderful. Than you guys!!
author: Dang D.

description: Very dilicious hot pot I never eat. I like the four parts of pots. Beef, lamb are particularly fresh, sauce is also very rich. I came here for many times，and I feel good every time. I always go with friends here. Thanks here！
author: Mio S.

description: try this place for the first time. good quality of meat for all you can eat restaurant. very good place for rainy day in San Francisco. Keep your soul warm.
author: Cheolsoo L.

description:
Clean fresh and good service. I would say it's a bit pricey for hot pot but the experience was overall pleasant. Cute waitresses and veggies didn't have bugs (esp watercress).

Meat looked and tasted fresh... The "Kobe beef" wasn't bad and neither was the lamb
author: B H.

description:
Came here once two weeks after their grand opening, since it was in my neighborhood and the restaurant we were planning to go had a long wait.

This place serves Chinese hot pot (Sichuan style, good for red hot stuff), they describe the history of hot pot in ancient china centuries ago and the proper way to do it on the back of their menu. The most differences to me from other shabu shabu places are: the pot is oxtangular with four default soup base, and you order individual stuff (meat, seafood, veggies, etc.) instead of a set.

We got pretty balanced amount of veggies and meats and udon, and the spicy soup base was truly red spicy. Tomato soup base was surprisingly good with even udon and was my favorite among the four.

I personally would go to other shabu shabu places if I'm in the mood for hot pot in the neighborhood, like shabu house and shabuway just three blocks away. It just saves some time to go through the big menu. It probably cost the same if not more to reach the same balanced & full level. Also those shabu shabu places have ice cream in the end, which is a big plus to me. :P
author: Jaclyn C.

description: We odered the combo and are not allowed to Oder other dishes unless we do all you can eat menu. The tomato and miso soup base are tasty but fish tofu and tofu are not fresh won't come back again....
author: Jingwen Z.

description:
I'm loving it, nice food provided, especially for the Tomato soup and fish materials, which is very fresh and delicious. In addition, service is super detail, rapid and accurate, every staff is doing their best to satisfy the customers, even the restaurant owner. I strongly recommend that everyone which lives in San Francisco should try this nice diner. 

簡單講，就是好吃，服務又好。強力推薦給大家！
author: CJ H.

description: Great food . Service is also great ! Love that all you can eat ! Fresh meat and vegetables! love this place !
author: Xin Xing H.

description: Just ate a huge amount of food here! The food is great and the servers are very friendly and accommodating. All of their ingredients are very fresh, perfectly sized, and not frozen, which makes it very easy to eat. I really love the broth, too! Spicy is wonderful and so is miso. I totally recommend Boiling! But make sure to call ahead of time or prepare for a little wait, it's very popular! I'm glad I came here over Little Sheep!
author: Monica O.

description: This is probably one of my favorite all you can eat hot pot in the bay area. The first thing that really stood out was that you can pick 4 different soups. You can also make your own sauces, which is a plus for me at any hot pot. Even though my friend and I sat in the back, the servers were attentive and friendly. They always refilled drinks and checked if we were ready for another round. The food was pretty fresh. They really listen to how much you want for each dish, the only down size was that all you can eat is about $30-35 including tip and tax. Overall, I would recommend this place if you're craving something hot/soupy. I think during the winter times, it would be a long wait since the restaurant isn't too big.
author: Tracy Y.

description: 6/5/17- came for my sis in-law bday. Food was great. Lots of selection. We tired all flavors of broth. My two favorite are kimchi  n spicy! For 10.00 extra you can have all you can drink too. If it wasn't for me having to drive back to Fresno, I would of taken that offer. We had a party of 9 and there was no rush for us to leave. Great food with great company equal great time!
author: Calina Y.

description: Great place for Hot Pot! Lots of choices and we tried a lot! All were great except for the tofu, we were not a fan of that. Loved the BEER BEEF and the quail eggs! The wooden mushroom was great too! We had four soup: Miso, Beef Bone, Kimchi, and Tomato soup. The kimchi and the tomato was flavorful. All of us enjoyed the tomato soup for sure. The pork belly was a great choice as well. Overall great experience. Would come back again.
author: jen r.

description:
I guess Hot Pot Island has converted to Hot Pot Buffet. When did this happen?? I ride the bus past this place daily and only realizing upon noticing a "Grand Opening" sign.

I think a buffet format actually works great here. Gone is the menu where you mark down your hot pot selections with a dry erase marker. Now they provide you a sheet of paper and you can check as much as you want. After turning in the initial paper, should you need more food you just verbally tell the staff. 

They still have their 5-flavor broth, which is really yummy and I'm glad they've kept that! Because it's a buffet, paying is much easier too. Bring your hungry tummies and swing on by. It's probably foggy in this part of town anyway (always hot pot weather)!
author: Jing D.

description: Nice parking nice food,the service is good. This restranut is all u can eat.pretty good deal
author: Mindy Y.

description: We had dinner with our family and I loved that there were four soups you could have at one time. Plus, there's a nice sauce station to fill up at. There was a slow moment in bringing the rest of the food but they were busy so it's all good. Would definitely come back!
author: j h.

description: Kobe beef was hot  Mason was attentive and brought out the food punctually. All the vegetables were fresh. Watch out for the spicy broth, it gets flaming!
author: Jessica J.

description: Fresh meat, beautiful presentation. Service was very attentive. We had a great time here tonight. My personal favorite was the house special beef. It was so juicy and tender.
author: Wes Z.

description: My absolute FAVE hotpot place!  The kimchi broth is soooo good and spicy! Service is always great and wait isn't too bad on weekdays. Highly recommend!!
author: Jiseon C.

description:
I have came here twice and I am probably going again next week (My sister loves hot pot so we went for her birthday and now we are going again for her graduation celebration) and I feel that this place is a hit or miss at times.

How it works: You can get four soups, three of them are already preset and then the fourth one you are allowed to choose between two options. 
You are given a list of their meats, vegetables, and sides to mark what you want with a dry erase pen. And voila~~~ you proceed to all you can eat after your food arrives.

The first time I came here I was like "Woahh this place is the bomb, all you can eat Kobe beef?!"

The Kobe beef here is very, very good by the way. I never encountered it being frozen. Please do not ever complain that they only give you like four to five pieces of Kobe beef each time you order it, you have to understand that it is really expensive and they do not want it to be wasted since they cannot redistribute it if tables leave it left over, 

I think their soup bases are O.K. They are not as flavorful as they look and I definitely have had better. But for those who like simple broths with a tiny bit of flavor, then this place may be for you! The curry soup base isn't as strong or "curry" tasting as I would like so I was a tiny bit disappointed about it.

Other than that I really like the sides and plates of meat they have, Their honeycomb tripe is bombbbbbbbbbb. It's a lot softer and fattier than the regular tripe. Kind of bummed they don't have lobster balls (orange ones) but their cuddle fish balls are good. 

Overall the food would be like a four but the thing that really gets to me is their sauce bar... I think they should make the layout of it better or what kind of containers they put it in or the kinds of serving spoons they use because everything is kinda spilled everywhere, or some sauces are spilled in other sauces. They also need to keep attentive to what needs to be refilled or wiped down. I also wish they had a separate bowl for sugar instead of putting it in a small salt shaker. The sauce bar does not look very appealing but it is a must since you do need some sauce to dip your goods in. 

The interior is really hip because the furniture is all dark and they have a projector playing and LED lights lining the walls.
author: Liane P.

description: Came here with my husband and his best friend. First of all, this is my new favorite hot pot place in SF :)!!! The service is super excellent! Our wE-Z money .. Againaiters were so attentive and super helpful. Great service and great food. We are happy people!!!
author: Em C.

description: Lovely little place for a hot pot with friends. Food is fresh drinks are fine. Service is considerate and swift in time. I'll certainly come back if I had the chance. Good
author: Zizhan F.

description: Great service and great food . I also like the wide variety of choices you can get with the meats and different broths .
author: danny h.

description: This was my first time to this establishment and i was thoroughly pleased. The servers were very friendly and understanding of the customers. The menu has many options to choose from so you don't need to worry about not finding something that you would like. The food is very delicious, but it is important that you pace yourself.
