It is also recommended that you go with a large group of people to get your moneys worth. Overall my experience at this establishment was very good. I will eat here again when I get the chance.
author: Arseniy N.

description: Came here on a Sunday night for dinner and was seated immediately. The staff is super quick and friendly. There is a sauce bar with lots of options to create your own sauce to your liking. The menu is all you can eat for $27.99 so come hungry! There are many options to choose from. You also get to choose 4 different types of soups. Overall I give it 5 stars and will return again!
author: Kristin M.

description: Disappointed by the food. Definitely not the best Hot Pot in the area. Probably better if you speak Japanese and have experience mixing your own dipping sauces. The broth flavors were mediocre. Granted, we are not familiar enough with Japanese food to know if this is authentic or not but we simply were not impressed. Kufuya on 34th and Geary was much better.
author: Austin H.

description: Everything is great except for the wait. If you come. Do yourself a favor and make a reservation.
author: Billy M.

description: Awesome service. Great food. Tons of screens for sports games. We got the complete package plus the 10 bucks for all you can drink. Cheska hooked us up with the unlimited sake and we never felt rushed. Great spot. Would come back again!
author: Frank L.

description: It's Friday night... all you can eat and all you can drink  you just can't go wrong with this place!!! Although the line was long the all you can drink started then. Long lines also mean great food  lots of options... love beef, shrimp, octopus, tons of veggies and noods... did I mention  a sauce bar?!?!!.... you can make your own Frankenstein... server "so hand"  great service
author: Susan S.

description:
This place is horrible. Will never coming back again. The service was extremely slow and dumb planing from the servers. 
It was about 9pm when they asked us if we wanted to share this big table with another group, we said we would wait so they asked other costumers if they wanted to be seated on a shared table with two pots and they said no. So it was just me and one other group.... 15-20mins later they had the whole table unoccupied and not seated knowing that there was two groups waiting to get seated. So then we (group of four) decided that we would just take the table since it was getting late, they close at 10:30 and it was like 9;30. Once we got seated they brought our soup, 8 minutes later, they brought our meat. Then I noticed that they've never brought us our napkins plates and chopsticks. So I went to the desk of waiters and asked for them and brought them to our table. All they said was sorry. This whole time we've been eating. No one even shared the table with us. We had food and plates stacked up the whole table and even piled high with emptied plates. Rarely came over to take away our empty plates. Even if there was another group were to share the table, it wouldn't even had fitted everyone. Overall the food wasn't worth the money. It didn't taste good and the second order of the beef was hard and thick. As the plates of cut beef gets worst and worst. Me and my girlfriend had a stomachache after eating from there 2-3hrs later. 

Tips for the waiters. 
#1 please be smarter next time when seating your costumers. 

#2 costumers shouldn't have to go and grab their own plates and utensils 

#3 costumer service. Don't argue with them. "Chinese ponytail girl" 

That's why you guys didn't get any tips at all.
author: Kenneth C.

description: One of my favorite Hot Pot places to come to in San Francisco. I love that you can make your own sauce and the servers here are really friendly.
author: Albertina C.

description: Probably the best hot pot place in san francisco. The soups, meat, veggies, and service are amazing. Would come here every week if I could afford it. 10/10 would recommend to anyone.
author: Darian L.

description: Came here on a Sunday night with the family. Everything was absolutely great. Service was fast and friendly and kept us fed . The food was amazing . Love how we have the option of having multiple soup broths . We are from out of town but when we come back to San Fran, we will def be back !
author: John W.

description: I was never a hot pot kinda gal. The ones I've been to in the past fell short of my expectations. Soup was bland, sauces were Meh....well my mind changed for the better once I came here. So.freaken.good. We ordered 3 different types of soups (spicy, kimchi, miso and beef broth) and a bunch of different meats and veggies. Oh man my mouth is watering just thinking of how good everything was. I love how there was a sauce station to grab whatever sauce you needed and there was a variety of food for us to eat. Good thing this place is far from me or else I'd come here weekly!
author: Samantha S.

description: Great hot pot! All you can eat is great, make sure to come on an empty stomach. Coming in the winter it can be a bit cold inside, so make sure to bring a jacket.
author: Hannah G.

description: Food is good, thinly cut meats are the best. Service is fast. But place is small and steamy. Pricey for even hot pot buffet; fish balls don't cost that much. They need to give customers bowls to eat, and not plates. And you are seeing a lot of 5 stars because that's how the customers get free ice cream
author: w m.

description: Super good food for the price.  Love the many selections of meats, seafood, tofu, veggies, etc.  Been to Zabu Zabu but believe this is even better.  Staff was helpful and friendly. They continue to bring as much as  we can eat.
author: Linh V.

description:
Not worth the hype I thought it was gonna be.

Pros:
Great broth, and good selections of vegetables.
Modern place and new.
You get to make your own sauces for your hot pot. 
4 types of broth all in one. 

Cons: 
Street parking.
Meat is too thick for my liking and can be a bit too tender. 
Service varies, the waiters seem pretty young and forget what we order sometimes. 

Can go both ways. I would only go back if I was already in San Francisco, not if I had to drive there but the broth is worth it.
author: Crystal C.

description:
Pros:
Nice environment, nice staff. Like their tomato soup which usually not seen at other hot pot place. 

Cons: amount of food too small compared to the price. Not authentic spicy hot pot
author: Danielle M.

description: This is our favorite place to go whenever we crave for hot pot. They have great selection of meat and vegetables, tasty broths, and you can also make your own sauce.
author: Eariel C.

description: Other than having to peel my shrimp this place is tops! Oh and the metal spoons should have a rubber handle or something they get so hot.
author: Luiz S.

description:
I'm a fan of hotpot on cold San Francisco nights and Hot Pot Buffet is a great place to go.  We went on a Tuesday night and it happened to be all you can eat.  It's great that they give you all 4 broths for the hotpot, instead of asking for your choice of broths.  This way you can try all the broths.  My favorites being the spicy ma la one and the basic pork bone broths.  My favorites cuts of meat were lamb and the Kobe-style beef.  I wasn't a fan of the beer beef, which is just beef floating in some beer in an unappetizing mason jar.  :(  The fish filets were were  tasty in the spicy broth.  

All the vegetables were really fresh, I like adding in napa and spinach because they go with all the broths well.  We also really liked the fish paste, fish tofu, frozen tofu, fried tofu, and wood ear mushrooms.  

Hot Pot Buffet will be my go to place for hotpot and the location is not way too out there like some of the other hotpot places in the city!
author: Wendy S.

description: This place is great, the all you can drink special is worth it. Best soup flavor is the spicy :)
author: Emily C.

description: Amazing.  Loved the selection of seafood balls! Good service. Lots of drinks. One of the best hot pot places in SF. Along with the food the waiters are mighty yummy.
author: Michael L.

description: Four soup base in every pot! Tomato soup is  good (I dig the sour taste) and pork bone are my two fav. I luv the fact that the sauce section is away from your own table so you don't make a mess on your own table. Go ahead and overindulge your sauce with cilantro, green onion and mountains of garlic. Breathe would be super smelly but it's worth it. Make sure you down couple cans of the herbal tea to take the heat out. Lots of variety of the usual choices, pretty fresh. All u can eat for about 25 bucks, not bad.
author: Vee V.

description: Right off of the bat the service here was quick and efficient. Someone will call you when they have a seat ready for you, so you don't have to worry about losing your seat to another party. This place let's you choose up to 4 different soup bases! The all-you-can-eat has a wide variety of selections to choose from. This place is well worth its price. The service is overall attentive and friendly, especially Tan!! Shoutout to Tan! I enjoyed my experience and I plan on coming again soon :-)
author: Kali B.

description: Amazing food great service I would recommend and definitely come back in the future!!!!
author: Raymond Q.

description:
I just recently discovered Chinese hot pot--I know, I know.  But now I'm addicted.  I can rack up a serious bill at Little Sheep, so I love how I can get great food for an amazing price here.

I've been here both when it's been slow, like when my fiance and I are the first ones in for dinner, and I've been here with friends when it's been busy.  And yes, it's kind of weird that they even take reservations seeing how big of a demand there is, but I disagree when people say the service is bad.  The servers are really accommodating here.

On the busy day we went:
-Since the wait was somewhat long--close to 30-40 minutes, I asked if I could order beer while I waited at the tiki looking bar.  They said yes.  Awesome!  I got beer and it was part of that $10 all you can drink beer tab
-One server (not even ours) taught my noobie friend what sauces to use and how to mix them.  She's never had hot pot, so that was nice of him!
-They constantly refilled our waters and topped of our soup
-They brought out meat quickly, and we were never waiting nor had nothing to eat while seated.
-Guy with glasses was really making an effort to joke around and be funny. He might have been the manager? I don't know.

Overall I've had a pleasant time everytime I've come here.
--
On another note: 

To the reviewer that tried coming to this place at 9:15pm when they close at 10pm.  Um, seriously who does that?!  Especially at this kind of AYCE establishment!?  It probably takes like 5 minutes+ for that soup to boil, and probably another 5 minutes to place your order.  By then the kitchen is closed. They know you're not going to be just there for "45 minutes." If you had the audacity to try to get seated at 9:15pm, you probably have the audacity to stay until 11pm.
author: Charlie A.

description: Good service free drink for first round. We will come back next time. We love the food here and we have free fruit after.
author: Feng W.

description: Great customer service. Variety of food and soup base choices. However can improve the soups base flavor to stronger tho. Lastly, the music is waaaay too loud here.
author: Cathy C.

description: First off, the men's restroom stinks like no one had cleaned it for weeks and it doesn't seem like it has enough ventilation cuz it smelled the moment I opened the door. That pretty much ruined my appetite.
author: Dio A.

description: Really enjoyable experience here. The slices were really nicely marbled for the kobe and the lamb. The broths were really tasty, especially the pork bone and spicy broth. The elder vice was speedy and attentive. It was a great first time trying the place. But as far as ayce it was really good, it would be a good recommendation for a comfy hot pot place
author: Ray L.

description: I came here for dinner with my friend and we order everything ranging from kobe beef, pork belly, lamb shoulder, corn, shrimp, octopus, mussels, pork intestines, the list goes on. The staff was really attentive and kept checking on us and they even have a sauce table where you walk up to create your own sauce. Most places just give you ponzu sauce and sesame sauce, but here, you get to create your own. The soup base consists of hot chili, herbal and a tomato-like one. For the price of ~25.00, this place is not too shabby and we'd definitely come again.
author: Eva O.

description: Very good! Love the food! Good service. I would def come back!!! The food came to our table so fast, everything is so good! I would bring my family back here and everyone I know!!!
author: Michelle L.

description: Me, my bro and my sis were looking for a place for dinner on a rainy, cold Saturday night. We decided to go here at Boiling Hot Pot and it was the best decision! Great food and the customer service is awesome! It's all you can eat! Amazing selection of flavored broths. Miso and kimchi are my favorites! Good selection of meat and veggies! Seafood option is also great for seafood lovers! My bro ate 2 plates of shrimp! Overall, I definitely recommend this place!
author: Migs D.

description: Love this place.  Great every time.  Awesome service with outstanding food.  Update.  It keeps getting better.
author: James L.

description: Came here with my family to use the groupon deal.   Apparently the groupon promotion needs 2 people or more to use the one individual $19 deal.  Anyway, i just forgot to look at the fine print.   About the food itself were good, except the chicken slices and the fish/shrimp paste.   Chicken slices were very tough.  Fish/shrimp paste tasted like eating marshmellow (no texture).   Other than that, other items were great and  the different broths were tasty.
author: D F.

description: Excellent service, great place for parties, good food. My yeh yeh loves this place a great place to gossip and catch up with your co-workers
author: Ick T.

description: I ate here with my friend Karen and we selected four soup bases：pork bone soup, spicy soup,tomato, pickled cabbage. I like tomato and pickled cabbage best~ and it's been a great experience here. And I tried a beer beef dish the first time today, highly recommend it.
author: Tian H.

description: it was really happy to eat here. the food are cheap enough for student :D   I hope everybody who has party should take part in here
author: Des D.

description: I was originally supposed to go to Ruth Chris, but at the last minute my reservation was cancelled. So my girlfriends and I decided to do Hot Pot.  I found this place via yelp and the wait was approximately 45 minutes.  This place is all you can eat, and its a Szechuan version of hot pot which is typically a spicy broth paired with Chinese seasoning.  They have a sauce bar where you can make your own dipping sauces and that was amazing.  All of the meat, seafood, and veggies was really fresh.  The service was fine, they were hysterically busy but they weren't rude at all.  We tried the miso broth, beef broth, and the spicy broth.  My favorite was the miso and spicy broth, actually I mixed the two and it was good.  Its definitely worth a try if you are ever in the area.
author: Angela V.

description: I love this place! It's worth the 75mi drive. Hands down the best hot pot I've ever had!
author: Nicole G.

description: Went back for a birthday dinner - still great food and great service!  This has become my favorite place in SF for hotpot!
author: Lyn Y.

description: I enjoyed my dining experience just wish the staff was a little more faster on refilling drinks
author: Omar D.

description: I and my ha bi bi named a mao fall in the love with Boiling Hot pot. It's supper!!!! Yamai!!!!! S+++++++++++++++++
author: Yijun C.

description:
I am here to warn those who is going to buy the groupon for Boiling Hot Pot.  

Thinking that $19 for $28 is a great deal, I bought 2 so I could enjoy with my friend.  They don't tell you until you bought the groupon where it said only 1 limit for group of 2.   You are not allow to return and cannot put comment on the groupon webpage to let people know.  I personally think that this is not the correct way to do business.
author: Josey T.

description: Lovely meal. It was an ambitious undertaking but well worth it. Prepare you taste buds accordingly.
author: Matt T.

description: This place is my favorite hotpot restaurant in SF, and i think their meat and seafood are by far the freshest ive ever had for an all you can eat hot pot restaurant. Food is great, nothing to complain about. But it's more pricy compare to other hotpot places.
author: Joyce H.

description: Loved the spicy soup base. The beef and the fish filet were particularly delicious .  Good spot to spend a leisurely meal. The extra sauces were quite an interesting  addition to the meal . Will definitely be back
author: Sanchali R.

description: This is a really good place to go with friends, goose service I would high and definitely would recommend for everyone
author: Joey Y.

description: They would do groupon once in a while so get them while its out there. It's a good place to hangout and stuff your face with meat. They have their own sauce station to make your own dip for your meat. Their pot for soup holds four different soups which surprise me the first time coming here because I haven't seen anywhere that carry four different soups in one pot.
author: Nick F.

description: Good place for groups~ 4 different base soups can fit all kinds of flavors~lots of choices from meats vegetables seafood. Snow flake is very delicious
author: Ziven P.

description: Authentic Chinese hot pot. Many flavors and just 27.75$ all you can eat. Good services. Definitely will come back again!
author: Maggie T.

description: One of the best hot pots in SF. Fresh ingredients with 4 different kinds of flavorful broth included in the EAYC. Server was attentive and friendly. I like that they have a small corner where you can prepare your own sauce. The place is small and may not be a good place for large groups or better make reservation before coming .Looking forward for my next visit.
author: Jed D.

description: This place is one of the best hotspot places - highly recommended! The meat is fresh, and the broth is good.
author: Di M.

description: This just may be the best hot pot in SF. We got there around the time that they were opening on Christmas Day, and the place was already filled. Not to worry, they let us begin our all-you-can-drink endeavor while we waited 30 minutes for a table to open up. The food was amazing, especially the beer beef. And the service was quick and friendly (not always the case at most hot pot places). Big 5 stars.
author: Dylan L.

description: Very satisfying and good quality food.
author: Scott Y.

description: Best hot pots in the city!! Love this place!! All the broths are amazing especially the beef broth!
author: Linda M.

description: Delicious soup base... excellent selection! Great service. However, the meat was pretty poor quality.
author: Betty T.

description: All you can eat had a good variety of bases and additions. They just added pumpkin which was great, but Fuzhou fish balls weren't the same as Taiwanese style. Solid food and service overall. $10 all you can drink
author: Yuni G.

description: My first time here & I loved it!  Great experience & delicious meat.  My favorite is the miso soup.  Made my own special concoction sauce to dip the meat in which topped off the flavor.
author: Julia M.

description: Amazing food. Wide variety of choices with wonderful broth. Fresh meats and the best kimchee we've ever had. Friendly staff and surprisingly large dining area. We will return and could not have been happier with our experience.
author: Helen W.

description: Best hot pot I have tried in SF! The food are so fresh and the spicy is delicious. It could be compared to some good standards back in China. Must try it if come to SF for real Chinese food.
author: Jiali Z.

description: I came here for lunch yesterday using my groupon. Although their meat isn't as soft as shabu house a few blocks away but they definitely make up for their broth, which you can pick up to 4!!! Their sauce bar is awesome too for customization. A few improvements was the service, she was nice but maybe in the beginning explain to a first timer like myself and perhaps mention the sauce bar station in the back. Also the broth towards the end got really salty, I didn't ask for more because we were just finishing up the last of our food. I wish it was a little cheaper, coming from San Diego ayce hotpot is around $20ish but I guess being in SF the price is to be expected. Other than that awesome place, can't wait to go back on another chilly day.
author: Julie C.

description: Service is incredibly quick and accommodating. The quality of the food and the wide selection of the different meats, seafood and vegetables definitely make me want to come back soon. 10/10
author: Melissa Y.

description: For $30 you get unlimited hot pot and it's SO GOOD. I'll definitely be back! Also free dessert if you write a yelp review
author: Zach W.

description: Multiple broths makes everybody happy and satisfied.  Extensive menu, fresh items, and I'm so happy they have bamboo fungus available.  I don't think I've ever seen that available at other hot pot places I've been to, so that's definitely awesome.
author: Karen L.

description: For a popular hot pot place, this was reasonably priced and if you make a reservation, the process isnt too hectic. Standouts: the spicy soup, the frozen tofu, kobe beef. Would recommend! Great for big groups of friends.
author: Brandon S.

description: Shohana was the best server during this busy Friday night. My party was smart to make a reservation and avoided the hour wait time! The space is a lot bigger than it looks; the atmosphere is very welcoming; and the food was amazing! Shohana was very attentive and quick on his feet, even after our 6th pitcher of beer and sake. Thanks for all the recommendations and accommodations!!
author: Geneve C.

description: The broth is flavourful and delicious, the quality of the meat is also good. Additionally, the veggies are fresh and they have many kinds of sauces. Had a great time overall!
author: Hans G.

description: good services，speed on the dish can be a little faster, waiting time was the be expexted. the portion of the food decewased over past visit, bit over all isvpretty great. good food and place to hang out with friends.
author: K. J.

description:
I give it 4 stars for the service and for the quality of the food. The soup was a meh to me. They give you 4 different soups, which is nice because you can get variety. I only like the spicy miso. Didn't care for the tomato, super spicy, and I think it was like an herbal one. 

You have to order by plate, but the portions are decent. The meat is fresh. They don't give you much for sauce besides ponzu and garlic. Wish they had more toppings and some hot sauce.
author: Karen H.

description: $30 all you can eat hot pot for 2 hours is a pretty good deal with a lot of options of food. The service was good. The waiters attended to us pretty quickly and time to time comes to ask if the table is doing ok. However, because there's so many hot pots going on in a small space, the air gets really clogged up by all the steam, so there may be a strong smell of everything that may stain clothes.
author: Angel N.

description:
It's good but super expensive for a Chinese place? First, the mandatory broth is $3.75 per person. It's good broth, but yeesh. For $7.50, 2 people can have an entire meal at, say, Taqueria Cancun.

Second, they don't give you very much for your money. The seafood platter has 3 squid, 3 shrimp, 3 mussels and a few hunks of fish. Total weight less than 1lb, I'm sure. For $10.99. That's a price I understand if they had to pay a chef to do something fancy to my 1/2 pound of seafood melange, but given that I'm the one cooking it, maybe that's a bit overpriced. At least it was fresh. A bowl of tendon was $4.99. Really? Don't they give that stuff away for free at the butcher because the white folks don't eat it?

Service was good, atmosphere was meh -- 3 televisions and loud clubby pop music. Not really what I consider good dining music. 

Loved: fish, beef tendon, pork dumplings, spinach, spicy broth.

Saw many tables with what looked like a paste for making your own meatballs. Looked good! You should try it and tell me how it is.
author: Diane Y.

description: Really Good All You Can Eat!! Same and even Better Food than Little sheep hotpot! But Cheaper than Little sheep! Definitely go there again!!
author: Real T.

description: Superb service. I would recommend this to my friends if they're feeling shabu. We were seated right away ! There's even a sauce station. I can make my own sauces!! If there was an option for premade sauces that would've been a plus.
author: Carla N.

description: All you can eat. Good selection.  Friendly staff.  Choice of 5 sauces and meats, seafood,vegetables and noodles.  Recommended
author: Jim B.

description: Friendly staff, fast and good service, would recommend to all my friends and family. Food tasted great! Will come back in the future!!!!! :)
author: Roy V.

description: This place was soooo good! I came with my family and friend. The service is great. They always made sure to pick up all our empty plates, refilled drinks, and take orders. The soup was delicious and my kids loved it. I wish there was one of these in my town. I will definitely come again. I can't wait.
author: Mei C.

description:
I like how they give you 4 different broths and 3 sauces. Most places only give you 2 choices. But that's about all the positives I can think of.

The portions weren't very big. It seemed like we ordered a lot of stuff, but I wasn't full by the end of the meal. Our check really added up. A small bowl of rice was $1.50 each. We ordered tea and they charged us $4.50. It was quite expensive for what it was.

Plus, I don't remember the server coming back to add soup. 

I probably won't be back. There are better hot pot places in Sunset/Richmond I rather go to.
author: Kathryn N.

description:
It's definitely improved.  More at tentative, nicer staff, I don't see them on cell phones either. The food is still to die for, but they took off their size choice option, so give a little take a little. I'm just glad they stepped it up, because this place is such a little gem. It's hard to find places like this.

Good job guys, great improvement.
author: Tiffany L.

description: I came here for lunch with my friends. I wish yelp allows me to give me a negative review. Their vegetables is not fresh. We ordered a combo, I tried a fish ball and a fish tofu. I am pretty sure those two ingredients are far gone. One of my friends tried their tofu also feel the same way as me. Definitely not worth to try this restaurant.
author: Ana K.

description:
Not "all you can eat" as it claims to be. Came here on a Friday night around 8ish. Parking is a bitch in this area. It was packed, the wait seems like forever when you're hangry.. Actually it was 45+ minutes so it was forever. 

You get a choice of 4 broths, the one in the middle you get to pick between pork and beef then the 3 around you can pick between miso, spicy, kimchi and tomato. I got pork, spicy, miso and kimchi because although my mother and I are connoisseur's of spicy food my 5 year old daughter is not.  Pork broth was not tasty. Miso was to be expected. Spicy was the only good one IMO. Kimchi could have had a stronger kimchi flavor to it.. This one was very faint. 

Average amount of items to pick from, the house special beef was good. Kobe beef, tendon, tripe, beef balls, fish balls. Barely any intriguing vegetables to pick from and very limited if you compare it to little sheep in San Mateo. The hot oil tasted more like peanuts than spicy and the garlic sauce was not as garlicky as I thought it would be.

Price was $28 per adult and $14 per kid which is BS if you have a kid that is a picky eater. All my daughter ate was egg noodles. So it's like I paid $14 for a measly plate of egg noodles for her. 

The reason why I say it's not "all you can eat" is because a hot pot buffet is different than a regular buffet. At a regular buffet you have the food already made but here it takes time to cook and to cool down. The hot pot process is pretty time consuming so you're limited by time to how much you can eat. And at $28pp I want to get my money's worth. 

I asked if I could get the rest of the soups to go. They said they don't do to go there. The waiter that understood very little English told me they don't have to go containers when I already saw some soup in a to go container on the counter of the bar in the front. Wtf? The bill for my mother and I plus my daughter came to around $80 which is over priced for the amount of food we were able to eat. Not to mention they overcharged us for a beverage we sent back. Nevertheless it is UNETHICAL to waste massive amounts of food like that. It's like I paid $80 for the food to go in the garbage. At least give it to a homeless person rather than throwing it in the garbage. NEVER AGAIN will I waste that much money on bullshit. The owner needs to rethink that stupid policy of his. I go to little sheep and never come out with an $80 bill and still come out satisfied AND I get to take the rest home. In addition their pork broth taste better than this place! 

I'm throwing up the middle finger to this place and the owners policy. Go down the block to the flame and you will spend half the amount but still come out satisfied feeling like you got your money's worth.
author: Sarah E.

description:
It was alright. I liked that you could choose four broths - they were all pretty good! The spicy one tasted great initially but got more bitter and funky after an hour or so. 

Moderate selection of meats and vegetables. The mung bean noodle was awful - you could either get super thick and fat option which was extremely extremely chewy, or the super thin vermicelli which wasn't chewy at all.

The meats were all pretty good except the pre-marinated beef was mediocre. The only truly awful thing was the house made fish mix. DO NOT GET THIS. It was like a watery sludge. The shrimp mix was decent, so go for that instead. Or the premade balls. 

My biggest complaint - The meats started out great, however as we progressed, they started giving us fattier and fattier meat. At the end, the lamb and beef slices were more fat than meat. So their AYCE is really AYCE of FAT. Blergh. 

I had a groupon, and with the discount, I might consider coming back. But without the discount, I'm rating it at 3 stars, and I am not planning to return. The price is too steep for the mediocre quality and "AYCE" that turns into unlimited fat servings.
author: Steph A.

description: Best place in SF for all you can eat hot pot. Great broth options and quality proteins. Great service also!
author: Joey H.

description: Service was excellent and the food here is splendid. The waiter that served me was super nice and helpful and would check up on us often to ask of we're okay.
author: Benjamin C.

description: Come in on a Friday night for a table for three with about 30 min wait. Price is $27.95 per person with no drink. There is a great selection of food here. Service was pretty good as well.
author: Shu Z.

description: Good quality meat, and they offer all you can eat for $28 per person, with an optional +$10 for all you can drink (sake + beer) as well. Would definitely come again!
author: Henry W.

description: Came here for their lunch special which really is the way to go. It's a flat $15.99 for however many people for 4 soups bases, all of which can accommodate a variety of tastes. I enjoyed the tomato base (in the middle) and the savory one! I got the shrimp paste and chicken slices, which all cooked fast and absorbed tons of flavor from the soups. They also gave us a few typical dipping sauces in these plastic bin/Tupperware-style containers that were a bit of a struggle to scoop from especially when you're voraciously trying to shovel food into your mouth. Oh well. The service was great; our waitress gave us some lip but for a Chinese restaurant, it's definitely more than what you'd usually get. The cherry on top, you can take all your soups and add-ons to go :)
author: Purnima G.

description: This is a very good place to share hot pot with friends. The beef is fresh and the green tea ice cream is so good
author: Qin X.

description: Very authentic ways of eating hot pot with multi-flavors soup base! Premium meat! Love the mixture of elegant & island ambiance!  :) Perfect for coming out with few friends, have some beer/sake & enjoy the yummy hot pot!!
author: Megan L.

description:
The best Chinese Hot Pot in San Francisco. There are five different soup and the tomato one is so tasty. 

Just one thing, they always forgot to serve dippings... But it's ok. People are very nice.

If you go there during busy hours, better make a reservation. Otherwise, will take forever to wait for people finish a table of food.
author: Huan L.

description: Amazing hot pot place. Servings are generous and there is a lot of variety. Everything is very tasty and fresh. We love coming here and having a change of pace from typical sit-down restaurants.
author: Ross B.

description:
I came here because there was a groupon deal. We got the spicy soup, miso, tomato, and pork.  The miso soup was very very salty towards the middle of the meal.  I like tomato the best.  Meat was good, selection of food was not bad....would be good to have some wonton and dumplings.  I wasn't a fan of the shrimp paste or the fish paste because it was just not tender or anything.  The Pot has a better shrimp and fish paste.

Overall, it's worth trying....
author: AB H.

description: finally. a hot pot restaurant that serves quality fine meat. their Kobe beef melts in your mouth. for once, lamb does not taste or smell like lamb. also, leaving us no choice for which broth we'd like to order made it all easier for everyone. 6 or 7 choices of meat, two types of tripe, super fresh shrimp with the tips of their heads cut off, quality seafood and other items. no dumplings!
author: Thao T.

description:
First time I had tried 4 soup bases at once. Liked this idea!!! +1.5 stars
Soup based ordered: Pork (w/ herbs), Tomato veggies, Northeast sour veggies, (basically cabbage), Szechuan spicy. + 1.25 stars

A bit on the pricy side for all you can eat hot pot ~ Food selection is good enough. 
Their lamb meat is good quality. + 0.75 star
Their beef is only A-OK ~ depends on which cut you got and if they slice thick or thin ~ slicing thinness quality seem to vary. One type of beef got cut real thick and super chewy upon cook... -1 star

Liked the fact that you can fix/create your own dipping sauce from the sauce bar they have there. + 1 star

Environment: looks neat and clean and the ventilation is good enough, you don't smell like hot pot when you get home the entire night. + 0.5 star

Services: Not that attentive. - 0.5 stars

Overall 3.5 stars
author: S B.

description: Great taste, great place! A bit pricey, but worth the trip. Get the miso soup broth with the beer beef and add a bit of ponzu.
author: John T.

description: It is very nice to come here for hot pot esp on chilly days. Best thing about this place is the 4 soup bases you can choose for the hot pot and the wide variety of food you can choose from!
author: Michelle Z.

description: If ratings were just for the hot pot broth, I'd give them definitely 5stars. However, service was slow and though it's all you can eat they seem to not want you to eat all you can. They take too much time to bring in the additional food items for your second round.  I got bored waiting but still wanted more. Then I didn't feel like eating anymore. I would go back to give it a second try.
author: Debbie S.

description: Definitely my favorite hot pot place in SF! Extensive menu options and great service for ayce!
author: Heather M.

description: We had a reservation for 8pm but we didn't I get a seat;( And I felt I couldn't breath in he restaurant.
author: Bowen D.

description:
First of all , the service was great . The waitress came to our table to added soup many times , and asked me many times if I needed anything . 
Spicy soup was great , and not so salty . However , miso soup & other two soups were not very tasty . My friends & I felt tooooo salty ，so we needed to keep drink water. I hope they didn't add too much salt in other soups bases . 
The beef was good quality , and I loved it .
Fish cake was very tasty , it's my favorite !
author: Anita J.

description: Our first experience at the Boiling hot pot. It's cool that we can choose 4 flavors of soup! All the foods r nice, it's a really nice hot pot place：）
author: 家溱

description: This place is amazing, my favorite hot pot place in the city. The broth is amazing esp the pork and beef bone soup. Def check it out!
author: Mick L.

description: Great all you can eat selection of meat, seafood as well as other more peculiar dishes to experiment! $10 all you can drink with generous saki servings you can't beat.  Good service and atmosphere, no wait on weekdays from our experience. Definitely try this place and worth the price!
author: Marissa E.

description: Nice place for hot pot!  Come here today and don't need to wait for a long time. The meat is high quality and the broth tastes good. The best thing is you can taste four different flavor broth at the same time. I will recommend my friends come to here.
author: Lokban K.

description: Best Chinese style hot pot in the city. Not stingy like other places, $10 all you can drink makes this place the go-to spot on a Friday night. Highly recommended.
author: Norver T.

description: Awesome hotspot place~ Delicious food~ Fresh seafood~ Great vibe there~ Love the plum juice! We invite our friends there several times and all of them love this restaurant. The sauces are good, too! You can have 4 kinds of soups at the same time, and each one of them is super delicious~ :)
author: Yingjie H.

description: My wife loves it!  Quality food at a reasonable price.
author: Brett H.

description: This place is not that big compare to other hot pot places out there but they serve the best food in San Francisco, and they have the unique pot which include four soup bases , my favorite one is the miso. I'm glad that I made a reservation otherwise the wait might be a pain. All the servers are very attentive and trying their best to satisfy everyone. The sauces bar is another interesting thing because you get to mix your own sauces!!!! They have many kinds of sauces such as sesame , ponzu , garlic...etc. I would suggest try to come a little bit early to avoid the crowd. Otherwise you might stuck in the line for a while.
author: Ma W.

description: This place is probably my favorite chinese-style hot pot in SF.  The five broth options wins it all!!! Great protein and vegetable selections and lots of dipping sauce options!!!!
author: Jes D.

description: Really high quality all you can eat hot pot. A little pricy, but well worth it for the quality and selection. Four different delicious soup bases (especially the spicy one!) and a bunch of different meats (Kobe beef and lamb were great) and seafood (shrimp and lobster balls). Don't know why it was so empty for a Sunday lunch, but as a result the service was excellent as well!
author: Jeffrey W.

description: This is probably my faviorite hot pot place in town. There are more than 50 food options for buffet style and we can choose up to 4 types of soup bases. The spicy soup base is awesome. The services here are great and the price is reasonable. We definitely will come back again.
author: Tom M.

description: I came here for the first time, and it was really great! You can eat as much as you want till you get really full. Make sure to make a reservation because it gets busy in dinner time.
author: Natsumi U.

description:
Hot pot is always my favorite Chinese food! 
The sauce they provide is flexible and you can make your own, unlike some hot pot restaurants charge you for ordering sauce! 
Fresh meet, specially like their Beef in Beer (not sure what's the name exactly), which makes the beef remain fresh(not too over cook) after some time in the pot. 
They have four types of soup for you! You can try all of them at a time! 
All dishes here are in small amount, then you can try as much as you like and reorder. 
Service here is good too.
author: Lareina Y.

description: It's a nice place!! I love the soup base and the dipping sauce.. the meats are really fresh, it also make me so hungry, and the waitress is really nice to me!! the foods come out really fast, and I really like the mango milk, they didn't put much ices on it, coming fresh and tasty.. This is the place you should come try it on!!
author: Yue Q.

description: Had a great time here. Good broth. Lots of quality meat. We got there pretty late in the evening and they were really accommodating. Will come back.
author: Rob C.

description: My favorite hot pot. 4 types of broth and make your own sauce. Now they have snow for dessert :)
author: RaeRae G.

description: All u can eat!  Good restaurant three different favor of hot pot with the fresh food. Good service. All u can eat!
author: Xu S.

description: Went here with a big group of 11 for a friend's birthday and they were very accommodating. Plenty of soup base options, good quality meat, variety of veggie options, and they are quick and easy to refill. They also have a dipping sauce bar so you can make your own! Also we didn't finish all our plates and they didn't even charge us extra. Will definitely come back here again!
author: Victoria G.

description: The food here is fresh and people are very nice here. I love this restaurant! I believe its the best hot pot in san francisco! Everyone should try it.
author: Yifan D.

description: All you can eat! Great "make your own" dipping sauces. Big plates of shrimp, sliced beef, lamb, vegatables. Cook it all yourself.  Great flavors and lots of fun!
author: John G.

description: The food was great as well as the services. A great place to have dinner with friends and will definitely come back in the future.
author: Evan J X.

description: Family loves hot pot, so gave this place a try. Very good service and food seemed very fresh and the soup choices were all flavorful!
author: Calvin C.

description: The seafood is not fresh. Same cost, go to a real Japanese shabu place right around on Clement street. Real thin cut Kobe beef.....
author: Hong S.

description:
This is a good place to enjoy hot pot.We can order anything we can eat!
So good! So many choices! Great price for fantastic food! I came on sunday night and came back two night later because I could not stop thinking about it.
Sum,I love this place.
author: Jasmine L.

description: This place isn't bad, but it isn't great either. I really like how they have 4 different broths. My favorite is the spicy one and the one in the middle. The other two were really bland and tomato-y (I hate tomatoes). We ordered the lamb, beef, egg noodles, spinach, and enoki mushrooms. Everything was pretty good and decent. My favorite thing is that they have "sa-cha" sauce and garlic sauce!!! I love garlic! Also, I ordered a watermelon juice, it was SO REFRESHING!
author: Lina C.

description: When we asked for vegetarian options, we were told they could give us "hot water" to boil our vegetables in. No other options were offered or given. I think it's absolutely ridiculous that in San Francisco there's no vegetarian or vegan options, after waiting 30 minutes we were forced to find a different restaurant because they couldn't offer a simple vegetable broth.
author: Rachel S.

description:
Came here with my girlfriend for dinner for the first time. At first the menu was a little confusing cause they made it seem like we had the ability to choose the broth but they came a minute later with four. Two of them were okay but we really enjoyed the spicy broth. 

One of the workers was too persistent. He came by to check on our table every few minutes asking if we need water. If either of us needed water it would be obvious just by looking at our glasses. We wanted to enjoy our food without being interrupted so often. 

The food was ok. We ordered the Kobe beef, and pork belly as our meat. The kobe beef was in my opinion mediocre. Bone was still attached to our kobe beef slices. How am I suppose to eat a bite sized piece of meat with an inedible bone on it?? Not acceptable. The flavor nor texture of beef would pass as kobe which was disappointing. The pork belly was better in texture, though was not as flavorful as we would think especially with half of the meat being fat, we would expect mouth-bursting flavors to follow but, again, we were not fully satisfied. They have three different ingredients you can put into your dipping sauces which were not special in anyway, bland peanut sauce, garlic and only garlic, and one I don't even remember to write about. Plus they were just sitting out on the table like ketchup which didn't seem very sanitary either. 

Overall, service was decent but since this place is fairly new I'll cut them some slack. The ambiance was new and modern, but small AND we had to ask to switch booths because the first booth we were sat at, the booth chair and table were way too spread apart (both could not be moved from their original places) and would make any dining experience awkward and more of a hassle than it should be. Food was decent. We got free coconut shave ice after our meal. Pricey, not really worth it. Well at least not yet, maybe give it a couple months to do some tuning up!
author: Neil V.

description: We've been looking for hot pot spot for a while and this place is pretty good. It was all you can eat for $25 per person. They had really good variety of meats, seafood, tofu, noodles and veggies. We liked the room in the back as our booth was pretty spacious. The service was solid. We'll be back.
author: Kevin C.

description: This year they changed their name to "Hot Pot Buffet" and under a new management. This place is now a buffet of all you can eat for $25.95 or All you can eat & drink for $35.95 and there is a time limit of 2 hours. There menu changed now since they became a buffet limiting out some of my favorite stuff bu I still gave it 4 stars because the food is fresh. The pot comes with 4 different soupbase, my favorite one is the tomato soup base. There are condiments, some sour carrots, kimchi, and fruits at a table near the kitchen for you to make your own sauce. I personally think the soup base is good enough and no extra sauce is needed for dipping. If you can't really eat spicy stuff like me then only try to dip the meat in the spicy soup and no other stuff. Atmosphere seems clean.
author: Viv T.

description: We are arrival at 10:30. pm and the manager told me that the business was take the last walk in at 10:20... Wth... Your business hour close at 11:00pm... And we are all the way down from San Jose
author: Bin T.

description:
After a year away from eating a Hotpot meal, today we took the jump and eat our first Hotpot outside China. To be honest it was a very positive experience. 
Good quality food and excellent service given complimented by a decent ambiance all for 28$pp (all you can eat). We will surely be back!
author: C S.

description: This hot pot restaurant is by far one of the best we have been to. I love how you can make your own sauces. The broth is excellent after cooking all your food.
author: Rich G.

description: First time here and the service was awesome. The host helped out with everything and explained everything on the menu. And he even brought out what he likes and it was goooooooood. Will recommend this place with friends and family.
author: Daniel F.

description: Worst service ever. Staff doesn't know their stuff/services. We waited for over an hour then finally seated then waited for another hour for food to slowly come. Food didn't even come complete!! Kept giving us wrong dishes that we didn't order. Not only that, one of the waiter told us its not buffet style tonite and ended up charging us BUFFET price for that we've only eaten 5 dishes due to their SLOW service. I won't come again nor recommend to anyone due to their poor quality of customer service. Food and soup base is good IF ONLY you can get your food correctly of what you ordered.
author: K G.

description: They've recently started doing AYCE and drink on Tuesday and Wednesday and it is AMAZING. You can pick what sauce you want in the back counter, and the beers are HUGE. We come here once a month, sometimes more. Try to come early in order to have sufficient time to stuff yourself because they start to do last call around 9:30.
author: Emily T.

description:
I cant find any better hot pot place than this one in San Francisco!!  I have been there twice and all of my friends give thumbs up.  They provided 4 different kinds of soup.  Each of them is special and tasty especially the tomato one. 

The place looks neat and well decorated.  Waitress are nice and polite. They are willing to explain to ppl who do not really know about hot pot.   The free ice cream is so sweet and girls always like it. The sauces can be customized from 4 different ones for free. I really enjoyed the meal and I m gonna be back a lot i guess. lol 

The only concern is you have to make reservations during busy hours.  I will recommend this for 5 stars.  It is definitely worth a shot.
author: Eric Z.

description: The quality of food is good! The broth is good! But the "very spicy" is not spicy to me. But some of waiters make me lower the star. Many people pill in the back and only one person serving. The vege came extremely slow.
author: Cherlyn H.

description: Went there on Thursday with my husband because we both love all you can eat buffets. We had a great time! The ambiance was great and the food was just spectacular, it was probably better than expected by the two of us. The place isn't too far away from our home, making it a convenient spot for us. We had a sickening amount of food because it was that good that we just couldn't stop. The broth and Kobe style beef were great, they had four kinds of broth and we tried all of them. They were super tasty and spicy. I like their fish tofu, super tasty!! The staff was very nice and helpful. All the ingredients were fresh (at least they seemed to be fresh) and the vegetables were just beautiful. Definitely coming back for more.
author: Vicky N.

description: Nothing special. Not bad. Soup bases are just okay. The spicy one is not spicy at all.....
author: Elle L.

description: First time here, the broth is really great. I love the tomato one. The food is fresh. Fatty beef is my favorite, the Kobe beef is not bad. The free green tea ice cream is cool. I will come back again! But the waiting line is too long. It is sad they don't take reservation for two!
author: Miya L.

description: The 4-soup hot pot is the highlight of the hot pot place! I like the new soup base, pickle cabbage best! They are using the homemade pickle cabbage to make this soup, which is incredibly good! If u feel the soup is not sour enough, they can just help you add more sour into it! One of my favorite  restaurants!
author: Joanna T.

description: The hot pot was fun here but the place was small. There are 4 kinds of soups in the pot and they charge $3 something per person which was surprising. The meat overall was tasty. The watermelon juice was refreshing. The dessert was this shaved snow which was not good at all. The price was quite high but comparable to other hot pot places like little Mongolian sheep. Too bad they didn't have an all you can eat option.
author: Jennie W.

description: Premium meat! authentic taste of food! :) love their multi flavor soup base. It`s good to have few friends to gather to enjoy the food & environment. They will offer soft drinks & happy hours soon, will definitely come back with my friends!
author: Tina H.

description: The soup base was really good and there are variety too from herb to spicy. There was not much need for dipping sauce since the soup's taste sticks to the food. The food was fresh. I thought the way of ordering was unique but can be easily missed like one of our plate. We marked we wanted one plate of pork belly but we didnt get it until we ask for it again and they charged us twice. Also one of the female server had an attitude. When we were ordering, she said 'that that's a lot' sounding let we were not going to pay for it if we dont finish. I understand that tone if it was an all you can eat but it was not. She could have said it in a different tone.
author: Edna L.

description: Food was good but the service was awful. Had to wait 10 minutes before we got menus. Then we waited another 15 minutes to order. Food was served sporadically. We had to ask for forks 3 times before they brought it. We won't  be back.
author: Joy C.

description:
Yup. This place is expensive. The price is about twice more than regular hot pot places in the neighbourhood. The food however is outstanding. All the 4 broths were really, really flavorful (except Miso is kinda blah compared to the rest) The meat quality is higher than other places nearby.  The service was great.

One star down because I don't think the price is worth it. I'll go back on a good day but not so soon. Also another star down for the most uncomfortable seats I ever come across!
author: Bobo V.

description:
If I can give a zero I would definitely do it!!!! 
Before me and my husband came, we already know they close at 10. When we walk in, it was at 9:15 pm while the open sign will up. 
The first sever saw us from the back with a doubted look in his face. He went to talk to another female sever for like 30 second before he came up to us. Here are the conversation :
Male sever :arr... We are closing.
Me: don't you guys close at 10 pm?
Sever: but our kitchen close at 9:30. 
Me: it's 9:15 now
Sever: ah.......
Then he went back and talk to the same female sever. 30 sec later, she came up and ask: how many ppl?
Me: 2
Sever: I'm sorry we are closing, last order at 9:30
Me: it's 9:15 now, so u are not seating us?
Server: yeah last order at 9:30 and people leave At 10pm
I was really angry coz when we walk in , the open sign is on, yelp says they close at 10pm
I don't see why they won't seat us at 9:15
This place for sure doesn't have a ANY service and the owner should reconsider their closing time so ppl like me won't be confused!!!!!
Bad place!!! Will Never come back and will tell all of my friend not to come!!!!!!!
People don't come here!!! They don't know how to do business!!!!!
author: Yan A.

description:
Such a great hot pot restaurant for either family party or friend's invitation. 
I had been here last week with my family, and I found out that they has many creative idea on the sauces and also the broth. Here is how it looks like:
They provides 4 different tasty broth within one pot, and 3 different kind of sauces (and they are free, some places take charge on the dipping sauces). Once you finish ordering the pot, then you could start to read out the menu and order whatever you like to eat. 
Unfortunately, I didn't take photo of the foods, but I have to tell that the foods was really looks wonderful and tasty. Me and my family feels really full after it, and they provides free ice cream ( like a sample bowl of the snow flake).
Really like this restaurant, and I will recommend y'all to come and try it out.
author: Jimmy Z.

description: i will never come back to this place again cuz the chinese waitress working there is rude. we ordered 1 egg noodle and lamb, but they didn't bring out. they final charge us for 2 order without serving us. we requested to cancelled it cuz they didnt serve those 2 item. she said to us that receipt is printed, so we have to pay for it. we decided to call someone else to talk with us, and they cancelled it for us. bad service and impolite waitress ever.
author: Cuoi L.

description: even they've changed their hours to close at 10:30pm.make sure that you walk in before 9:30pm.waitress and those ppl working at the kitchen just too lazy to serve.they need complete one hour to clean up .they don't serve anyone after 9:31 pm!!!!! They really need to change their hours to 9:30pm or simply let ppl know that they actually close at that time even the sign says " open"!!!!
author: Butterfaylc C.

description: nice place, foods r gd, service is excellent,,but waiting time is a little bit long,,
author: Allen C.

description:
I will never come back to this place again. The waitress here is very rude and uncommunicable.

 I order a napa and a watercrast.  they give us a lettuce instead of the watercrast. But this was totally fine with me. Cuz I like both. Later on we want to add a napa and watercrast. We told the wariness that they delivered the wrong thing the first time, however we will take the lettuce too. Then the wariness carry a really negative attitude and give us a look. She don't even let me finish my words. She just keep repeatting:"I saw two vege on the table."   Then i realized that she don't speak English very well. Ok, maybe she just misunderstood me. then she started using  her native language to talk to us. She told us she is absolutely sure there is a watercrast on our table. OMG. Do u think don't know what I am eating? we already said that we will pay for the wrong one you have delivered.  What else you want us to?  Later she bring us a watercrast finally and throw it on our table without saying anything...Girl, if you can't handle customer complains.  Then you should not be in this position.  I am not going to pay you to ruin my dinner again.
author: MQ W.

description: This place is solid.  Love the variety of broth available.  Meat is fresh, service is good.
author: Alex E.
